posts.title: SF Beer Week Opening Gala
posts.description:
The SF Beer Week Opening Gala is the largest, most anticipated, and prestigious annual gathering of the Northern California craft beer community. It’s the kick off party for SF Beer Week, commencing a multi-day marathon of beer dinners, tastings, tap takeovers and educational events that occur all over the Bay Area.

*** Over 350 beer flowing ***
See the list at "GALA" in the menu above (more to come!)

*** 125 Breweries pouring ***
Click on the ticket link to see the list

*** New this year ***

Bay Area Brewer Talks -- Co-presented with the San Francisco Chronicle and SFGATE, brewers will take the stage to share stories, talk ingredients and styles, and take stock of a changing craft beer landscape.

Featuring: Admiral Maltings, Armistice Brewing, Drake's Brewing Co., Mad Fritz Brewing, Humble Sea Brewing, The Rare Barrel.

* Open to all Opening Gala attendees. *

posts.title: Bear Republic Tap Takeover
posts.description: To kick off beer week this year, we'll be having 20 taps pouring from our friends at Bear Republic. Flights available. Lets get way beyond racer!

posts.title: Wake & Break(fast)
posts.description: Let's kick off Beer Week 2018 with Breakfast! We'll be offering special foods to pair with a growing line-up of hearty breakfast & coffee beers in a variety of styles. It's always our most popular event of the year so don't miss it!

posts.title: Fort Point Ferry Building Special Release
posts.description:
Fort Point is excited to release a lineup of brand new beers, just for Beer Week! Visit our Ferry Building location for the first chance to try these four specialty beers. To help us celebrate, we'll be joined by our friends and neighbors at Humphry Slocombe who will be scooping a special Westfalia-infused ice cream.

Mosaic Park: A lush and juicy deviation from the bright citrus flavors in the original Park.

Clarion Lager: A Vienna-style lager brewed in collaboration with fellow Brewers Guild members Almanac, Standard Deviant, Old Bus Tavern, Southern Pacific, Southpaw, and Woods Cerveceria.

posts.title: Beer for Breakfast w. Track 7
posts.description: Beer for Breakfast? Sounds even better when you have beers like Strudel Berry Kettle Sour and Second Breakfast from Track 7 on tap! We'll have a Brunch Special TBA and will also be pouring Bloomer's Cut and Hop Addict DIPA. Beers will be on all-day; brunch special until 3pm.

posts.title: The Dark Flight of the Soul
posts.description:
Our brunch is amazing, if you didn't know already. This year for the first weekend of SFBW we will be featuring flights of dark beer to pair with our stellar menu.

Since we are ending Beer Week with a DJ (see Fruity Rebels Hoedown on 2/18), we thought it would be fun to kick off the week with some tunes. Our pal DJ Dennis Yadroff will be here selecting and spinning fashionable beats and melodies for your ears to feast on while your mouth feasts on brunch and beers.

If you ever needed a reservation, it is highly recommended during this service for guaranteed seating times. You can always go through OpenTable or call us directly.

BEER GEEK BRUNCH

posts.title: Local Hospitality Coffee Hour
posts.description: Come join us after the SF Beer Week Gala for coffee hour sponsored by Pine Street Brewery. The Family Room SF will be hosting all customers and beer vendors for a free cup of black coffee or tea. Allow us to show you the unique neighborhood where Pine Street Brewery was born. Meet locals, see art, and people watch as you recover with a cup of our delicious pour over coffee, cold brew, or tea.

posts.title: United Sours of America, An American Sour/Funk Fest
posts.description: Celebration of American sours. About 20 taps will be filled with sours from American breweries. Also available will be glass pours from the bottle, and a killer vintage list.  We will open an hour early (11am) for this event.

posts.title: Blind Barrel-Aged Beer Takeover
posts.description: Join us for 2 days of a unique event to blindly taste some of the best barrel-aged beers in the country!  Flights will be available.  Consumers can vote for their favorites.  Beers to be revealed Sunday evening at 7pm as well as the top vote-getters.

posts.title: Flights & Bites with 21st Amendment
posts.description:
Pairing three Library beers from 21st Amendment with three bites! You'll find the following on tap:

El Camino (barrel-aged strong)
Kriek Forte (belgium strong with cherries)
Great Things (belgium tripel)
Baby House (belgium quad)

Come and see what kind of "bites" we pair these special releases with!

posts.title: 17th Double IPA Festival
posts.description: The original kickoff to SF Beer Week, over 60 Double and 30 Triple IPAs on tap. A professional competition with awards ceremony at 3 pm. Live music on 2 stages, Cheese tastings, grilled sausages and Frickles.

posts.title: Tasting the National League West
posts.description: No doubt about it, the NL West is far and away the best conference for great beers. To celebrate the upcoming 2018 SF Giants season, we will line up some of our favorites from the Divisions 5 members. San Francisco, San Diego, Colorado, Los Angeles and Arizona. Maybe even a wild card? There are no losers in this one. AT&T will be open for Fanfest so come get ready for baseball with a day of great beer and food at Public House. Line up TBD

posts.title: Brew It Yourself: Beer Making at Home
posts.description: Have you ever tasted a beer and said, I could probably make that? Take our Brew It Yourself: Beer Making at Home class and you’ll realize how true that is. This is SF's only class where you get to learn from a professional brewer and take home beer YOU made! You’ll get your hands dirty on one of our brewing rigs, and after this two-part class, you’ll walk away with a case of beer that YOU BREWED. We'll make special STRONG beers for SF Beer Week and Strong Beer Month!

posts.title: Barrel Aged Beer Party and Special Release
posts.description: Join us for our best and booziest SF Beer Week tradition – Barrel Aged Beer Party! We’ll be tapping select, out-of-print barrel-aged beers as well as the highly coveted collaboration with Dogfish Head Brewery Life and Limb.

posts.title: Doom Bloom Triple IPA Release Party
posts.description:
We released our Triple IPA, Doom Bloom, for the first time last year and ran out in less than 6 hours! We've decided to bring it back as an annual cameo.

Using the wild Prickly Pear fruit blooming from cactus plants on the cliffs overlooking our brewery, we created a hazy, New England-style Triple IPA. It's as dangerously delicious as the journey up the cliffs required to reach the precious fruit. Don't miss this once per year Triple IPA treat!

posts.title: Green Flash & Alpine Flight Fest
posts.description: Come enjoy a seven beer flight of Green Flash and Alpine beers or a half pint. Also, we will be pouring a  Blanc Tarte Sour Saison from Cellar 3.

posts.title: Beers and Brats Special Release Party
posts.description:
Come join us for the special release of our Double Standard double IPA! We only release this beer once a year during beer week. Originally brewed to commemorate our 15th Anniversary, it has a very aggressive hop profile that you would expect from the style, and an equally pungent hop aroma, but is remarkably smooth.
In addition to the special beer release, we're going to make it a party! We will be doing a throwback to our old $2.50 Tuesdays by offering $2.50 brats from 11:30am until 4:00pm.
Come drink some amazing beer and get a brat or two!

posts.title: Love Dogpatch - Collaboration Beer Release & Valentine Sale
posts.description:
It's hard for us to admit but Beer Week's not the only thing going on this week. Dogpatch is throwing one of its legendary neighborhood sales on Saturday, 2/10, (un)coincidently the same day the Dogpatch breweries' SF Beer Week collaboration beers are released.

The Beer: Not content to leave well enough alone and brew one neighborhood collaboration beer (like we did last year), the breweries of Dogpatch decided to brew three different expressions of our collective vision, one at each brewery. Harmonic, Triple Voodoo and Magnolia each brewed a beer using locally-made Admiral Malt and cannabis terpenes. The rest was up to each brewery to choose their own adventure.

Magnolia brewed an IPA following these guidelines and it will be tapped when we open today at 11:30am. We'll be filling growlers of this new beer all day—a rarity for limited release beers like this one.

The Party: Meanwhile, Dogpatch is throwing itself a party with pop-ups, raffles and make-your-own-Valentine stations throughout the hood. Smokestack is hosting 14 pop-ups of local makers in our loading dock.

It's the perfect day to explore Dogpatch, visit all three neighborhood breweries, and try all three of these highly experimental SF Beer Week collaboration beers the day they come out.

posts.title: Sweet Treat Saturday ft. Big Bad Baptist Imperial Stout
posts.description:
On February 10, we'll be bringing in two kegs from Epic Brewing Company. We are honored to bring you the rare Big Bad Baptist, Imperial Stout, bourbon barrel-aged, made with coffee and cacao nibs. We'll also be offering an Epic Brewing Company favorite, Lil' Brainless on Raspberries.

Additionally, Executive Chef Matthew Dolan has created the perfect dessert pairing to compliment these unique beers. Stop by to enjoy these beers or pair them with this special dessert. We recom

posts.title: Modern Times Tap Takeover
posts.description: Focus on aroma-driven, complex, flavorful, sessionish beers. Often brew hybrid styles, combining the features from established categories to create new, Island-Of-Doctor-Moreau-style mash-ups.

posts.title: Uptown Beer Walk | Oakland
posts.description:
Uptown has been touted as the arts and entertainment district and is one of the hottest neighborhoods in Oakland. It also happens to have great beer!

On this unique walking tour experience, you will taste delicious microbrews and enjoy lunch in a hidden beer garden. As you journey to the different breweries, you will visit landmarks and listen to tales about ales and a shining town history.

Here's what is included on this walking tour:
​​
- Delicious lunch made from high quality and healthy ingredients along with your choice of a pint of craft beer in a wonderful beer garden.

- All of your beer tastings at nearby local microbreweries where you can enjoy specialty brews.

- Learn about several historical landmarks in this district - past and present.

- Beer education and history from your friendly and knowledgeable guide.

- Gratuity for all of your beer and food servers (does not include gratuity for your guide).
​
Duration: 3.5 hours
Distance: 0.5 miles; easy and flat.
Maximum 10 participants

Meeting location:
In front of the Paramount Theater at 2025 Broadway, Oakland, CA 94612

2 blocks from 19th Street BART station. Street parking has a 2-hour limit. There are a few parking garages. Whole Brew World does not condone drunk driving.

The tour ends at the Latham Square Plaza fountain.

All participants must be at least 21 years old. ID's are required. Advanced reservations are required. To learn more and to book online visit www.wholebrewworld.com/uptown-beer-walk

posts.title: Mister Stout: Special Release
posts.description:
It’s Mister to you, pal! We’re kicking off an incredible lineup of San Francisco Beer Week events with the gnarliest, most brutality delicious barrel-aged flight known to Berkeley craft beer, truly any dark brew lover’s dream.

Join us February 10, starting at 11:30am, to witness the unveiling of Mister Stout, 2018. This massive Imperial Stout is an all-inclusive drinking experience, packed with malty, roasty awesomeness, and perfectly balanced. It’s fresher than fresh and not to be missed!

In addition to this new beast of a brew, we’re serving a flight through time of barrel aged Mister Stout (2015), barrel aged Mister Stout (2016) and the joining of forces for 2017/2018 Mister Stout Blend.

Entry is free, beer costs money. Must be 21+ to purchase and consume alcohol. Check out our full calendar of events at http://www.triplerock.com/calendar/

posts.title: Beer Brunch
posts.description:
It's beer week and we got what you need to start the day with your best foot forward; Beer Brunch!

Our amazing brunch-only chef Becca will be cooking up the goods including a 48 hour semolina pancake that will knock your socks off, and her tasty Shakshuka among a bunch of other offerings.

We'll have a great lineup of our own beers plus the best gosh darn bloody mary you've ever had made our infamous bartender Janio.

Full menu here:
https://www.socialkitchenandbrewery.com/

posts.title: Dogpatch Collaboration Beer Release Party
posts.description:
Harmonic Brewing, Magnolia Brewing and Triple Voodoo got together over (more than a few) beers and decided we needed to make a beer together. All three breweries were around for all three brews, and we all have our own interpretation of the style guidelines. The guidelines are simple: we must use Admiral Maltings malt in the grain bill, and we must use cannabis derived terpenes as well!

Come on out to the Dogpatch for the release of our saison featuring Admiral'a malts and cannabis terpenes. Limited amount of cans will be available to go, yes to growlers! We will also have live music and a killer pop up to celebrate the neighborly love.

Food: Good To Eat Dumplings 2pm-8pm
Music: Fogbank Jazz Band 7pm-10pm

posts.title: Beer Immersions to Belgium & Germany - A Taste of Things to Come
posts.description:
Travel to Belgium and Germany in 2 hours, while previewing Rich Higgins' Beer Immersions travel in Mikkeller Bar's amazing Sour Room! Amazing event for only $25.

Beer Immersions are incredible, educational beer tourism developed and led by brewmaster and Master Cicerone Rich Higgins. Explore classic European beer cultures by way of breweries, restaurants, pubs, other beery sites. You’ll feel like a local after he takes you to all his favorite beer spots.

At this exciting preview event, you'll enjoy:
- multiple pours of 6 amazing, archetypal Belgian and German beers from breweries you'll visit on the Immersions
- 2-course pairing of savory and sweet classics with beer (snack portions)
- Q&A panel with Bay Area professional brewers
- blind beer tasting with prizes
- Beer Immersions slideshow
- mini-seminar on what those weird Flemish, French, and German beer words mean and how to actually pronounce them, with recordings from European brewers
- beer trivia quiz with prizes
- time to chill out and socialize with friends and beer
- finish with coffee and pastry

Benchmark Beers:
- Andechser Kloster Doppelbock Dunkel (from Munich Immersion)
- Weihenstephaner Original (from Munich Immersion)
- Weltenburger Kloster Barock Dunkel (from Regensburg Immersion)
- Schneider Aventinus (from Regensburg Immersion)
- Oud Beersel Oude Geuze (from Brussels Immersion)
- Westmalle Dubbel (from Antwerp Immersion)

Fantastic food from Chef Laurance Gordon, Mikkeller Bar SF:
- witloof gratin
- kaiserschamrrn
(small-plate portions)

* exact beers and dishes subject to change

"A fascinating deep dive into historical beer styles with a backstage pass to the breweries that defined them." -- Erik G., Manchester, UK

"We have been to Brussels before and this was far and away a much better beer experience." -- Curt G., San Francisco, CA

http://richhiggins.com/beer-immersions-travel/preview

posts.title: Seismic Brewing – Entropy IIPA Release Party & Tap Takeover
posts.description:
The new kids from Sonoma County, Seismic Brewing Company, will release their 1st Imperial IPA (Entropy) during SF Beer Week. Come meet the brewing team and be among the first to try this Limited Release and several other great Seismic Beers at Devil's Slide.

Entropy Imperial IPA is malty, hoppy, aromatic, robust, and hedonistic.  Featuring two different rye malts and a healthy dose of rich Vienna malt, the full bodied monster does not disappoint.  Caramel and peppery rye flavors create a strong background to the hops, which are classically reminiscent of pine and citrus - with a sneaky addition of Nelson Sauvin hops to keep things interesting.  At a bracing 75 IBU and 8.5% ABV, this winter warmer aims to satisfy hop heads and malt lovers alike.  This is the Imperial IPA your mother warned you about.

posts.title: Clandestine Brewing Grand Opening
posts.description:
At long last, Clandestine is having our grand opening! We will be having special events that day including a ribbon cutting ceremony with the City of San Jose and limited release beers as well as a food truck. We will also be having prize give-aways throughout the day including a grand prize of a membership into our exclusive Secret Agent growler club. But, prizes are only for those present.

We are extending our hours until 10 pm. Come join us!

posts.title: Saturday Social with Make a Wish + Cherry Red Release
posts.description:
Saturday Socials are our way of giving back to the community that so enthusiastically supports us. On the second Saturday of every month, we'll join forces with a local non-profit organization to raise both funds and awareness for their efforts to make the Bay Area a better place. For this special Beer Week Saturday Social, we’re the Greater Bay Area chapter of Make-A-Wish will join us for great beers and a great cause.

And speaking of great beers, this Saturday Social will also mark the release of one of our best loved barrel-aged brews: Cherry Red. This Flanders Red-inspired tart ale has spent the past year aging in wine barrels with--wait for it--cherries. It’s rich and tart with a touch of characteristic Belgian funk. Try this year’s batch on draft, or squirrel away a couple bottles for your cellar!

Canasta Kitchen will be on site serving up tasty snacks. Dogs, children, and well-behaved adults are all welcome!

posts.title: Triple IPA Release Party
posts.description:
We will be releasing two new beers just for SFBW 2018. The first is our new 10.5% ABV Triple IPA that will have hops added in the mash, using a hop back, at every stage during the boil, and then dry hopped to create a very pronounced hop profile. All hops used are sourced from the 2018 crop to be fresh as possible.

We will also be releasing the beer we brewed as part of our dogpatch brewery collaboration. Unlike other collaborations where brewers convene to develop a single recipe and brew it at one brewery we have decided on a different approach. All of the three breweries have agreed to use certain common ingredients and each brew a beer using these ingredients that represent each breweries individual style. The result is going to be three very unique beers sharing these common ingredients. Our contribution will be an Extra Pale Ale using locally sourced malt from Admiral Maltings in Alameda and Terpenes provided by our friends at Chemistry in Oakland.

Our Friends from Slow and Oak BBQ will be joining us to serve up the BBQ goodness starting at 2pm.

posts.title: It's Our 4th Anniversary Celebration
posts.description:
We're having our 4th anniversary and we want you to come celebrate with us! Saturday, February 10, is the day and we'll be having fun from noon-9 pm.

Four new beers will be on tap plus we'll have 3 firkins full of wonderful surprises! Joining the fun is S&K Wings food truck but thats not all! From noon- 3 pm Better Days will be playing once again (a 4 year repeat). Then we're welcoming back Heartstone who will be rocking the house from 5:30-8:30 pm!

Now all we need is you! Grab your friends and family (yes we're a family friendly spot and dogs too!) and come have some fun with us! Share this with everyone you know. No Cover!

posts.title: Alum Rock Double IPA Can Release
posts.description:
Alum Rock NEDIPA is back! Help us celebrate SF Beerweek Saturday, February 10th with the release of Alum Rock on draft and in 16oz cans! If you haven't had it yet, this juicy, hazy double IPA features tropical fruit notes complimented by citrus like hop-flavors and aroma. Get this limited edition brew while it lasts and celebrate local beer!

Our good friends from Emergency BBQ Company will be here with everything from Ribs to Tri-Tip, Mac-N-Cheese to their fantastic Slow Smoked Pulled Pork! If you have a craving for delicious hunger-quenching BBQ & beer, we've got you covered!

posts.title: Smokey Soiree - SFBW East Bay Collaboration Beer Release Party
posts.description: The East Bay breweries collaborated on a special beer for SFBW, and we developed an amazing smoked coffee porter called "Smoke & Coffee Break", brewed by Shadow Puppet Brewing Company.  We will be celebrating the release of this official SF Beer Week East Bay Collaboration beer in our tasting room with our friends at South Smokin' BBQ for a day-long party of amazing beer & BBQ, including a special freshly smoked salmon and unique BBQ made with the Smoke & Coffee Break beer.

posts.title: Limited Edition CBD Beer Release
posts.description: We've created a special edition CBD beer just for beer week! Enjoy this limited edition release all day long, not available anywhere else. We're also featuring an acoustic performance from 3-6pm.

posts.title: Smoothie Brews & Fruity Sours: Tropical Tap Takeover
posts.description: A tart, tingly taste of the tropics: three different house-made sours, each one its own fruit basket of flavor. Try them all and earn a special island-hopper badge of honor!

posts.title: Barrel Aged Beer Release
posts.description:
What would beer week be without the release of some delicious, barrel-aged beers?

So far the lineup is...
2018 Precious Cargo - Whiskey Barrel Aged Imperial Porter
2018 Red Vicar - Red Wine Barrel Aged Belgian Quad
2018 Date With The Devil- Whiskey Barrel Aged Belgian Quad
2018 Collaboration with Libertine - Wine Barrel Aged Sour w/ Pluots
2017 Devil's Hoard - Whiskey Barrel Aged Imperial Stout
2017 Peach Pulpit - Chardonnay Barrel Aged Belgian Tripel

With limited quantities in mind, we are offering a small amount of VIP tickets for a flight of 5 before we make them available to the public and a glass to take home. This is the only guaranteed way to try them all, so grab yours today!

If presale isn't your style whatever is left will be available to the public from 2pm onward. Get here early if you can since these beers will go quick.

Cheers!

posts.title: Barrel Constrictor Tap Takeover & Bottle Release
posts.description:
Are you into bourbon?

Are you into imperial stout?

Are you into sexy glass bottles full of bourbon barrel aged imperial stout?

If you answered yes to any of these questions this event is undoubtedly your cup of tea... or pint of beer whatever floats your rubber duck.

Barrel Constrictor is our most celebrated release of the year and lucky for both of us it is happens twice a year!

This coming SF Beer Week we have a real treat as well. Jeroboams! 3L of 13% abv bottled up and will be available for purchase on February 10th at noon. CANNOT STRESS ENOUGH how limited these babies are. Literally.. they are heavier than your newborn.

Along side the behemoth 3L will be our standard 375ml bottles to go with 8 different variants on tap!

Here are the variants:

2017 Vanilla Rye (bottles & draft)

2017 Caribbean Rum (bottles and draft)

2016 Vanilla Bourbon (Single Barrel Four Roses)

2016 Brandy (Old World Spirits)

2017 Bourbon (Buffalo Trace)

2017 Bourbon Style Rye (Redemption Rye)

2017 Coffee Barrel Constrictor

2017 Double Barrel Constrictor

See you February 10th!
Cheers!

posts.title: Lucky 13 / Fieldwork Brew Co Dog Day Afternoon
posts.description:
For the 6th consecutive year, First Saturday goes to the dogs.

Lucky 13 and Fieldwork Brewing Company are partnering up to benefit Rocket Dog Rescue.
This might be the last one, due to the plans to build condos at the side of the Lucky13. Do not miss this ONE!

Join us for five special beers. Bring your pooch for a pint, or come meet your future best friend at our on-side adoption fair.

Commemorative bandanas for all four-legged attendants while supplies last.

Woof and Cheers!

posts.title: Drake's Hopocalypse Day // Local Color Artist Expo
posts.description:
Join us as we kick off San Francisco Beer Week 2018 with our good friends at the one and only Drake's! We will be featuring this year's amazing renditions of the infamous Hopocalypse beers and a slew of others to round out the event. Eric Ortega will also be in the house with other members of the Drake's team as well to talk with you about these awesome new releases.

We will also be displaying a brand new art series made specifically for Original Gravity by our righteous neighbors at Local Color with each artist contributing a different piece to adorn our walls. These pieces will be beer themed, for sale and limited to one of a kind!

There will be killer food specials TBA as well to keep you going throughout the day, see you there!

- Pouring -

Flyway Pils - Pilsner
1500 - Dry Hopped Pale Ale
Drake's Amber - Amber Ale
Bourbon Barrel Drakonic - Bourbon Barrel aged Imperial Stout
Cherryland - Barrel aged Sour Ale w/ Cherries
Hop Black - Triple IPA
Hop Green - Double IPA
Hop White - Double White IPA
Rye Robustito - Rye Whiskey Barrel aged Porter
Tiberius - Barelywine

* List Subject to Change at Any Time

posts.title: Imperial Smoked Coffee Porter – Release Party
posts.description:
Release day party for our version of an Imperial Smoked Coffee Porter- which is infused with Peet's Cold Brew Coffee!

BBQ Truck 2 Legit 2 Pit onsite smoking up meat using a special smoked porter bbq sauce.

Peet's cold-brewed coffee puts an indisputable East Bay stamp on this smoky, robust, chocolate-tinged coffee porter.

posts.title: Sour Saturday
posts.description:
Join us at Calicraft for our 5th Sour Saturday! Sour Saturday is our ode to sour and funky beers - we have one every quarter.

However this one is extra special for SFBW! To celebrate we will have 12 sour draft handles all day. The sours will include a few of our new releases, as well as some unreleased projects and rare/vintage beers. All of these are coming out of our barrel project sour beer program.

We will have special curated flight options as well as sour by the glass. We are breaking out some of our vintage sour bottles as well - so come prepared to stock up the cellar.

Of course there will be a selection of non sour beers as well (including Karl the Foggier, our SFBW Double IPA). There will also be food trucks serving up food all day.

Admission is free, so join us and celebrate SF Beer Week in Sour Style!

posts.title: Fourth Anniversary Party
posts.description:
We are turning 4, and to celebrate we are throwing our most amazing party yet! We will be releasing special beers on draft and in cans, live music from amazing bands, roasting a pig, second bar, and an expanded beer garden! You will not want to miss this!

-Beer Releases
*Godwood Triple IPA (Draft and Cans)
*North Bay Brewer's Guild Collaboration "Instant Classic" West Coast IPA
*Dyerville Imperial Red (Bourbon Barrel Aged)
*Outlier Red Wheat IPA
*Brotherhood Belgian Dubbel (Brandy Barrel Aged)

-Live Music
*Down Dirty Shake
*Brown Bags
*The Restless Sons

-Pig Roast
-Expanded Beer Garden
-Outdoor Bar

posts.title: 'The Champion of Ale Industries' Tournament
posts.description:
3 games, 1 champion. Compete against fellow beer drinkers, AI employees, and experts in this winner-take-all fight for Ale Industries glory by entering a 3-day tournament to find who among you is the most skilled at our taproom games: jenga, rock-paper-scissors, and a mystery game announced on the first day of the tournament.

Contestants are allowed to enter in only 1 or 2 events, but take heed, the true champion must enter all 3.

posts.title: Opening Day Urban Picnic
posts.description:
Welcome to SF Beer Week Opening Day Urban Picnic!

Kick off the sudsiest week in San Francisco with beloved classics and new releases at this all-star Urban Picnic. Taste the region’s most aspiring young breweries alongside founding titans in California craft beer.

With new, distinct brews from 8+ local breweries and brewery representatives on site, you'll get the ultimate beer fix at this grasshopper-meets-sensei event – sipping, savoring, and socializing alongside the mighty brewmasters themselves!

Kickback and feel the breeze (and buzz) on our game-packed astroturf field. Or, snag a picnic spot next to the All You Can Drink Beer Bar. It will be a brew-tiful day filled with good brews, great company, fresh air, sunshine and killer food.

See you at the picnic!

FEATURED BREWERIES
Headlands Brewing Co.
New Bohemia Brewing Co.
Karl Strauss Brewing Co.
Highwater Brewing Co.
This is a Tap Takeover with 16+ beers on tap from 8+ breweries including rarities, exclusives, and award winners.
posts.admission: Free Admission or All You Can Drink Craft Beer tickets $35+

posts.title: Faction Brewing Tap Takeover
posts.description: Join us for a Faction Brewing Tap Takeover. Faction offers a wide variety of pales, IPAs, Belgians, porters and stouts and barrel-aged beers.

posts.title: St. Florian's Brewery - 5th Anniversary Celebration
posts.description:
Let's drink to the hero in ALL of us! And, YOU are a hero, for helping us get to FIVE YEARS!! Thank you for all of your support...now it's time to CELEBRATE!

Details to roll out, but include: live music, food trucks, family-friendly fun, heroics &...of course, our award-winnin' beer!!

St. Florian is the patron saint of firefighters. Our co-owner/brewmaster is a full-time fire captain, in addition to his brewery roles. We donate a minimum of 5% of our profits to fire-related & other community-based organizations.

posts.title: NorCal vs. SoCal Invitational
posts.description:
Which region’s beer reigns supreme…NorCal or SoCal? This friendly competition will pit 10 NorCal breweries up against 10 SoCal breweries and let our guests vote on their favorite beers . Participating breweries will be matched up with a brewery from the opposing region depending on style. Guests will be asked to blind taste by style and cast votes on which beer they like better (not knowing who brewed what). The region with the most points at the end of the day will be announced victor. Winners will not only be able to brag about which region makes better beer but be able to put an end to the long standing debates on who makes a better burrito, if "hella" is a legitimate word, and if it is ever appropriate to put the word "The" in front of a freeway name. Well, at least for the next year.

So who’s participating? We will have beers from 10 NorCal breweries and 10 SoCal breweries. Please see below a list of confirmed breweries participating. A few more breweries will be confirmed will be confirmed closer to the event. Styles and match-ups won’t be disclosed until the day of the event.

NorCal
Alvarado St. Brewing | Monterey, CA
Cellarmaker Brewing Co. | San Francisco, CA

posts.title: Release the Crackin’!
posts.description: The cidermakers at Redwood Coast Cider have been crackin' through a lot of cider, and we have some special cider releases for Beer Week! We've got a pommeau, a barrel-aged sour cider, and a chocolate cherry cider lined up. We also have a collaboration with Alpha Acid--a graff made with our barrel-aged sour cider and their sour beer. The founders Jesse & Gabe and the assistant cidermaker Andrea will be around to chat with during the event; the cider will be pouring until it's gone!

posts.title: Downtown San Jose Beerwalk
posts.description:
Explore the unique shops, art studios, and great restaurants within the community, all while sipping on great beers and enjoying the social enthusiasm of shopkeepers and beer lovers alike!

The Beerwalk was created beyond the idea of sampling great beers, but rather to provide the outlet for our community to come together to explore the neighborhoods and small businesses, which help keep the Bay Area great.

Early Bird Tickets - $35
Limited Day of Tickets - $40

Ticket includes beer samples, custom glass, and passport.

This is an official San Francisco Beer Week event. #SFBeerWeek

Follow us on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram at The Beerwalk. @thebeerwalk #beerwalk

To benefit the San Jose Downtown Association & The Bay Brewers Guild.

posts.title: A Sour Afternoon with Almanac Beer Company
posts.description:
Come join Almanac Beer Co. for a tap takeover at The Crafty Fox Ale House. We’ll be offering rare barrel aged selections alongside limited Beer Week releases on tap. Our kitchen will also be serving up our full menu for the duration of the event.

Tap list to follow

posts.title: Cultivar Beer Tasting and Hop Farmer Conversation
posts.description:
Cultivar Beer will join us at The Periodic Table Taproom in Public Market Emeryville for a tap takeover and a conversation with the hop farmer. Flights, pints, and pitchers all day. Mark Cabrera will tell us about his hop farm at 2 pm, and will be with us throughout the afternoon. We'll feature a house-made sausage special all day.

The Periodic Table is a new taproom and sake bar, located inside Public Market Emeryville. A spinoff concept from the team behind Shiba Ramen, The Periodic Table features ten rotating beer taps, pouring the best craft beer from the Bay Area and Japan. We offer an extensive selection of sake, shochu, and distilled spirits from Japan. We offer a small bar menu, including burgers, cheese and charcuterie plates, and items from Shiba Ramen. Our 18-seat bar is an intimate refuge inside the bustling Public Market, featuring modern design inspired by Japanese geometric patterns and chemistry.

The Periodic Table is the latest concept from Jake Freed and Hiroko Nakamura, a husband-and-wife team of chemistry Ph.D.s who met in a Harvard lab working on the synthesis of a complex organic molecule. They are passionate about good drinking, Japanese culture, design, and science, and The Periodic Table is a forum to share those passions with the East Bay community. Jake writes about the experience of building the Shiba Ramen business on his blog, www.ramenchemistry.com.

Cultivar Beer brews its own craft beers from the hops it grows. With the first hops harvested in 2017, its beers are fresh, flavorful and hoppy. Located on the Sacramento River, Cultivar's 5 acre hop farm grows about 2,000 plants of six cultivars: Chinook, Cascade, Centennial, Columbus, Cluster and Willamette. www.cultivarbeer.com
posts.admission: Free - Cultivar Beer and Food for Purchase

posts.title: Beer Appreciation 101
posts.description:
Ever wanted to know more about beer but were too intimidated to ask? Don’t know the difference between a Saison and a Stout, but not sure to whom you should turn? Are you a connoisseur of craft beer, but are always looking to learn more about what goes into giving beer its multitude of different aromas, flavors, and colors? Then look no further, we’ve got the best SF Beer Week Event for you!

Come learn from Kevin, our head brewer and nationally ranked beer judge, and sample EIGHT beers, as he gives an overview of the ingredients that provide beers their unique characteristics, discusses what defines various brewing cultures and centers around the world, and highlights numerous beer styles and what makes them similar and different from one another. Throughout the discussion, you’ll gain an appreciation for why you may like certain beers, while understanding why you may not enjoy others quite so much. You’ll also enjoy a tour of our brewery and an overview of the complete Ferment.Drink.Repeat brewing process.

The knowledge you’ll gain in our Beer Appreciation 101 Class will set you up for SF Beer Week Success and help you make better-informed beer style selections in the future when out and about with friends, or when deciding what six-pack to grab at the market. Great activity for groups - book now!

posts.title: (Beer and) Whiskey Train
posts.description:
Chugga Chugga...

We are very excited to announce some changes to this year's Whiskey Train. We are switching up the format slightly and will be starting our train this year at the distillery at 1439 Egbert Ave. The first train will depart the distillery at 1pm and will load up and drive across SF to our Outer Sunset Taproom. We will then unload for half an hour, grab some beers and grub, and get back on the train and load up and head to our next surprise - our partner hotel bar at Stanford Court on Nob Hill. We will get out at the Stanford Court, enjoy some whiskeys, and load up and head back to the brewery for the termination of the first Whiskey Train at 4pm.

The next train will run the same route and will depart from the distillery at 4:30pm and return to the distillery at 8pm. The trains we are using this year are slightly smaller so we expect them to sell out faster. There are about 35 spots available per session.

------
Admission includes:

One round trip ticket making all three stops aboard the whiskey train
Live music on the train (usually a banjo or fiddle band)
A limited Choo Choo Mother Fucker 2018 Whiskey Train beer koozie
Beers aboard the train
One drink at the bar at each stop
Snacks at the Outer Sunset Taproom

posts.title: Bourbon Barrel-Aged Nitro Oatmeal Stout Release
posts.description: This is the longest-tasting oatmeal stout in the city.  Did we mention it's on nitro?  And was aged in a blend of Four Roses and Lost Republic bourbon barrels.

posts.title: Beer & Slider SF Rooftop Party
posts.description:
We're celebrating everything great about SF Beer Week with a Beer & Slider event co-hosted by Waystone & Armstrong Brewing Co. We'll be pouring just released SF Beer Week Armstrong beers on the Waystone rooftop patio which has amazing views of the San Francisco skyline.

Included with your ticket:

Open Beer & Wine Bar (Armstrong Brewing will be bringing 4 of their house beers to pour throughout the event.)

Slider bar of your favorite Waystone sliders

posts.title: Cali Coast Cruisin’
posts.description:
Imagine yourself cruisin' down the CA coast, soaking in the sun, and making pit stops for beer. Come kick off SFBW with some of the best coastal breweries in CA! We'll be pouring beers from Alvarado St., Humble Sea, Central Coast, Pure Project and Burgeon! Rarely will you be able to taste so many non-distro CA breweries all at one place! Come early to be sure you have a chance to try everything before the kegs kick!

Check out our website or Untappd for a full draft list prior to the event! This will be a TWO DAY event (Saturday, 2/10 and Sunday, 2/11)!

posts.title: Dim Sum Beer Brunch with Fort Point
posts.description:
Join Fort Point for one of our favorite Beer Week traditions: the third annual Dim Sum Beer Brunch!

Enjoy fresh, made to order dim sum and delicious beer pairings at one of San Francisco’s most storied restaurants, Hong Kong Lounge. This year the event will benefit the Richmond District Neighborhood Center.

Come hungry for soup dumplings, Peking duck, coffee pork ribs, and many more Dim Sum classics, served alongside Fort Point’s KSA, Villager, Park, Westfalia, and Animal.

All event proceeds benefit the Richmond District Neighborhood Center, which provides youth, adult, and family programs that address critical community needs and foster respect for all people and our environment.

posts.title: Tap Takeover:  Altamont, Faction and Fieldwork
posts.description: McKay's Taphouse and Beer Garden is hosting a total tap takeover with Altamont Beer Works, Faction Brewing, and Fieldwork Brewing.  These three Bay Area behemoths will be in Pleasanton to share their frothy brews.  Join us.

posts.title: Local Barrelage 2018: 10 Single-Barrel Beers (Sours, Bourbon + more)
posts.description:
Local Barrelage returns for 2018 SFBW. We've got a bigger barrel program to share this year, with 10 single-barrel aged brews, consisting of sours, mixed culture brews, and bourbon, rum and tequila barrel-aged brews. Seven single-barrel sours and mixed culture brews, three bourbon barrel-aged beers, and a single-barrel Rum and single-barrel Tequila beer. Your ticket includes unlimited tasting from 2pm - 6pm and a commemorative glass. More info on the beers coming soon....
This is a one-time event. Advance tickets: $35. At the door: $50 -- limited to 50 advance tickets.

posts.title: 5th Annual West Coast Craft Can Invitational
posts.description:
Taste the best canned craft at Devil's Canyon Brewing Company -- all the best craft in cans from West Coast breweries and beyond!

The West Coast Craft Can Invitational brings the best West Coast breweries together to show off their canned brews. Hosted in association with The Can Van, the WCCCI is a benefit for the Peninsula Sunrise Rotary and San Mateo Sheriff's Association Code 30.

posts.title: Open Malthouse Day
posts.description:
Come join us on Saturday, February 10, for the full Admiral Maltings experience!

Enjoy a complimentary malthouse tour and beer tasting while hearing from our maltsters, wonderful farmer partners and brewers who have used Admiral's malt!

THE DETAILS:

We'll be taking guests behind-the-scenes at the malthouse where we'll be actively engaged in multiple parts of the production process. Both farmers and brewers will be on site to share their stories and speak about their experiences with Admiral's malt. After the malthouse tour, we'll walk over to our brand new pub, The Rake, for a complimentary malt and beer tasting. There, you'll hear from the brewers who brewed the beer using our fresh, locally sourced and locally made malt.

TICKETS:

This event is 100% free! Due to capacity limitations, we can only have 45 attendees at this time. Please RSVP so you can reserve a spot! To ensure a great experience for all, we'll offer three rounds of tours on a first come, first served basis. Tours will begin at approximately 2:30, 2:45 and 3:00pm.

After the tour and tasting, we invite you to hang out and enjoy The Rake, where we'll have delicious food and 20+ beers brewed with our malt available to order -- including eight of the limited release SF Beer Week collaboration beers!

We hope you can join us for this one-of-a-kind "grain to glass" experience!

Cheers,

The Admiral Maltings Team

posts.title: IPA Fest - West Coast vs New England
posts.description:
We're kicking off Beer Week with an IPA face-off!
Who will reign supreme? West Coast or New England...you make the call! We'll be tallying up your votes along the way, so come support your favorite style! Get an IPA flight, and you'll get an ØL taster glass to take home!

posts.title: Brewer's On The Hot Seat
posts.description:
This event begins as an ordinary panel discussion featuring principles from four of California's most highly regarded breweries:

-- John Gillooly, Brewmaster, Drake's, San Leandro
-- Ting Su, Owner, Eagle Rock, Los Angeles
-- Jim Harte, Owner/Brewmaster, Ol' Republic, Nevada City
-- Collin McDonnell, Owner, HenHouse, Sonoma County

The panel will moderated by "Bay Area Beer Guru" Sayre Piotrkowski and Chauncey Jackson, of BrewStuds and AllThingsBeer510, and divided into five 15-20 minute segments. The twist is that as the panel goes along, Hog's sous-chef, Daniel Sotelo will be bringing out a progressively hotter plate of wings with each segment. Each participant is required to eat 2 wings per cycle.

In addition each brewer has selected a beer from their catalog to help them through the ordeal. This beer will be the only thing, aside from water, and of course the wings, that the participants are allowed to consume throughout the panel.

Guests can join in! There will be a flight available of all 4 of the recommended brews and plates of wings will be available at all heat levels.

*Please feel free to arrive beginning at 2PM. We hope to start the event around 2:45.

posts.title: Winning HomeBrewer Release Party

posts.title: SF Beer Week Special Releases - Three New, One-Off Beers!
posts.description:
SF Beer Week wouldn’t be complete without the release of special, one-off beers made just for the occasion. Not to disappoint, we’ve brewed up three truly unique beers that are sure to please. Visit our Tap Room to get these exclusive beers before they are gone!

Triple Kitty Triple IPA – Our FIRST Triple IPA and it is a beauty. Weighing in at 10.7% ABV, this classic West Coast variant has a firm level of bitterness and loads of citrus, pine, and resin notes from massive amounts of Cascade, Columbus, Chinook, Centennial, and Amarillo hops. We added FOUR separate dry hop additions, and 54 pounds of hops total to this batch that only yielded us 3 barrels of beers --- you read that right, a ridiculous 18 pounds per barrel when it was all said and done! The firm backbone of malt also lends a slight warming sensation as you finish the glass. A killer beer you don’t want to miss – very limited quantities on hand!

Bayview Haze Pomegranate DIPA – Our “SFBW Neighborhood Collaboration” beer made with our friends in the area from Barebottle, Laughing Monk, and Seven Stills, with whom we share the Bayview Line of the SF Brewers Guild monthly “Meet the Brewers” shuttle series. For this collab, each brewery created our own unique take on the beer – the one common thread? Make a Hazy IPA using pomegranate. For our variant, we added pomegranate puree to our wildly popular “Cats In Fatsuits New England-Style DIPA” and the result is sublime! The tartness of pomegranate adds a layer of complexity to the citrus, tropical, and stone fruit notes from the Citra, Mosaic, and Amarillo hops and GigaYeast Vermont IPA yeast. Sure to be a crowd pleaser, we only have a couple of kegs so be sure to get here before we run out.

Spinderella Salt-n-Pepa Gose – Our “Iron Brewer Competition” winner – this year we challenged a group of homebrewers to make beers using a required, special ingredient pulled from the deconstruction of the Bloody Mary. Each brewer was assigned either Cayenne Pepper, Horseradish, Smoked Paprika, Black Peppercorns, or Celery Seed. This year’s winner, Matt Bixby, was assigned Black Peppercorns and smartly put that ingredient to work in the historical Gose style. The traditional Sea Salt and Coriander in this tart and sour beer is complemented perfectly by the addition of the Black Pepper, which adds a depth of spiciness as a bit of heat builds in the lingering, dry finish. A truly unique beer you’ll want to be sure to try while it lasts.

Beers will be put on tap when we open at 3pm, Saturday February 10th. Enjoy your SF Beer Week!

posts.title: Sour Saturday Sh!tstorm
posts.description:
Start SF Beer Week 2018 right with hella sours! in 2017 we lined up kegs from a veritable sh!tstorm of incredible breweries including Sante Adairius, The Rare Barrel, De Garde, Grimm, Toolbox, Panil, Modern Times, Propolis, Mad Fritz, Phantom Carriage, Almanac, Libertine, Lost Abbey, The Bruery, and more! We're doing the same and even raising the game for 2018. Here's the list of kegs we've lined up so far:

1) The Rare Barrel - TBD

2) Propolis - Pi - 7.5% - Syrah barrel aged golden ale with strawberries & rhubarb

3) Phantom Carriage - Super Dry Hopped Broadacres - 4.2% ABV - PC's house berliner weisse dry hopped with a ton of Simcoe

4) Sante Adairius Rustic Ales - Saison Bernice - 6.5% - sour farmhouse ale

5) Almanac - Hibiscus Ginger Lime - 6.9% - oak aged sour farmhouse beer w/ hibiscus, ginger, & lime

6) The Collective Brewing Project - American Sour Red - 6.5% - amber sour from a fairly new brewery doing sours out of TX

7) Firestone Walker - Sour Opal - 5% - oak aged golden sour

8) Upland - Kiwi - 6% - oak aged sour with kiwis

9) Cascade - Sang Royal - 10.1% - blend of sour amber ales oak aged with Cab Sauv grapes & aged in Port & Pinot Noir barrels

10) Cascade - Vlad the Imp Aler - 10.6% - sour wood aged pale Quadruppel

11) Avery - Amicitia - 8.2% - sour ale aged in Cab Sauv barrels

12) Mission Trail Caribbean Cold Front - 6.7% - white plum Jerkum with guava, soursop, & cranberries

13) Epic Brewing - Common Interests - 7.4% - mixed-fermentation ale w/ Oregon red wheat, matured in first-use oak foedres, & re-fermented with Colorado honeydew melons

14) Grimm Artisanal - Galaxy Pop! - Berliner Weiss - 4.8% - Dry hopped Berliner Weisse style ale brewed with galaxy hops vanilla and milk sugar.

15) Mad Fritz - The Lion & Other Beasts - 5% - oak aged Belgian grisette fermented with Brett Brux

16) Modern Times - Lightning Helix - 6.2% - lemon saison aged in red wine barrels

17) BarrelHouse Brewing - Cherry Flanders - 7.4% - flanders red with cherries

18) Allagash - Allagash Avancé - 9.7% - Allagash Four, brewed with a variety of sugars and yeast and bacteria strains, aged in bourbon barrels with strawberries

19) Bruery Terreux - Sour In the Rye POG - 7.3% - special edition of this classic oak aged sour rye ale with added passionfruit, orange and guava

20) a sessionable light beer to cleanse the palate

BONUS) 100 cans of Kukmin hazy IPA from The Booth Brewing!

* ODM is opening at 11AM for this special event.

* We'll be serving brunch until 3PM. Our regular dinner menu will be in effect from 6PM to midnight.

* We always do 4 oz, 10 oz, & pint pours of everything (unless it's really strong or ridiculously expensive/rare, then no pints).

* This is a BYO antacids event.

* The following day is our Black Magic Sour Sunday Beer Brunch and we'll be tapping another 7 sours to go with whatever is left from the Sh!tstorm, so if you can't make it to the Sh!tstorm you may miss out on some of the heaviest hitters, but we've got you covered the next day, too! Details here: https://www.facebook.com/events/1980623692263508

* ODM has a ridiculous line up of SF Beer Week events, one every day, including Whales of the Deep, Fat Tuesday, and HazeFest II. Check them all out here: https://www.facebook.com/olddevilmoonSF/events

posts.title: 707 Brews
posts.description:
The 707 area code represents an area filled with charm and distinct
areas. Visit the Ave Bar as we travel along the northern coast to sample
fantastic beers.
*Lost Cost *- Eureka! Lost Coast Brewery has found the secret to great
craft beers using state-of-the-art equipment and innovative methods...like
turning steam produced from boiling wort back into hot water which is used
to make the next brew. Get lost learning about new beers and brewing
processes.
*Third Street AleWorks *- Tradition meets experimentation at Third Street.
Beer aficionados can enjoy beers that don't fit into any one category.
Anglo-Celtic ales, West Coast styles, lagers, and even lager-ale hybrids
are available to spice up your pallet. Soothe your thirst with a variety of
exciting beers.
*Six Rivers *- Small Batch Craft beer locally sourced in the traditional
English style of brewing offer an old world experience. Become educated on
craft beers and suggested pairings- be tempted with Sasquatch Double IPA,
Chili Pepper Ale, Raspberry Lambic, Macadamia Nut Porter and more old
school perfectly balanced malts
*Fog Belt* - North Coast Stand Up! Your taste buds will come alive with
brews sourced from local ingredients and named after coastal Redwood trees
only found in the "Fog Belt" Learn about barrel aging and a new sour beer
program and enjoy the tastes that come from the Northern California Coast.
and also 101 North.

posts.title: Beer Tour – Alameda & San Leandro Breweries
posts.venue: Whole Brew World - Bay Area Brewery Tours
posts.description:
The Blue Collar Beer Tour | Visit Alameda and San Leandro Breweries

There's nothing better than a guided tour where you can check out local breweries, drink amazing beers, meet great people and not have to worry about a thing!

No hard hats required for this tour, but be ready for strong and well-constructed beer flavors. These brewers are brave and hard at work producing some of the most popular craft beers in the country. Honestly, there are seemingly infinite options for every kind of palette. Bring your thirst. You're gonna drink hella beer!

​Included:
- Visit a minimum of 3 breweries
- All of your beer tastings at each brewery
- Complimentary on board snacks and beverages
- Safe and comfortable round-trip transportation for a max. of 8 guests
- Professional and friendly guide with beer knowledge
- A brewery facility tour at one stop (if available)
- Gratuity for brewery staff

Pick Up and Drop Off Location:
In front of the fountain at Latham Square Plaza in Oakland, two blocks from 19th Street Bart station. 1615 Broadway, Oakland, CA 94612

There are a few parking garages in the area. Street parking has a 2 hour limit. Public transportation or ride sharing is best. Whole Brew World does not condone drunk driving.

All participants must be at least 21 years old. Advanced reservations are required.

To learn more and book online visit www.wholebrewworld.com/bluecollartour or call 925-725-5029.

posts.title: Seismic Brewing - Entropy IIPA Release Party & Tap Takeover
posts.description:
The new kids from Sonoma County, Seismic Brewing Company, will release their 1st Imperial IPA (Entropy) during SF Beer Week. Come meet the brewing team and be among the first to try this Limited Release at Ocean Ale House. Not an Imperial IPA fan? No worries. This tap takeover will also feature several other great styles from Seismic: Liquifaction Kolsch, Alluvium Pilsner, Namazu OPA, Deep Tectonic Stout, Megathrust IPA, and Shatter Cone IPA.

Entropy Imperial IPA is malty, hoppy, aromatic, robust, and hedonistic.  Featuring two different rye malts and a healthy dose of rich Vienna malt, the full bodied monster does not disappoint.  Caramel and peppery rye flavors create a strong background to the hops, which are classically reminiscent of pine and citrus - with a sneaky addition of Nelson Sauvin hops to keep things interesting.  At a bracing 75 IBU and 8.5% ABV, this winter warmer aims to satisfy hop heads and malt lovers alike.  This is the Imperial IPA your mother warned you about.

Drawing inspiration from Belgian tradition and like-minded breweries, Sante Adairius Rustic Ales (affectionately known as SARA) offers beer enthusiasts a carefully crafted collection of beer.  Sante celebrates the unexpected qualities a small well-tended batch of beer produces; the melded flavors of yeast, hops, and nature joining together for a remarkable taste.  A list to admire will arrive shortly.

posts.title: A Bay Of Our Own Beer Release - SF Beer Week 2018 Collaboration, Monterey Bay
posts.description:
Join us for this special beer release: A Bay Of Our Own - Salted Caramel Stout - one of the official SF Beer Week 2018 Collaboration Beers, this one bringing together breweries from the Monterey Bay and Santa Cruz area. This is a rare treat, as this beer will be hard to find outside of the Monterey area.

Produced at Discretion Brewing and brewed with California-grown Maiden Voyage malt from Admiral Maltings, this beer features Monterey sea salt and rich, dark caramel -- homemade by Uncommon Brewers.. Local and sustainable ingredients plus the efforts, ideas, and camaraderie of 12 Monterey Bay Area breweries make this beer a celebration of place. Participating Breweries: New Bohemia Brewing Co, East Cliff Brewing Co, Uncommon Brewers, Brewery Twenty-Five, Alvarado Street Brewery, Corralitos Brewing Co, Santa Cruz Mountain Brewing, Shanty Shack Brewing, Humble Sea Brewing Co, Steel Bonnet Brewing Company, Seabright Brewery, Discretion Brewing.

We'll also have a small bites food menu for the event.

posts.title: Jeffers Drops Acid
posts.description:
Join us at Sessions as Jeffers of Firestone Walker drops....education! He'll be tasting you through the pH scale as he leads a discussion on sour blending and how the pH scales play a massive role in understanding the sours we all love.

Featured pours include:
Agrestic
La Piccola Virtuosa
Reginald Brett
Krieky Bones

posts.title: Berryessa Beers and Blues Night
posts.description:
A night of local craft beer from Berryessa Brewery coupled with killer blues bands!

Free Show

posts.title: Sierra Nevada Tap Takeover
posts.description:
20 beer Tap Takeover from Sierra Nevada. Pouring all day and all night! Flights available. No need to drive to Chico anymore! Featuring
Rubotto sour,
Sunset sour,
Sierraveza,
BA Rasberry Bigfoot,
BA Maple scotch, and more!

posts.title: Yoga and Beer
posts.description:
Life is all about balance. Come undo some of the damage done the night before with a little yoga and beer!

Your morning will start in our taproom with an awesome, 90 minute Bhakti yoga session suitable for all levels led by instructor Armando Luna.

After yoga is over head to the bar for your cool down. With 16 beers to choose from, there is sure to be something to quench everyone's thirst.

Follow the link for exclusive discounted presale tickets, otherwise walk-ins are also welcome, just pay $15 after yoga when you grab your beer.

Namaste and #LaughOn

posts.title: The Dark Flight Returns
posts.description:
Brunch is BEST, if you didn't know already. This year for the first weekend of SFBW we will be featuring flights of dark beer to pair with our stellar menu.

If you ever needed a reservation, it is highly recommended during this service for guaranteed seating times. You can always go through OpenTable or call us directly.

posts.title: 2nd Annual Beer & Brunch
posts.description:
Join us for Novel Brewing Co.'s 2nd Annual Beer & Brunch Event during SF Beer Week 2018! We are again pairing with our neighbors at Homegrown Oakland (first two courses) and James & the Giant Cupcake (third course). Prepare yourself for three amazing food courses paired with some amazing Novel Brewing Co. beers! This year we will have two seatings, one at 10:30 am and one at 12:30 pm. Please ensure your ticket is for the correct seating time that you prefer and you arrive withing 15 minutes of the seating time.

This is a 21+ event.

Menu has been announced!

FIRST COURSE
------------------------------------------------
Homegrown Oakland's Toast: Toasted Acme bread topped w/ avocado, roasted corn & poblano peppers, and seasoned with chili flakes and olive oil, paired with an 8 oz pour of Novel Brewing Co. Brett on the Farm, Brett Saison

SECOND COURSE
------------------------------------------------
Homegrown Oakand's Pork Hash*: Pork hash topped w/ soft boiled egg, diablo sauce, herb crema, and scallions, all served on a pile of country potatoes, paired with a 16 oz pour of Novel Brewing Co. Double Grainbow, Double IPA

THIRD COURSE
------------------------------------------------
James & the Giant Cupcake's Life’s a Peach Cupcake: Vanilla cupcake filled w/ citrus curd (lemon, orange, grapefruit,tangerine) iced w/ whipped, fluffy vanilla butterceam, and topped w/ peach colored edible glitter, paired with an 8 oz pour of Novel Brewing Co. Peach Don’t Preach, Golden Sour Ale w/ Peaches

-- OR --

James & the Giant Cupcake's Luck of the Irish Cupcake: Guinness cupcake filled w/ Jameson whiskey ganache, iced w/ whipped, fluffy buttercream, and topped caramel & mini pretzels, paired with an 8 oz pour of Novel Brewing Co. Pomegranate Shake, IPA


* Veggie Hash available upon request
** Menu subject to change based on availability

posts.title: Philz Coffee - Beer Collaboration & Brunch
posts.description:
If you're like us, the first Sunday of Beer Week makes you regret (or forget) Saturday. What better way to not feel sorry for yourself than grabbing coffee, brunch and a great brunch beer?

We've partnered with our friends at Philz Coffee to create an out of the ordinary Coffee Ale. It's bright, golden and steeped with Philz's Amrosia blend.

The Philz crew will be at Barebottle, pouring the same coffee blend that we added to the beer. Me So Hungry food truck will be out front whipping up some a la carte brunch items to pair with it all. There's no better way to start your Beer Week Sunday!

posts.title: Barrel Aged Sundae
posts.description:
Sunday Funday at Smoke Eaters Mercado! No mimosas today. Just some full bodied stouts that have been aging for quite sometime. It's time to pour these liquid gold! Also, order any of the beers below and we will throw in a scoop of vanilla ice cream! See what makes the best combination.

On deck:
-- The Bruery So Happens Its Tuesday '16
-- Belching Beaver ODB '16
-- Oskar Blues Java Ten Fidy '16
-- Founders CBS '17, KBS '17
... more TBD

posts.title: Cultivar Hair of the Dog Beer Brunch
posts.description:
Experience 3 craft brews from Cultivar while enjoying a paired SF Beer Week Brunch Menu and Brotzeit Lokal's gorgeous Oakland waterfront view. Play games, win prizes and take home custom Cultivar glassware and other swag.

Meet the Cultivar brewers and hear the ins and outs of a truly unique and passionate craft brewery. Hops farmers first, craft brewers second, Cultivar grows unique and proprietary strains of hops locally and crafts each batch with a unique recipe to highlight particular qualities of each harvest.

posts.title: Black Magic Sour Sunday Beer Brunch
posts.description:
Sunday brunch is awesome. Sour beer is awesome. Mash up!

It's simple, on the first day of SF Beer Week, Saturday the 10th, we're doing our epic Sour Saturday Sh!tstorm event and as much sour beer as will be consumed that day (a sh!tload), there will be PLENTY left for Black Magic Sour Sunday Beer Brunch. Sure, some of the heaviest hitters will blow on Saturday, like the Sante Adairius & Rare Barrel stuff, but we figure there will be around 12-14 partially full kegs left.

Not only that, but we're holding back a few VERY special kegs just for our Black Magic Sour Sunday Beer Brunch! We were going to make it a surprise, but what the hell, you need to know about these:

1) Boon - Boon Oude Lambik - 6.5% - unblended lambic, while it can be found in Belgium it is super rare to experience this in the US

2) Boon - Oude Kriek - 6.5% - wild cherry lambic

3) Hanssens - Oudbeitje - 6% - strawberry lambic, made in small batches and only a few kegs made it to the west coast of the US

4) BFM - Abbaye De Saint Bon-Chien Special 20th Anniv Edition - 11% ABV - one time release, sour biere de garde aged in Bordeaux Grand Cru wine barrels

5) Schneider - 2014 Cuvee Barrique - 9.5% - vintage sour, blend of wine barrel aged Aventinus & Aventinus Eisbock

6) Brouwerij Bockor N.V. - Cuvée Des Jacobins Prestige - 7.1% - one time release, a blend of 24 month-old foedrebier, spontaneously fermented & blended from foedres IX, XI, and XIV

7) Alvinne - Kriek van Mortagne - 9.5% - a blend of 60% Kerasus 2014 & 40% Cuvee de Mortagne aged in St Emilion wine barrels

The deets:

~~ ODM's Black Magic Sour Beer Brunch goes from 11AM to 3PM (the regular dinner menu is in effect from 6-10PM).

~~ ODM is open on Sundays until midnight, so if you can't make beeruch, come in later!

~~ We'll be pouring all the killer sours left over from the Sour Saturday Sh!tstorm event. We figure there will be about 14 partially full kegs, some more full than others. Help us kick those sours!

~~ In addition, we're tapping a VERY special surprise keg on Sunday. Seriously, it isn't like, just another humdrum sour.

~~ We have full liquor, so if a Bloody Mary or Maria is more your speed (or your non-beer-geek-partner's speed!), we've got you all covered.

~~ Black Magic Brunch goodies include Huevos Rancheros; Loco Moco; Shrimp & Griddled Grits; a Breakfast Sammy; French Toast Dippers; Fried Chicken Sliders; and Cheddar Biscuits & Gravy. Many of these are available vegetarian.

~~ ODM has a ridiculous line up of SF Beer Week events, one every day, including Whales of the Deep, Fat Tuesday, and HazeFest II. Check them all out here: https://www.facebook.com/olddevilmoonSF/events

See you there!

posts.title: Charitable Goldsprint – Cycling Event with Anderson Valley
posts.description:
Avid Cyclists, Bike Messengers and Beer Aficionados alike, join us for a healthy albeit boozy cycling competition featuring Anderson Valley’s finest brews!

We’re hosting a charitable goldsprint, a friendly race on stationary bikes mounted in the beer garden. All proceeds from the featured Anderson Valley brews will be matched by Zeitgeist as a donation to the SF Bike Coalition and NICA.

Register at 1 pm. Compete from 2 to 4 pm. Top 3 men and women win price packets filled with gear from Market Street Cycles, Mission Workshop, Ritchey, Cadence and Anderson Valley.

Be one of the first 25 registrants for the race to get Zeitgeist cycling swag before it begins.
Drink Beer and Give Back at Zeitgeist all week during SF Beer Week 2018. For all of our events during Beer Week, Zeitgeist is giving back to the SF community by matching our event sales as a charitable contribution.

More details at Zeitgeist_SF on Insta, Zeitgeist_SF on Facebook. Full Zeitgeist SF Beer Week menu on Untappd!

posts.title: Breakside Brewery
posts.description:
If you love craft beer and haven't heard of Breakside, you are in for a treat! We are honored to be the launch site for this fantastic beer in the South Bay. Brewers will be on hand for your gushing 2-4pm.

Founded in 2010, Breakside Brewery has become one of the fastest rising and most acclaimed breweries in the Pacific Northwest. Their mission in brewing is to create diverse and interesting beers that appeal to the palate as a whole.

posts.title: Firestone Parabola Vertical Tasting
posts.description: We will have Firestone Walker's Parabola Imperial Stout  2017, 2016 + 2015 on tap.  And there may be a few bottles of other vintage Parabolas floating around as well.  Taste them side by side.  Flights will be available.  While supplies last.

posts.title: Strong Beer Brunch with Drakes, Cleophus Quealy & Three Weavers
posts.description: Join us at our pub in San Francisco for our annual Strong Beer Brunch with our friends at Cleophus Quealy, Drakes and Three Weavers. We'll be pairing their super special strong beers with a brunch menu created by 21A's own Executive Chef Joel Ruiz. This is not to be missed and is a great way to start your SF Beer Week off right.

posts.title: Barrel Aged and Sour Day with Mussels
posts.venue: The Rose and Crown English Pub
posts.description: A day of Sours and Barrel Aged brews to go with Mussels cooked two ways by local Chef Barry Stiles.  We will have a variety of different sours and barrel aged beers with the option of a bowl of mussels cooked in either a white wine, butter, and shallots, or mussels cooked in a cream, coriander, and ginger sauce. Always a popular day and mussels are limited.

posts.title: 101 North Brewing, Dylan & Ekin Imperial IPA Release Party
posts.description:
We will be celebrating a Limited Release of 101 North Brewing's "Dylan & Ekin Imperial IPA."
Party lasts all day and we will continue to pour this fine beer all week until its gone.
Come Celebrate good beer and the marriage of two of our friends.

posts.title: Beerunch
posts.description:
Public House, Woods Beer Co. & Friends cordially request your presence at Beerunch, a beer and food brunch featuring Woods Morpho and other morning-friendly brews. Beer in the morning!" you say, "Blasphemy!" Well, you too will believe, as our divine pairings defy convention and show that the beverage of the masses is truly a beverage without boundaries.

FEATURED MENU
Woods Sour Morpho + Oysters w Morpho Mignonette
Woods Divine Origins Merlot + Hash Brown Croquette with Tomatillo Barbecue Sauce
Woods Freeze Pop Pale + Breakfast Taco with Chicken Chorizo Scrambled Eggs and Jalapeño Salsa
Woods Nico Weizenbock + Banana French Toast with Coconut Caramel Sauce
Woods Divine Origins Fiano + Fried Artichoke Frito Mixto with Shaved Fennel
Moonlight Toast + Crispy Pork Rillette with Gribiche
TBD + Bacon Macaron

posts.title: Pin Fest
posts.description:
We'll have a lineup of our beers poured in the traditional english method, on cask and dispensed by gravity.
The Line Up:
Bramling Cross Rye IPA - english style IPA w/ rye fermented in barrels 6.9% abv
Proud Papa IPA - hazy IPA collaboration w/ Cellarmaker 6.8% abv
Jungle Cruise - Triple IPA w/ even still more hops added to the cask. 11% abv
Who Let the Dog Stout? - big ol' roasty stout conditioned on Dandelion cocoa nibs. 7.4% abv

posts.title: Cinnamon Roll Brunch
posts.description: We are opening 3 hours early to help you kick start your SFBW with some homemade cinnamon rolls paired with HMB Brewing's Calf-eine Coffee Milk Stout. The Calf-eine is made with Ritual espresso and will give you a much needed boost to your event packed week!

posts.title: Cider Sunday
posts.description: We will be exploring styles of cider around the world during our Sunday brunch hours. We are hosting Half Pint Ciders, whose portfolio includes ciders in a range of styles from various countries.

posts.title: Brewing for a Cause: Aubrey Brown Foundation Fundraiser w. Seismic Brewing
posts.description:
Beach Hut Deli is proud to present Seismic Brewing Company & 5 other great craft brewers.

This outdoor party will feature Live Music and BBQ. We will be raising money for the Aubrey Brown Foundation.

The new kids from Sonoma County, Seismic Brewing Company, will release their 1st Imperial IPA (Entropy) during SF Beer Week. This will be the first pour in the South Bay. Hope to see you there!

Entropy Imperial IPA is malty, hoppy, aromatic, robust, and hedonistic.  Featuring two different rye malts and a healthy dose of rich Vienna malt, the full bodied monster does not disappoint.  Caramel and peppery rye flavors create a strong background to the hops, which are classically reminiscent of pine and citrus - with a sneaky addition of Nelson Sauvin hops to keep things interesting.  At a bracing 75 IBU and 8.5% ABV, this winter warmer aims to satisfy hop heads and malt lovers alike.  This is the Imperial IPA your mother warned you about.

posts.title: Shaman Series: Elemental Magic
posts.description: The shaman returns! For the fourth year in a row, our resident apothecaries brew a series of medicinal, healing beers, using locally foraged herbs and ancient, sacred recipes.

posts.description:
We are delighted to be hosting Beachwood Brewing here for a tap takeover. These guys are making some incredible beer in Longbeach, CA and we can't wait to share them with you.

posts.title: Two Hops For Sister Sara Bottle Release Party
posts.description:
We are extremely pleased to release Two Hops For Sister Sara in 22oz bombers, the first of a three beer homage to legendary actor and director, Clint Eastwood. Brewed with Mosaic and Citra hops, this Double IPA (8% ABV 65 IBU) will be available at our Tap Room in Petaluma, NorCal. This release has seven label variations, and we're giving away label art posters if you buy just two, so come on down while supplies last!

We'll have plenty of grub on-hand as well from our friends at FA Nino's, the Godfather Of Sauce.

posts.title: Barrel Strong Brews Day
posts.description: Beer Revolution is hosting some of the very best barrel aged brews around! Full line up list: on its way!

posts.title: Intoxicating Hops Sipping Session
posts.description:
This is the one where we wax poetic about Humulus Lupulus. ah the intoxicating scent of zesty hops!  Treat your taste buds to a collection of IPAs on draft. Have a preference-hazy, clear, slightly hazy, single, double, triple-have an opinion?  All are welcome here. You're in California, it's perfectly legal to enjoy your hoppy beers in any fashion.

And you know what tastes good with Humulus Lupulus?  Snacks. Snacks like: pizza rolls, Combos, Poptarts, and Rice Krispy treats, we'll have those too.  Talk hop shop-floral, citrus, sticky, piney, insert your hoppy word of choice here-oh we love to encourage these discussions. 

We wouldn't want you to leave empty handed; can and bottle releases will be held throughout the day.  
-Chapman Crafted Ales
-Temescal Beer
-Alvarado Street Brewery
-Track 7 Brewing Company
-and more....

posts.title: The Sour Sunday
posts.description:
Tickets now on sale!

Pucker up, your favorite funk fest returns! Presented by Jupiter, Triple Rock and Drake’s Brewing, The Sour Sunday has been the Bay Area's premier sour and barrel-aged for almost a decade. Featuring more than 60 of the world's finest draft and bottle-conditioned mouthwatering brews, this afternoon of awesomeness is sure to make your jaw hurt!

Hop between two Downtown Berkeley locations to experience old world and new world sour ales beyond your wildest dreams, including cult favorites and sour scene newcomers. Rain or shine, we’ll be pouring the rarest, wildest, tartest, horseblanketiest and most pungent brews of all!

Visit SourSunday.com for updates on participating breweries, tap list and location maps.

Ticket Packages:
* Pre-Sale General Admission – TBA
* Pucker Package – TBA
* VIP Package – TBA

Nitty Gritty:
* Must be 21+ to purchase tickets. Jupiter and Triple Rock will be open for regular service, as well as for the event.
* Service animals are welcome but please leave pets and children at home.
* Additional tasting tickets will be available for purchase at the event.

posts.title: Lambic Sunday
posts.description:
*****NOTE: THE DATE OF THIS EVENT HAS CHANGED TO SUNDAY FEB 11*****

All lambic all day! 50 different bottles and 6 kegs of real lambic on tap.

posts.title: Shaman Series: Elemental Magic
posts.description: The shaman returns! For the fourth year in a row, our resident apothecaries brew a series of medicinal, healing beers, using locally foraged herbs and ancient, sacred recipes.

posts.title: Gears and Beers Car Meet-Up
posts.description:
In the spirit of the old auto shop that once resided where Gilman Brewing stands... it only made sense for us to use our space to bring together the best hot rods, lowriders, kustoms, classics and imports of the Bay Area!

Gears and Beers is back for Round 2 as part of San Francisco Beer Week!

The event will run from 12-3pm. All cars are welcome and there is no entry fee! Parking will be available in the back parking lot starting at 11:30, and for anyone who arrives earlier there are usually lots of spaces out front as well.

Food vendors will be on site. Beers will be flowing.

We will also be releasing our new Belgian Golden Strong Ale, a delicious addition to our lineup that we've nicknamed "the Devil's Hot Rod".

Looking forward to seeing everyone there! Cheers!

posts.title: CQ Tiki Party
posts.description:
It may be winter, but we’re partying tiki-style to celebrate our most tropical beer yet: POG Saison! This barrel-aged brew is loaded with passionfruit, blood orange, and guava for a beer that is super juicy and as refreshing as a Mai Tai. Canasta Kitchen will be serving up some special island-inspired dishes as we crank up the surf jams and break out our most obnoxious Hawaiian shirts.

Dogs and kids are welcome! (Bonus points for dogs and kids in Hawaiian shirts)
