posts.title: Fogbelt Beer & Cheese Meet the Brewer
posts.description: Fogbelt will be joining us for a special beer & cheese pairing! We'll be featuring four of their amazing beers paired with four delectable cheeses. The brewers will be on hand for any questions you might have about the beers or if you just want to say hi. :-)

posts.title: Off The Line - 2nd Annual Real-Time Can Release
posts.description:
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
FEATURED RELEASES
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Wonder Why IPA - canning @ ~1pm
Big News IIPA - canning @ ~3pm

Ever watched “How It’s Made” and wished you could pluck a freshly made treat right off the assembly line? This Beer Week, we’ve got you. Come see us and our pals at The Can Van take two new beers every step of the way from tank to can, while sipping on a freshly filled can of your own straight off the canning line. Sip & Slide will be on hand serving up sliders, and we’ll have to-go cans for sale, too.

We’ll be canning our Wonder Why IPA at roughly 1pm, and our Big News IIPA starting at around 3pm. (Since this is a live production process and delays can happen, keep in mind those times are subject to change.) Our full draft lineup will also be available, in case you prefer to keep it old-school with a pint.

posts.title: 2nd Annual Rec Room Party
posts.description:
East Brother Beer Company will celebrate its one-year anniversary during its second annual Rec Room Party!

Last year’s Rec Room party was a resounding success, so the brewery decided an encore was in order, and pairing the two events seemed to be a natural fit. The event will feature BBQ made with East Brother Beers served up by local food truck favorite Steel Smokin BBQ; live music by bands Flowtilla and Walter Hand & The Blue Hand Band; new merchandise for sale; pinball and other classic arcade games; and numerous opportunities to win prizes. The highlight of the day is sure to be the introduction of a new beer, the identity of which will not be revealed until SF Beer week and during the party.

posts.title: An Afternoon with Modern Times
posts.description:
Our favorite San Diego brewery, Modern Times, will be taking over our taps for the afternoon with a mix of one off and hard to find brews.

Tap List TBC

posts.title: Sunday Fun-day with the Sisters
posts.description:
The Monks and Nuns come together for #BeerWeek!

The centerpiece of the afternoon will be donation BINGO starting at 1pm! Prizes will include gift cards and other goodies from Laughing Monk and other local businesses.

If Bingo's not your thing, we'll also have Sister Twister! And, yes, it's exactly what it sounds like. This is the bucket list item you never knew you always had.

$1 from every beer sold will be donated to The Sisters of Perpetual Indulgence and all of the amazing good they do.

Lastly, we will have an Assemble to Order Catering Brunch Pop-Up with a BYOB - Build Your Own Biscuits Bar. You can go classic biscuits and gravy or try one of the other adventurous sweet & savory biscuits they have to offer.

Get your discounted presale tickets now:

Your $35 ticket will include:
-BYOB Meal
-2 Pints of Your Choice
-3 BINGO Cards
-1 Raffle ticket

See you then-- a Sunday Funday you won't want to miss
#LaughOn

posts.title: Beer Things From Chicago
posts.description: We've invited four of our closest friends and amazing brewers from Chicago to takeover our taps. Featuring four beers each from Off Color, Half Acre and -- for the very first time ever in SF -- Pipeworks and Hopewell! Mark your calendars this might be your only chance to taste these beers on draft outside of Chicago! Stay tuned for the beer list...

posts.title: Cellarmaker Sunday - Tangerang Bottle Release & Growler Fills
posts.description:
We get so excited hanging with our buds from Cellarmaker Brewing Company. The creative juices start flowing and we put our heads together to come up with some new (and old favorites) collaborative brews. This year we are sharing 3 beers with y’all! What makes this year’s party more special than years past? We bottled Tangerang!

Yes, that’s right, for the first time ever you can take Tangerang! bottles home with you, and on top of that for 1 day only we will be filling any clean 32oz and 64oz growler brought in with one of the other Cellarmaker collaboration beers. There are just a few requests we need to ask prior to bringing in your growlers to this Cellarmaker + The Rare Barrel event.

1. Growlers must be a marked 32oz or 64oz growlers with a lid
2. Please tape over any logo that is not The Rare Barrel logo
3. Please clean your growler prior to attending this event

Stay tuned for more details to come on pricing, limits, and draft styles.

Looking for grub? Real Smoked BBQ will be hanging out Sunday as well to fill bellies with tasty BBQ dishes!

posts.title: SoCal Sour Sunday & Cheese Pairing
posts.venue: The Good Hop Bar & Bottle Shop
posts.description:
SoCal Sour Sunday is back for the 2nd year in a row! One of our most popular SFBW events at The Good Hop, this event is exactly what it sounds like: ALL SOURS, ALL DAY LONG. Our 16 taps will be taken over by some of the yummiest sours to step foot out of SoCal. 

This year we are adding curated cheese pairings to the list, because everyone knows that good cheese and sour beer are a delightful combination. Our very own bartender and house cheesemonger Paul Klevan will be selecting the cheeses and suggesting irresistible pairings that bring our the funk and play up the flavors of both the cheese and the beer.

Participating Breweries (updated 1/18):
Mike Hess Brewing Company

Pizza Port Brewing Co.
The Good Beer Company
Council Brewing Company
Eagle Rock Brewery
Smog City Brewing
Beachwood BBQ Blendery

Modern Times

Keep an eye out for the brewers/crew themselves, who will be trekkin' up North to hang out with us that afternoon/evening between 4pm and 9pm.

posts.title: IPA Day & 650 Can Release
posts.description:
As all Alpha faithful know we put a lot of time and effort into our hoppy beers. IPA Day is one of those we celebrate dearly.

This year we have an extra special release as it will be the first time in a format other than a pint or growler fill as we can up 650!

So join us for some hop bombs and cheers to another sweet af SF Beer Week!

Tap list (subject to change):

Final Final - Triple IPA

Emerald Hills - Double IPA

posts.title: Smoke & Juice: BBQ Competition and Beer Release
posts.description:
Harmonic Brewing is hosting an epic BBQ competition to celebrate SF Beer Week and a brand new collaboration beer with Bare Bottle Brewing. We will have at least 3 BBQ vendors in house, and the beer will be flowing!

We decided to brew a Double IPA with Bare Bottle to showcase our love for the hop but also to show our two different methods of brewing them. We give you: Invisible Haze Double IPA. We brewed this with Bare Bottle in the house, and we used the same recipe as them. The difference being that we do a couple of things to the beer to make a clear beer in the end, while Bare Bottle did everything they could to keep the haze in suspension. Come try this amazing hop bomb!

We will still be open to the public, and if you would like to participate in the BBQ competition, please purchase a ticket!

Each ticket comes with the following:
1 Chicken wing from each vendor
1 pork rib from each vendor
2 votes: 1 each for best wing and best rib
1 13oz pour of our brand new double IPA: Invisible Haze

Featured BBQ Vendors:

Native Sons BBQ
Sunset29 BBQ
Backyard BBQ

posts.title: 3rd Annual East Bay Non IPA Tap Takeover
posts.description:

posts.title: CaliCraft Tap Takeover
posts.description: We will being hosting Calicraft Brewing on Sunday, February 11th from 1pm-7pm for a tap takeover! We will be offering flights of Calicraft during the event!

posts.title: Drag Brewery Tours
posts.description:
A classic brewery tour with a twist!

Come learn the history of Laughing Monk and take a peak behind the curtain of our brew operation while enduring the sass of San Francisco drag legend, Ginger Snap. With Sister Snap at the helm, hijinx are sure to ensue!

Brewery tours start at 1pm, 2pm, 3pm, 4pm and will last 20-30 minutes with time for photo ops, followed by a pint of your choice and you get to keep your logo glass as a memento. You don't want to miss this--grab your tickets today!

#LaughOn #SisterSnap

posts.title: Bordeaux Barrel-Aged Brown Ale Release
posts.description: It's in a wine barrel!  It's beer!  It's beer in a wine barrrel!

posts.title: Firefly Rebellion – North Oakland Beer Crawl
posts.description:
We at Arthur Macs have decided to join forces with our friends and neighbors at Temescal Brewing, Roses Taproom, and Hogs Apothecary to bring you a unique opportunity to taste many specialty beers in a group setting! Led by the one and only Sayre, our bar crawl will begin at Roses Taproom at 1:30 where we will kick off the action. Here is the itinerary:

1:30pm - Roses, where we will be drinking Lorale, a Hibiscus Dry Hopped Blonde

2:30pm - Temescal Brewing, where we will be drinking the newly released Big News DIPA

3:30pm - Hogs Apothecary, where we will be drinking Triple Rock's Hip Breaker

4:30pm - Arthur Macs where we'll be drinking Henhouse + Ol Republic's Collab Neon Rise and a DJ who also happens to be a brewer at Ol Republic!

We intend to highlight amazing beers, brewed by amazing people, and showcased at local and independently owned businesses. Join in at any point along the way, the more the merrier! This is a rare opportunity to taste some amazing beers while being able to discuss the process, the story, and the methods behind attaining such a high standard of quality.

posts.title: Yeast Class: Lecture & Tasting
posts.description:
Brewers make wort. Yeast make beer.

Santa Clara Valley Brewing welcomes NYC craft beer pioneer and owner of Brooklyn's Bitter & Esters Homebrew and Brew On Premises, John LaPolla, who will be explaining everything you've always wanted to know about yeast.

Did you know that most of the flavor of beer comes from the strain of yeast used in fermentation? In this class we will delve into the wonderful world of brewers yeast. We’ll cover a history and usage of yeast and how it affects the flavor of your beer. Afterwards we will taste four beer samples and discuss the yeasts role in the flavor profile of each beer.

posts.title: High Water Brewing Barrel Aged Beer Release and Pig Roast
posts.description: This is going to be a really fantastic event! If you haven't been to a pig roast at Stay Gold then you haven't experienced real BBQ. We will be pairing this up with some special Barrel Aged releases by High Water Brewing. Its gonna be a killer pig roast party out in the beer garden. Make sure the get their on the earlier side since the pig tends to go pretty damn fast! Last year this was probably one of our most heavily attended events :)

posts.title: Historic Breweries, Bars & Brothels Tour
posts.description: Kick off SF Beer Week with a walk back in time, when San Jose lived up to its reputation as a drinking town. An alcohol-themed walking tour will cover San Jose's drinking past and introduce what's brewing in the present. This interactive stroll  will visit former brewery locations, introduce famous brews, and infamous drinkers. The tour has sold out the past so sign up early to avoid the wait list. You MUST register in advance to receive exact starting point for the tour.

posts.title: Chicks Dig Beer
posts.description: Grab some gal pals and come learn and sip with beer nerd + Hogwash owner, Paula Thompson, during this two-hour workshop. You’ll taste six different beer styles and learn the key differences between each. What’s better than beer on a  Sunday afternoon? Small snacks to be provided.

posts.title: The Holy Trainity
posts.description:
It's time for us Monks to take it on the road!
We have chartered the historic streetcar, Melbourne 496, to take a cruise down the F line from the Castro to the Wharf and back. Onboard you will our founder, Andrew serving up delicious beer and ready to chat it up. We'll have snacks for sustenance and a bluegrass trio providing the soundtrack for our journey! The journey takes approximately 2 hours beginning to end. Grab your tickets today, you don't want to miss this very special event during SF Beer Week.

posts.title: Prubechu x Fort Point - Chesa & Setbesa
posts.description:
We're teaming up with Fort Point Beer for a special Sunday event called Chesa & Setbesa. We'll be opening up, for the first time, on Sunday to host this event which will consist of Chesa (Chamorro snacks) and Setbesa (beers).

This will be an all-you-can-drink event!

We'll be celebrating the release of Fort Point's newest addition to their canned offerings called Resonance. As a special treat, the good folks at Fort Point will be bringing some special beers brewed just for SF Beer Week.

We'll have Fort Point in the house to field any questions about their newest beers, the brewery, and a new location that will open this year.

Live music will keep the vibes rolling through the afternoon and early evening.

$50 All You Can Drink
chamorro snacks
live music
good vibes

posts.title: Pinball & Pints
posts.description:
Play unlimited pinball on 100+ historic pinball machines AND drink 20+ beers from 10+ of the Bay's best brewers.

Pinball and Pints at the Pacific Pinball Museum returns for its 4th year! We are back in the original museum, which means limited tickets are available. This will sell out quickly, so get your tickets soon.

Taste 20+ beers from some of Bay's best breweries. We'll have soon-to-be-released beers from an exciting mix of young and established breweries. You get a nifty Pacific Pinball Museum tasting glass and unlimited tastings with all our brewers.

And of course, you'll play a ton of pinball on the Museum's 100+ machines, all set on free play! We'll have some fun and casual tournaments with great prizes to test your pinball skills.

Featuring:
-- Ale Industries
-- Cleophus Quealy Beer Co.
-- Alameda Island Brewing
-- Federation Brewing
-- Alpha Acid Brewing
-- Iron Springs Brewery
-- Triple Voodoo

More to come!

The event is a fundraiser to support the programs of the Pacific Pinball Museum, a non-profit organization.

posts.title: Messing Around with Melvin
posts.description:
Melvin is coming - look busy! But don't miss the shenanigans (and beer) we've got in store for this event. Our friends at Melvin love a good ruckus and we're more than happy to assist in such a noble cause.

Guest chefs (Adam Timney & Alejandro Morgan), a whole pig from Devil's Gulch Farm (fed on our brewery grain, naturally), Kung Fu movies, drag impersonators, beer punch and a selection of some of Wyoming and San Francisco's finest beers (did someone say IPA Cart?).

The merriment ensues in the Magnolia Dogpatch loading dock from 3-6pm on 2/10, when we are all still fresh and well-rested at the very beginning of the marathon that is SF Beer Week. Come on down and meet the good folks from Melvin (and Magnolia). Try limited release and new beers from both breweries. Enjoy whole roasted pig and an assortment of sides. Watch silent Bruce Lee movies. Make memories. Plot your next Beer Week move. We're here for you.

$45 gets you a beer or punch from the dock bar, two beers from the IPA cart and one serving of pork with all the fixings.

posts.title: 2nd Annual Girl Scout Cookie & Beer Pairing Flight
posts.description:
Ahh, the best time of year. SF Beer Week (of course) and…the start of Girl Scout Cookie season!

Back by popular demand, we'll be celebrating two of the greatest things in life with a flight that pairs 4 awesome Bay Area beers with 4 of everyone’s favorite cookies.

Forget milk—dunk your cookies in some of the best local craft beer around. And you’ll be drinking up for a good cause: $4 from every flight will go directly to the Girl Scouts of Northern California, whose mission is to build girls of courage, confidence and character who make the world a better place.

4 beers, 4 cookies, $4 donation

(P.S. The cookies will support the kids, but this event is 21+-only!)

posts.title: 3rd Annual Local Lighthouse IPA Competition Special Beer Release
posts.description:
Join us as we celebrate homebrewers and their craft, as we release the scaled up version of the winning IPA recipe from our 3rd Annual Local Lighthouse Homebrew Competition.

This year's IPA competition brought in beers from all over the Bay Area. We'll be releasing the scaled up "Best in Show" IPA recipe in both West Coast and East Coast styles. The Local Brewers and homebrewers will be available for Q&A from 3pm - 5pm. Homebrewers will get special discounts on beers all day.

posts.title: 9th Annual Women Only Beer Tasting & Appreciation
posts.description:
Women who drink craft beer- this one's for you!

Devil’s Canyon Brewing Company invites you to its 9th annual SF Beer Week Women Only Beer Tasting at the brewery. Newbies to aficionados welcome, although the tasting is generally geared toward casual craft connoisseurs.

When we first began our Women Only Beer Tastings almost 10 years ago, men still dominated the craft beer (or any beer) market. Now, women ages 21-34 drink craft beer more frequently than the national average and represent 37% of craft beer consumption, according to a recent report by the Brewers Association. Come celebrate women and beer with us! Enjoy sampling beers in a casual setting among other like minded women and embrace the joy that is craft beer.

Explore a variety of styles, learn something new and maybe even surprise yourself. A blind tasting of 8+ beers from a variety of breweries will be led by Brewery owner Kristiann Garrett. The tasting will help you discover new beer, beer styles, flavors, complexities and styles. If it is anything like last year, you’ll likely find a new favorite!

Bring a friend and join us for one of our favorite SFBW traditions. Space is very limited, so buy your tickets today- this event sells out quickly.

Some light tasting snacks provided. Feel free to bring food with you or order in if you'd like to eat at the brewery, but be advised that table space is limited due to ALL THE BEER!

Attire: Comfy Casual- that includes sweats!

Please arrange transportation- we'll taste a lot of beer! Easy Caltrain access with 2 stations, each a mile away from the brewery (Redwood City or San Carlos Stations)

posts.title: Beer and Cheese Pairing
posts.description:
Triple Voodoo Brewery & Tap Room will be offering a unique opportunity to learn about pairing beer with cheese. Triple Voodoo's head brewer Phil Meeker will be creating a unique 4-flight cheese and beer pairing. Triple Voodoo beer experts and local cheese experts will be on hand during the event to guide you through the pairing and help educate you on the subject of pairing beer and cheese.

Your ticket includes a taster flight of four beers paired with four cheeses.

Tickets on sale now

posts.title: Faction Tap Takeover
posts.description:
We’ll be pouring these 5 Faction brews:

Hipster Conformant - 4.8% - Industrial Lager, our tribute to Hamm's this beer is light and sessionable. Perfect for unseasonably warm days.

Crosby, Stills, and Hash - 6.0% Strong Pale brewed with Amarillo, Simcoe, and Centennial Hop Hash a citrus finish that is balanced and drinkable.

Stratasbeer IPA - 6.4% - Single hop IPA brewed with a new hop from OR called Strata. Aroma driven hop with a nice citrus finish.

Keyser Soze - 10.5% - Russian Imperial Stout with a nice, rich finish. Cold brewed coffee from Equator was added to the beer to give it a balanced coffee nose.

Dont Tell Claudia IIIPA - 10% - Collaboration beer with Central Coast Brewing, this beer has Simcoe, Mosaic, and Citra, all in large quantities.

posts.title: The Bruery Tap Takeover
posts.description:
The Bruery has always had a special place in our hearts as one of the first breweries to show us how unique beer can be. From big barrel-aged strong ales to puckering sours, The Bruery has remained an innovative force in the world of beer. To celebrate their role in our passion we will be pouring multiple years of their anniversary brews alongside some other standouts we’ve had cellared away. The list includes:
2015 Rueuze
2016 Rueuze
2016 Tart of Darkness
2017 Tart of Darkness
Cuivre (2015 Anniv.)
Poterie (2016 Anniv.)
Saule (2017 Anniv.)
2017 White Chocolate
2017 Melange #3
2017 Sans Pagaie

posts.title: Beers, Bourbons and Bites
posts.description:
Sunday Funday has never been better!

Join us for Beers, Bourbons and Bites at Dirty Habit. Located on the 5th floor of Hotel Zelos.

Featuring brews and bourbons from Stone Brewing, Arrogant Brewing & Four Roses. Bites will be provided by Dirty Habit.

Steve Gonzalez, Senior Manager of Brewing and Innovation for Stone Brewing and Head Brewer for the soon to be open Napa Stone, will be in attendance to let you know all about the unique brews you'll be tasting.

Your $10 entry will go to benefit the Hotel Zelos charity partner, The SF Education Fund.

Sign up via Eventbrite: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/beers-bourbons-and-bites-tickets-42444900841

posts.title: Sour Sunday
posts.description: Featuring the best of the best Sour Beers and Sour Beers styles from around the country. Special bottle release of Fonteinen. 1 per customer

posts.title: Laughing Monk Belgium Night
posts.description: Laughing Monk from San Francisco is taking over our taps with their Belgian-style ales that are super pairable with our burgers and fries. We'll be pouring a Belgian single (Bayview Gold), dubbel (Evening Vesper), a tripel (Pluot Pulpit) and a quad (Red Vicar)!

posts.title: Ghost Town Brewing Horror Flicks & Beer Pairing
posts.description:
Join us and the folks from the Bay Area's most exciting new brewery for a night of horror flicks, spooky tunes, ghost stories, sweet treats, and more!

We will be hosting a tap takeover with Ghost Town Brewing out of Oakland, CA. The founders will be hanging with us and head banging to a curated playlist of their favorite tunes alongside horror films on our projector screen paired with their delicious beers!

We will also be hosting an intimate, candle-lit ghost story themed reading from local bay area poets and writers in our upstairs mezzanine.

Home made sweet treats are first come, first served.

Sample draught list: (subject to change)
~Helles Awaits Lager
~Hail Saison
~Locrian Pale
~Cat Horder Porter
~Death Rattle Double IPA
~Last Caress Triple IPA

posts.title: HenHouse Brewing ExtravaCANza
posts.description: ExtravaCANza with HenHouse Brewing. Since 2011, HenHouse has been cranking out awesome beers in an uncompromising and fearless pursuit of creating new and interesting kinds of delicious. At this special all can event at Southpaw, Henhouse Brewing will be featuring a variety of HenHouses most outstanding canned beers. Come taste through some of the delicious beers of this beloved Sonoma brewery.

posts.title: Ham Hocks & Triple Rocks: 4th Annual Hip Breaker Release
posts.description:
True story. One of the original owners had a pint and got inspired to paint a wall while standing on a ladder. He had an accident. A name for this beer was born. Triple Rock's Jeff Kimpe has been brewing it for us every year since then and releasing during beer week.

Since ham is basically the hip of the pig, our Head Chef / Owner, John Streit, has been inspired to create a dish to go along with this year's release of Hip Breaker. Come on by and feast on delicious swine and suds.

Join us every afternoon during SF Beer Week to help Kick the Keg. The draft beers from the previous night will be 50% off (while supplies last).

posts.title: Blue Plate Brewer’s Lunch
posts.description:
Our annual Brewer's Lunch is back! Join us on Monday 2/12, starting at 11:30am to kickoff our Blue Plate Lunch Special food and beer pairing, featuring delicious bites and incredible beer from Triple Rock Brewing, Drake's Brewing Co. and Faction Brewing.

Mingle with the brewers as you enjoy an actual soup, salad and sandwich, alongside a ridiculously dank flight of Faction's Hop Soup, Triple Rock's Hop Salad and Drake's Hop Sandwich IPAs. An affordable full meal with refined fare, you won’t find a better liquid luncheon in Berkeley. Ditch the office to enjoy this vanishing, wholesome American tradition, a filling combo that’ll still leave you functional for the afternoon.

Can't join us on Monday afternoon? We'll be offering this awesome Chow + Brau pairing throughout San Francisco Beer Week.

Malty Maven's Collabopalooza is back! We can't keep Melissa away from brewing for long before she starts itchin' to get her hands on some hoses and hops... wait, what?

posts.title: Dionysus Tap Takeover
posts.description: We're incredibly stoked to have Dionysus joining us for Beer Week this year! These guys are making some of the best beer in California at the moment, with a focus on sour and hoppy beers. We'll be filling as many taps as possible for this one.

posts.title: Munich Monday
posts.description: Munich Monday will showcase beer styles made popular by Munich. We're releasing 4 different styles of beer and serving up Bavarian-style pretzels.

posts.title: Double IPA Release
posts.description: It's not your mother's IPA.

posts.title: Meet The Maltsters @ Oak Barrel
posts.description:
Attention: Homebrewers! Want to learn more about malt? Interested in tasting some fresh, locally sourced grain?

Join us on for a special Meet The Maltsters event at one the Bay Area's finest beer institutions, Oak Barrel Winecraft in Berkeley! You'll get to talk shop with our maltsters and try samples of malt and beer. Plus, there will be plenty of snacks on hand!

Oak Barrel has been an integral part of the brewing community, helping and educating brewers for decades. Many professional Bay Area brewers, including our own founders, Ron Silberstein and Dave McLean, started out getting their homebrewing ingredients and supplies there as well. We're proud to be partnering with Bernie, Homer and the rest of the Oak Barrel team to provide more homebrewers and distillers with access to our malt.

posts.title: Meet the Brewer – Drake’s Brewing Co.
posts.description:
Join us as Drake's Brewing Company, the San Leandro-based brewery, pays us a visit and pours a selection of Drake's finest beers.

Throughout SFBW, we will have a rotating selection of brews on tap and by-the-bottle, and beer-friendly food.

posts.title: Imperial Mocha Shake Release Party
posts.description:
Our seasonal Mocha Shake Milk Chocolate Coffee Porter is the perfect balance between locally sourced coffee, chocolate, and milk sugar to create a unique flavor profile that is like dessert in a glass. We have decided to modify the recipe and kick it up a notch to create an Imperial version of this beer that will not only be higher in alcohol but also have an even more pronounced richness in flavor. We will be tapping this beer for the first time during SFBW so come and get it before it is all gone.

We will also be serving “porter ice cream floats” featuring ice cream from our friends from Humphry Slocombe.

posts.title: Suds and Sauce - Pizza Port Tap Takeover
posts.description: Orbit Room & Pizza Port team up to bring cocktails and beer together. We will be offering three of Pizza Ports specialty craft beers. We will create a tasting menu with beer cocktails and the beer itself along with a flatbread to match. Orbit Room's staff is ready to talk beer and we will have Pizza Port staff here as well. We will be bringing that So. Cal surf vibe to the middle of SF!

posts.title: East vs West with Dogfish Head and Drake's Brewing
posts.description:
Dogfish Head (Delaware) comes head-to-head with Drake's Brewing (San Leandro) for a night of their best brews. Who will win? You be the judge.

Dogfish Head Line-Up

120 Minute IPA- 15-20% ABV
-- Continuously hopped with a copious amount of high-alpha American hops throughout the boil and whirlpool, and then dry-hopped with another pallet of hops. Unfiltered and abundently hoppy, it's the Holy Grail for hopheads!

Wood Aged Bitches Brew- 9% ABV
-- Wood-Aged Bitches Brew is still the same bold, dark, Imperial Stout you know and love!

Liquid Truth Serum IPA- 6.8% ABV
-- You'll find the perfect match of citrusy and tropical notes, making for a zesty finish ... honest.

Seaquench Ale- 4.9% ABV
-- SeaQuench Ale is a session sour mash-up of a crisp Kolsch, a salty Gose, and a tart Berliner Weiss brewed in sequence with black limes, sour lime juice and sea salt.

Drake's Line-up

Hopocalypse Black Label Triple IPA- 12.5% ABV
-- What rough beast’s hour has come round at last? It’s Drake’s Hopocalypse Black Label — A Triple India Pale Ale.

Bourbon Barrel Aged Drakonic Imperial Stout- 11.3% ABV
-- Drake’s has taken their incredible Drakonic Imperial Stout and made it even better by aging it in bourbon barrels for an entire year.

Thizz Face NE-Style IPA w/ Rye- 7.3% ABV
-- Balances the thick mouthfeel of the un-malted rye with a stern addition of our dankest and most fruited hops.

Flyway Pilsner- 4.8% ABV
-- An Americanized version of a North German style pils. Hop forward with a dry, crisp body, this beer exhibits floral and spicy notes derived from the use of Vanguard, a domestic Noble hop.

posts.title: Phantom Carriage - Meet the Brewer & Tap Takeover

posts.title: 'Swill + Swell' Beer Pairing
posts.description:
When we’re not in our brewing overalls, with their Pollock splatter of yeast and hop matter, we like to think we clean up well. So please join us for our keystone event of SF Beer Week: a night of swilling inventive beers cleverly paired with some of the best food in the country, all while enjoying live jazz and sunset over the swells of the Bay.

We are fortunate to be joined by our friend Sharon Li, executive chef at Press – a Michelin reviewed farm-to-table steakhouse in the heart of the Napa Valley – who will take us on a culinary tour of taste memories from her childhood. Chef Sharon is coming off an insane year in which her restaurant was selected as one of OpenTable’s top 100 restaurants in America and received glowing reviews from Michelin. Specializing in nose-to-tail cooking and traditional fermentation and pickling techniques, Chef Sharon Li pairs elevated comfort food with the fresh and inventive beers brewed by the brother-sister team at Armistice Brewing Company for a taste experience that will amuse your bouche and foxtrot maniacally across your palate.

But this sensory experience is for more than your mouth; we’ll have live jazz to charm your earholes and the most stunning panoramic views in the Bay that might just make your eyeballs explode in your skull. The Craneway Pavilion is simply the most beautiful waterfront venue in the region, and sunset is when it really shines. Enjoy the views of ocean, cities, and bridges as the final light seeps out the sky and the city turns to diamonds at night from this historic venue. Built in 1931 as the Ford Assembly plant, the Craneway later served as a process plant during WWII, when Richmond was home to Rosie the Riveter and the most prolific Kaiser Shipyard in America. The Craneway is a fine showcase of what makes us proud to call Richmond home.

But it gets better: this all-you-can-eat and all-you-can-drink event includes your very own fancy glass and a cash bar (if you’re the type that likes their sundowner in cocktail form). Brewers Alex and Gregory will dive into their process and the magic behind Chef Sharon’s pairings. Monday never tasted so good, and with free-flowing beers, you might just want to take off the rest of the week.

Due to the specific nature of this event, dietary restrictions cannot be accommodated.

Ages 21+

Tickets on sale now!

posts.title: The Booth Brewing - Korean Craft Total Tap Takeover
posts.description:
Before becoming the first Asian craft brewery to operate in the United States in May 2017, The Booth Brewing Co. started off as a small pizza pub in an alleyway of Gyeonglidan Avenue in Seoul, Korea in May 2013. Its three founders at the time were still working full time as Korean medical doctor, financial analyst, and Economist correspondent. But with their love of craft beer and the ambition to create a “booth” where young-minded people can gather to change the world, The Booth was born.

Since its humble beginning, The Booth broke conventional industry boundaries and led the creation of a healthy and exciting drinking culture that is true to its core philosophy – Follow your fun – that resonates with the zeitgeist of the younger generation. From the release of Tae(dong)gang Pale Ale – South Korea’s triumphant answer to North Korea’s Taedonggang beer – and hosting one of the largest beer festivals in Asia, to launching the first 100% refrigerated beer distribution system in Korea, The Booth has transformed the Korean craft beer scene, and even earned the founders a spot in Forbes 30-Under-30 Asia list.

Fast-forward to today, The Booth US is getting ready to make history in the biggest craft beer market in the world. Our mix of fun-based philosophy, unique artwork, and cutting-edge quality beer has already been attracting the mouths and hearts of many craft beer lovers and even non-enthusiasts. The best part is that our journey has truly just begun!

DRAFT LINEUP:
- Kukmin IPA
- EurekaSeoul Hop Ale (Hazy IPA)
- Dancing Cow Milk Stout
- Pilgrim’s Porter
- City Hippy Wit (Orange+Korean Tangerine+Coriander)
- Fun Follower Wit (lemongrass+peppercorn)
- Great God of Fun Red Ale

...check back as we'll be updating this often

Join us every afternoon during SF Beer Week to help Kick The Keg. The draft beers from the previous night will be 50% off (while supplies last!)

posts.title: Won't You Be My Neighbor
posts.description:
Join us for an evening hang out session with some of our fave nearby brewers and taste all their goods in one place. ODM's neighbors in the 'hood and in the industry have been really great to us and we're stoked to feature them on our tap list throughout the year and at this special event. We'll be featuring fresh kegs from our good friends, including:

* Barebottle - Doom Bloom 2018 - 10.4% ABV - hazy New England style Triple IPA

* Triple Voodoo - Imperial Mocha Shake Porter - 8% ABV - rich milk chocolate coffee porter made with lactose, conditioned on vanilla beans, TCHO chocolate cocoa nibs, & Sightglass coffee

* Old Bus Tavern - Gallagher's Best Lager - 5.5% ABV - made with 100% Admiral Malting's Gallagher's Best malt & lightly hopped w/ Hallertau and Equinox

* Temescal Wonder Why - 6.5% - hazy IPA w/ Simcoe, Citra, and Loral hops

* Laughing Monk - Pluot Pulpit - ??ABV - Belgian tripel with pluots

* Freewheel
--- On cask: English IPA specially dry hopped with TBD trendy hops!
--- On draft: Mind The Gap IPA - 6.8% ABV - big English style IPA finished with citrusy American hops

* Ferment Drink Repeat - Juicy Beast NEIPA - 6% ABV - hazy IPA fermented with Vermont yeast and hopped with Citra, Mosiac, and El Dorado

* Standard Deviant - Altbier - 5.6% ABV - German style amber ale that's lagered to be extra smooth

* Fort Point - Galaxy Park - 4.7% ABV - a special edition of FP's wonderful pale hoppy wheat but dry hopped with Galaxy

We'll have happy hour prices going until 6PM for everyone and all night for service industry folks ($1 off all pints & house cocktails). Our other beer handles will be pouring awesome sloppy seconds from our weekend sour beer events. Don't forget, we also do cocktails and have a full menu of NOLA-influenced bites. Yum!

~~ The rest of our 20 beer handles will be pouring awesome sloppy seconds from our weekend sour beer events. Don't forget, we also do cocktails and have a full menu of NOLA-influenced bites. Yum!

posts.title: Brewer V Brewer: Collaboration Beer Dinner with Drake’s & HenHouse
posts.description:
Join Drake’s Brewing and Henhouse Brewing for an epic beer dinner battle royale, and the debut of their new smoked imperial stout collaboration beer, Fowl Play V: No Styles No Masters. You will determine which brewmaster paired the best beers with Chef Taylor’s four course prix-fixed menu.

The event will begin with a “beer hour” to relax and schmooze with Drake’s Brewmaster John Gillooly and Henhouse Brewmaster Collin McDonnell. Then during the dinner each Brewmaster will present their best beer to pair with each course. Taste the beers side by side with the food and then cast your vote. Who will be the winner? It’s entirely up to you!

The price includes 4-courses, 7 beer pairings, brews during the “beer hour,” a private dining experience, and an open discussion session with the brewers. Service fees, tax, and gratuity are included. Limited seating will be available.

MENU

Schmooze it Up

posts.title: Barebottle Brewing Beer Dinner
posts.description:
Some of you may have noticed a new brewery on tap around the city, and Bar Crudo is very excited to have them in our house for our annual beer dinner during SF Beer Week 2018.

Barebottle Brewing just opened less then 2 years ago at the end of Cortland in Bernal Heights, and is brewing up some of the best beers in SF. They create a varied selection of beers from juicy, tropical IPA’s to a crisp, mineral driven Kolsch that pair perfectly with oysters and crudo.

Our chefs Mike Selvera and Melissa Perfit will be matching some of these creative beers in a 5 course beer dinner. We will have our friend, and Barebottle’s representative Pine Watt here with us to introduce all the beer selections for that night, share some ideas of how the brewery got started, and how the magic gets in their beer.

As always, we will begin with an extra beer by our featured brewery for our beer social at 6:30pm, and we will be seated for dinner shortly after.

We are looking forward to celebrating Beer Week 2018, and we hope to see some new, and familiar faces joining us.

For reservations, please sign up for the event here, email: info AT barcrudo DOT com, or call the restaurant at 415-409-0679.

posts.title: Hops Class: Lecture & Tasting
posts.description:
SCVB welcomes NYC craft beer pioneer and owner of Brooklyn's Bitter & Esters Homebrew and Brew On Premises, John LaPolla, who will be explaining everything you've always wanted to know about hops.

Hops are wonderfully diverse and are used for multiple purposes. Each variety imparts a uniquely different scent and flavor – from spicy, citrusy, pine-like, earthy to floral. Learn how hops are used for flavoring, bittering, and preserving beer and leave with a deeper appreciation for the world of hops. Afterwards we will taste four beer samples and discuss the hops role in the flavor profile of each beer.

posts.title: Brew Free! or Dine Beer Dinner
posts.description:
What happens when three brewmasters with a love for fine food get together during SF Beer Week? Join us on Monday, Feb. 12, to find out!

We are honored to be joined by James Beard award-winner Garrett Oliver, brewmaster of Brooklyn Brewery and author of the Brewmaster's Table, and Gordon Schuck, co-founder and head brewer of Funkwerks in Fort Collins, CO. 21st Amendment Brewery's very own co-founder and brewmaster, Shaun O'Sullivan, will be the host for the evening, and the three dapper gents will walk you through a delicious and thoughtfully curated dinner featuring many courses and (obviously) delicious beer pairings to tickle your taste buds.

In addition to good company and a meal you won't want to miss, there will be live music and special surprises along the way. Cheers!

posts.title: Beer Cocktail Showdown

$20 gets you a taste of each cocktail, voting rights to choose your favorite and...a jerky pouch (because you need a little something to nibble between cocktails). Every Monday should be like this.

posts.title: Home Brew Competition - Brew with Sierra, Social, More
posts.description:
Attention Home Brewers! The Richmond Republic Draught House will be hosting a home brew competition in honor of SF Beer Week 2018. Head Brewers from Triple Voodoo, Social Kitchen & Brewery, Pine Street, beer judge Jewels Holiday, and Brewcrafts own Andre Sanchez will be judging, and be onsite from 7pm til midnight.

Categories will include Best Ale, Specialty Brew, and Lager. Winner of each category will receive a trophy and their own mug on the wall at the Draught House worth hundreds of dollars of free beers. The winner of Best Overall will get to spend a day brewing with either the crew at Lagunitas, Social Kitchen, or attend Beer Camp at Sierra Nevada this August!

To enter, submit 22oz of beer, in up to two categories in unlabeled bottles to the Richmond Republic Draught House, 642 Clement st. before 8pm Monday 2/12. Winners will be announced at 11:30pm that night. We'll be pouring flights from Triple Voodoo, Social Kitchen, and Pine Street all night long.

Any questions, please email David at richmondrepublicsf AT gmail DOT com

Good Luck!

posts.title: Her Majesty's Crush: Special Release
posts.description:
Join us as we release two special versions of Her Majesty's Crush Old Ale! Enjoy a side by side tasting of these incredible heavy hitters, aged in two different barrels.

Her Majesty's Crush Old Ale - 12.68% ABV
This complex provision ale has had quite a journey! Conceived in 2016, this hearty, nuanced brew has the highest quality English pale malt as its base and is finely tuned like an old violin with carefully selected English character malts. Hops include German Magnum and U.K East Kent Goldings. It was fermented and cold-conditioned for eight weeks, then matured in Caribbean Estate Rum barrels for eight months. Expect notes of oak, vanilla, toffee and brown sugar.

Her Majesty's Crush Old Ale with Figs - 11.25% ABV
We brewed a second batch of our Old Ale with Moylan's Head Brewer, Derek Smith. Derek suggested a second fermentation with locally grown figs. We barrel aged this version in George Dickel Rye Whiskey barrels. Expect notes of dark fruit, caramel, honey and spice.

Entry is free, beer costs money. Must be 21+ to purchase and consume alcohol. Check out our full lineup of San Francisco Beer Week events at http://www.triplerock.com/calendar/

posts.title: Barebottle / 101 North / Brewcraft
posts.description:
Our beer week Tuesday starts off with an 101 North beer (Hopium IPA, High gravity double IPA, Indigo blue agave pale ale, or Dorstlager helles), burger and fries for $13, or flight plus burger and fries for $18 from 11:30 - 3pm We're one stop along 101 North -Clement Street Takevoer and Crawl Luncheon!

We'll be pouring the 101 North flight all night, along with a Barebottle flight including recipes from two amateur brewers, featuring pale ales made with exclusive hops. You get to vote for which beer gets made by Barebottle. We are one of a group of Pop up polling places taking place this beer week.

Finally, SF Brewcraft will have an exhibit on the process of home brewing. Smell hops, taste grains, touch equipment, and learn about a new potential passion in your life. Andre Sanchez will be answering questions from 7-9pm.

posts.title: Bigfoot Vertical
posts.description: Barleywine fans unite! Here at Sierra Nevada we’ve been brewing our Bigfoot Barleywine Style Ale since 1983 and love to cellar a few kegs each year. Join us at the Torpedo Room for a Bigfoot vertical on tap, featuring Bigfoot 2009 through 2018 (forgive us if we miss a year or two in the middle).

posts.title: Drink SF-Brewed IPAs for Firefighters
posts.description:
Why not put your drinking to good use this SFBW? Drink 10 fresh, SF-brewed IPAs from the best SF breweries around town in support of the California Fire Foundation.

This amazing non-profit organization provides emotional and financial assistance to families of fallen firefighters, firefighters and the communities they protect. This charitable event is a great way to try special release, SF-brewed IPAs all in one place, and give back at the same time. A portion of proceeds from the sale of these IPAs over the course of the ENTIRE DAY will go to this community-based, non-profit organization. ca.firefoundation.org

Confirmed breweries as of 1/12/18:
Local
Barebottle
Cellarmaker
Fort Point
Harmonic
Magnolia
Social Kitchen
ThirstyBear

posts.title: Nuclear Meltdown on Dempsey
posts.description:
Kicking off SFBW 2018 with El Segundo Brewing Company as they bring us some of their tasty hop forward beers. We will be tapping the following

- Power Plant TIPA
- Nuclear Power Plant TIPA
- Blurred Lines Hybrid IPA
- Cerveza Fresca IPA (Hazy w/ Guava)

posts.title: Fresh Beer Tasting and Tour
posts.description: Taste beer straight from the source. Brite tank tasting with a tour only $5! You just can't get beer any fresher than this!

posts.title: Beers around the Bay

posts.title: 2nd Annual Sour Power

We will be showcasing beers from: Almanac, AleSong, Cascade, Council, Grimm, Jester King, Jolly Pumpkin, Lost Abbey, Mraz, Phantom Carriage, The Bruery, The Rare Barrel, Urban Family and MORE!

posts.title: Galentines Day Happy Hour Beer Cocktails
posts.description: Grab your best gal pals and treat yourselves to a special SF Beer Week happy hour featuring craft beer cocktails and signature house spirited cocktails, fit for noble land mermaids and self-rescuing princesses. Enjoy our dazzling waterfront sunset views with your wifey squad.

posts.title: Mission Cheese Beer Pairing
posts.description:
Harmonic and Mission Cheese are pairing up again to bring you an amazing pairing to rock your taste buds! Head Cheese Monger Alex is going to be in house again, dishing out the cheesy goods while we get you set up with a beer pairing. There will be 3 cheeses and 3 beers included with each pairing, along with a suggested 4th pairing, sold separately in-house.

We will have a Raclette Machine in house and covering roasted potatos with the gooey french cheese!

There will be 2 opportunities to listen to our head brewer Eddie Gobbo, and head monger Alex Armstrong discusss the pairings and the complexity behind the individual ingredients as well. Talks take place at 5-7pm. Feel free to ask as many questions as you would like through this process, they are the pros!

Food: Mission Cheese 4pm-9pm

posts.title: 6th Annual Double and Triple IPA Festival
posts.description:
We will be tapping as many as 12 limited, seasonal, and hard-to-find double and triple IPAs on draught.

We will be dispensing this over hopped goodness from 3 locations within the bar. Main bar, lounge, and beer garden, so check back here to locate where your beer is being poured.

Of course big beer means proper sustinence to soak it all up with. Free BBQ for SFBW participants. Purchase a SFBW beer and get a ticket for the free BBQ. Limited quantities so get here early to guarantee a plate.

***Beer List Coming Soon***
We will updating and curating the beer list all the way up until the day of the event.

The StandBy was established in 2009. We work hard to feature local vendors, in both spirits and beers. We only use house made mixes and fresh juices. We have a passion for cocktails and beer.

21 and over only please.

Drakes (Black Label will be here!)

posts.title: Taster Tuesday
posts.description:
Taster Tuesday is a celebration of adventure, flavor and community.
Togetherness is a great reason to venture over to The Ave and tickle your
beer taste buds.

Heretic Brewing Company - It's not heresy to push the boundaries of beer
flavors. Be Brave as you experience "Cruel Beauty, be Bold as you take on
an "Empire, or experience the "Bitter Truth of ale with many more flavors
in the extraordinary world of Heretic Beers.

Pine Street - Fall in love at first smell with Pine Street Brews. Celebrate
togetherness and communities as you sample a Pale Ale "Atom Splitter" or
introduce yourself to a Raspberry Blonde "Red Head". This is a great
opportunity to find great alternatives to everyday ales.

Figueroa Mountains Brewery- Join the "Fig-Fam" and their deep love of good
craft beer. Be adventurous as you enjoy finest quality ingredients to
satisfy every palate. Watch out for the tropical bite of "Lizard's Mouth
IIPA" or feel the rush of "Hurricane Deck DIPA" just to name a few.....

Iron Springs - Let the flavors of hand crafted beer come alive in your
mouth. Quaff a nice cold "Vanilla Latte Porter" "David HAZElhoff" or try on
a "Silk Smoking Jacket" and don't forget to bring all your friends for
"Quad Goals"! and all the other wonderful beers on tap.

posts.title: SDA/Locals Only presents The Brewer Games
posts.description:
Join us for the first of our TWO events for SF Beer Week 2018: The Self Distribution Alliance (SDA) Brewers Games! What better way to celebrate our beer culture cultivated here in the East Bay then to spend some quality times with the beers and the folks responsible for brewing these magical elixirs; concocted right here in our beloved Bay?

We love independent beer here at The Albany Taproom; these folks not only make the beer, but deliver the kegs to our doors. When asked to host a Locals Only event like this, we jumped at the chance! Chat with brewers, learn a thing or two about the entire life of the beer in your glass, from start to finish, and let’s toast each other on a job well done!

Featuring Ale Industries, Alameda Island Brewing Co., Ghost Town, Oakland United and Federation.

posts.title: Seismic Brewing – Entropy IIPA Release Party & Tap Takeover
posts.description:
The new kids from Sonoma County, Seismic Brewing Company, will release their 1st Imperial IPA (Entropy) during SF Beer Week. Come meet the brewing team and be among the first to try this limited release at Creek Monkey. Not an Imperial IPA fan? No worries. This tap takeover will also feature several other great styles from Seismic: Liquifaction Kolsch, Namazu OPA, and Shatter Cone IPA.

Entropy Imperial IPA is malty, hoppy, aromatic, robust, and hedonistic.  Featuring two different rye malts and a healthy dose of rich Vienna malt, the full bodied monster does not disappoint.  Caramel and peppery rye flavors create a strong background to the hops, which are classically reminiscent of pine and citrus - with a sneaky addition of Nelson Sauvin hops to keep things interesting.  At a bracing 75 IBU and 8.5% ABV, this winter warmer aims to satisfy hop heads and malt lovers alike.  This is the Imperial IPA your mother warned you about.

These sausages will be available to order along with the respective Saison pairing. Or, bring a friend and order the whole package - all three Saisons with all three Sausages.

posts.title: Three's Company:  21st Amendment/Brooklyn Brewery/Funkwerks
posts.description:
There is magic in the number three.  Three esteemed breweries hailing from different parts of the country forged a relationship and it is our good fortune to hold a sipping session while releasing beers never available in these parts before.  Come knock on our door and welcome:  Brooklyn Brewery, Funkwerks, and 21st Amendment. 

Shaun O'Sullivan, a mighty fine soul, has been a good friend to City Beer since he sat on our barstools early years.  We are honored to host 21st Amendment along with Brooklyn Brewery and Funkwerks.  You'll be pleased to know the characters behind the brew kettle will be sipping at the bar, come and knock on our door and say "hello".

Garrett Oliver, Brewmaster, Brooklyn Brewery
Shaun O'Sullivan, Brewmaster, 21st Amendment
Gordon Schuck, Brewmaster, Funkwerks 

Delicious beers you can count on will be offered on draft and in the bottle...

Funkwerks:
-Pineapple Provincial Saison

-Sour Sop

Brooklyn Brewery
-Brooklyn Lager

We are Going to take Fat Tuesday and turn into a Mexican Mardi Gras! We will have Tacos, Made by Chef Hinojosa; Tequila and beer pairings, Mezcal Micheladas, and Molé & Orange Stout Cocktails!

posts.title: Uptown Funk: Beer & Cheese Pairing
posts.description:
Tickets now on sale!

Butterfat & barley, sitting in a tree... Drake’s Barrel Program Manager Travis Camacho will team up with local cheesemaking teacher and "It's Not You, It's Brie" author Kirstin Jackson to take you on a journey through beer and cheese magic. You'll learn how they’re made, what styles of beer & cheese pair best, hear a story or two, and leave with the power to pair your own at home. Think chèvre, buttery triple cremes, pungent blues, barrel-aged rarities, funky sours…. and a limited release or two. Grab a friend or bring a date to Drake's Broadway location for a cheese and beer love fest.

Private event, limited seating available. Ticket includes one (1) 4oz pour of all 5 different specialty barrel-aged & sour beers, paired with 5 unique cheeses. Tax and gratuity included.

- Ariana Saison with our Admiral Pils malt and Ariana hops
- Denali Double IPA with our Gallagher's Best malt and Denali hops
- Enigma IPA with our Maiden Voyage malt and Enigma hops
