posts.title: Magic in a Bottle w. Barebottle Brewery
posts.description: An official voting site for Barebottle's Homebrew competition. There will be 2 pale ales that will be voted on for the next homebrew winner. We will also be showcasing other excellent Barebottle Brews.

posts.title: Moonraker Tap Takeover
posts.description:
Moonraker Brewing just won RateBeer’s best new beer for Yojo IPA, best new brewery in California and was named the ninth best new brewery worldwide. We've managed to pick up some great beers from them and will be tapping them today at 4pm.

Tap & Can list to be confirmed

posts.title: Anchor & Hope Shrimp Boil
posts.description: Join us for Anchor & Hope's annual Shrimp Boil! All-you-can-eat shrimp and all-you-can-drink draft beer for $40. This year, we are partnering with three local breweries: Anchor Brewing, ThirstyBear and SF Brew Co. The event will be offered in two seatings: the first from 5:00-7:00 and the second from 7:30-9:30. Make your reservations online or over the phone 415.501.9100. It's a party that can't be missed!

posts.title: Passionate By Design: Brewery Rex and Yeast of Eden Sipping Session
posts.description:
One of the great pleasures of our job is working with old friends on new projects. We had the privilege of collaborating with Tyler King once upon a time on a beer and are beyond happy to host Tyler along with his partner Brian White during SFBW as they launch their new brewing house Brewery Rex. Brian and Tyler both come from a storied background in the brewing world, and you would be remiss if you did not saddle up for a few ye old brewing tales. Joining Brewey Rex is the new sour and wild project Yeast of Eden, an excellent addition to the collection of passionate breweries we find in our fertile California land. You will find us pouring a smattering of selections from both breweries on draft with bonus bottle options to pack for home.
Tyler King and Brian White will be barside and ready to chat.

posts.title: North Coast vs Sudwerk
posts.description: Come try new releases and favorites from North Coast Brewing Co. and Sudwerk Brewery.

posts.title: Uinta + New Belgium = Connecting Flights
posts.description:
Take a hop--from citrusy IPA's to Barrel-Aged Sours!
Uinta Brewing:
Grapefruit HOP NOSH IPA
Tangerine HOP NOSH IPA
Cahoots (Flander's Red)
New Belgium:
La Folie Sour Brown Ale

posts.title: Barrel Aged Beers
posts.description: A style showcase of beers that have been aged in barrels.

posts.title: Woods Islay IPA Release
posts.description: What's better than a fresh-brewed, sticky strong, citrus-and-pine-packed double IPA? A fresh-brewed, sticky strong, citrus-and-pine-packed double IPA — infused with peat from Laphroaig barrel aging! Beer hounds and whisky snobs, unite!

posts.title: Woods Islay IPA Release
posts.description: What's better than a fresh-brewed, sticky strong, citrus-and-pine-packed double IPA? A fresh-brewed, sticky strong, citrus-and-pine-packed double IPA — infused with peat from Laphroaig barrel aging! Beer hounds and whisky snobs, unite!

posts.title: Hops & Haze: New Glory Brewing Tap Takeover
posts.description:
Lovers of hops and haze unite and indulge your inner (and outer) hophead! We will be featuring fresh draughts from one of our favorite new breweries out of Sacramento, CA.

Sample Draught List: (subject to change)
~Make it Rain IPA
~Galactic Worms IPA
~Dankatronics DIPA
~Greenergy DIPA
~Wake Me Up Before You Cocoa (milk stout)

posts.title: Barebottle Tap Takeover
posts.description:
Come on in for flights or full pours of the fantastic beer selection offered from San Francisco's own Barebottle.
Specials on appetizers and beers until 7:00, or until the beer runs out. Divisadero Art Walk is also happening tonight, so make a crawl of it!

posts.title: HenHouse Flies the Coop!
posts.description: HenHouse joins us at Naked Lunch to party for Beer Week! They'll be showcasing fun stuff like their Golden Strong Belgian, a Beer Week Special collab w/ Ol Republic, Saison, Nitro Oyster Stout, Stoked! Pale, & the Deep State IPA. Do it!

posts.title: Drake’s Cellar Release
posts.description:
Join us at Drake's Barrel House on Thursday, February 15th for your chance to claim a piece of our funky, sour and barrel-aged collection! We're bringing out the good stuff, (like that whiskey your grandma saves for special occasions) including your favorite Barrel House Reserve Series bottles, our most recently corked options and a few favorites from the archives. We're diving deep into our dusty cellar to pull out the rarest, most coveted creations we've ever brewed. This will be the only time our cellar is completely open to the public, so don't miss out!

Barrel Program Manager Travis Camacho will be on hand to chat barrels and bugs, as well as provide insider information about the 89 Club, our barrel-aged membership program. Not only will club members receive exclusive access to all barrel-aged brews for growler fills during all of 2018, membership also includes signature '89 Club glassware, access to Barrel Reserve beers one week before the general public, members-only events, free VIP upgrades at select brewery events and first right of acceptance for 2019 membership. Be among the first folks to know about beer releases, events, and breaking news.

More information about the '89 Club available on our website at https://drinkdrakes.com/barrelhouse/89-club/. Stay tuned for Cellar Release Sale bottle list (which will include Cherryland and the NEW Drakonic Black Label). Availability will be highly limited so mark your calendars now and don't miss out on the fun!

posts.title: Extra Sprinkles – Vegan Donut and Beer Flight Night
posts.description:
Vegans, get ready: we’ve got an epic evening in store. To spotlight our brand-new beer flights, we’re teaming up with Oakland’s own Vegan Donut Gelato for a pairing extravaganza, with a flight of four of our beers each matched with a half-donut from their collection (while supplies last).

If that’s not enough donut goodness, we’ll also have a special donut-themed cask beer available for one night only. And to prevent any sugar crashes, Sumaq Peruvian will be in the house, serving up their bomb-ass vegan Peruvian food. Omnivores are welcome too—come try something new!

posts.title: Danville Meet the Brewer
posts.description: Danville Brewing Co. will be joining us for a mini tap takeover and meet the brewer! Have you tried their award winning Imperial IPA yet? Now's the time! Plus, Matt will be on hand to give you more insight on his brewing techniques. This is going to be a fun night!

posts.title: Woods Islay IPA Release
posts.description: What's better than a fresh-brewed, sticky strong, citrus-and-pine-packed double IPA? A fresh-brewed, sticky strong, citrus-and-pine-packed double IPA — infused with peat from Laphroaig barrel aging! Beer hounds and whisky snobs, unite!

posts.title: Humble Sea Tap Takeover & Meet the Brewers
posts.description:
Meet the crew from one of Santa Cruz's newest and most exciting breweries!
Tap list tba

posts.title: Seismic Brewing – Entropy IIPA Release Party & Tap Takeover
posts.description:
The new kids from Sonoma County, Seismic Brewing Company, will release their 1st Imperial IPA (Entropy) during SF Beer Week. Come meet the brewing team and be among the first to try this Limited Release at Louie's Bar. Not an Imperial IPA fan? No worries. This tap takeover will also feature several other great styles from Seismic, including Deep Tectonic Imperial Stout.

Entropy Imperial IPA is malty, hoppy, aromatic, robust, and hedonistic.  Featuring two different rye malts and a healthy dose of rich Vienna malt, the full bodied monster does not disappoint.  Caramel and peppery rye flavors create a strong background to the hops, which are classically reminiscent of pine and citrus - with a sneaky addition of Nelson Sauvin hops to keep things interesting.  At a bracing 75 IBU and 8.5% ABV, this winter warmer aims to satisfy hop heads and malt lovers alike.  This is the Imperial IPA your mother warned you about.

posts.title: West Coast Beer Bash
posts.description: Four West Coast breweries --New Glory, Ex Novo, Kern River, and Boneyard -- will be offering two rare or new brews each to be offered as a part of a limited flight available at the bar. Brews are limited and will only be offered during this event. Don't miss these rare beers!

posts.title: Altamont Beer Works Night
posts.description:
Altamont Beer Works takes over the bar as part of our San Francisco Beer Week festivities! Free Altamont Beer Works glassware while supplies and a free raffle at 7:00 p.m. for Altamont Beer Works cooler, growlers, hats, mugs and tin signs!

We'll be pouring:

Hella Hoppy IIPA
Lupulin Advisory DIPA
Mocha Something New Imperial Stout
Scarcity IIIPA
Smoke N Dank IIIPA

....plus more TBA!

posts.title: BrettFest Sour Night ft. All Brett Lineup
posts.description:

posts.title: Zeitgeist’s Fruit Phenomenon – California Exclusive Premiere

This band is dance music for when you are feeling right and you wanna feel so fine. This band will make you clutch your heart. This band will make you move your feet. posts.title: Smitten Ice Cream – IPA Ice Cream Collaboration
posts.description:
IPA Ice Cream - that's right ... an IPA Ice Cream! We've been working with our friends at Smitten Ice Cream to develop a one of a kind flavor - IPA.

You've seen other beer flavored ice creams, but we doubt you've tried anything hoppy. Instead of simply adding beer to ice cream, the chefs at Smitten have built up the IPA flavor from the same base ingredients that we use in our IPAs.

Smitten will be in our tap room with their mobile nitrogen cart, churning up some hoppy goodness. We'll be serving IPA Ice Cream, beer floats and have pints of ice cream to go. You don't want to miss this.

posts.title: Dustbowl Brewing: Special Release-Maple Coffee Black Blizzard-Russian Imp. Stout
posts.description:
Join us for the pouring an exclusive, small-batch Maple Coffee Black Blizzard-Russian Imperial Stout. This is the first time it's being released outside the brewery and it will only be at The Halford for SF Beer Week.

We will also have the GABF gold medal winner Public Enemy - Baltic Porter on tap. This style originated in the region bordering the Baltic Sea and is a take-off on English porters. Originally an ale, brewers in the region switched over to Lager yeast making this big, dark beer extremely smooth and chocolaty. It lacks the roast bitterness of a stout but has layers of chocolate, coffee, caramel, perhaps toffee and a wine-like finish.

There will also be a fresh batch of Confused Therapist. And we'll also be pouring Fruit Tramp-Kettle Sour and Change Order IPA.

We'll also have a small bites food menu for the event.

posts.description:
Experience Livermore's growing craft beer scene among the bustling nightlife of Downtown Livermore. Join us as downtown restaurants, tap rooms and other watering holes, showcase the beers of our cities 4 great breweries: Altamont Beer Works, Eight Bridges Brewing, Shadow Puppet Brewing Company and Working Man Brewing Company will be taking over the taps in Downtown Livermore!

Try local Livermore beer at spots like Beer Baron, First Street Alehouse, The Banks Vault, Railroad Saloon, Tap 25 Craft Beer Livermore, Beach Hut Deli Livermore, Sauced BBQ & Spirits Sanctuary Ultra Lounge, Backyard Bayou Livermore, The Venue - Livermore, Cravings Stone Fired Pizza and Pasta, Patxi's Livermore, Aviation - Rooftop Bar and Kitchen , The Riata Diner And Tavern, Demitri's Taverna & more.

We are collecting food for the Alameda County Food Bank that night with collection barrels at most locations. So come check out these great craft beer spots in downtown Livermore.

This event is being sponsored by Blue Brew Bus and Livermore Valley Craft Beer. The Blue Brew Bus will be giving rides up and down 1st Street that night. More information to come.

So come check out these great craft beer spots in downtown Livermore.

For more information, please follow us on Facebook & Instagram @livermorevalleycraftbeer.
posts.admission: Free, Buy beer as you go.

posts.title: SF Beer Week NightLife
posts.description:
Celebrate SF Beer Week with a froth-filled evening of brews and science!

Sip your way through a pop-up beer garden with dozens of local breweries, pick up tips on the art of home brewing, and check out fascinating talks and demos by local brewers.

Plus, be sure to treat your tastebuds to NightLife’s signature craft beer Aliciella Bitter, brewed by Magnolia Brewing Co. with plant types found on the museum’s living roof.

Full event lineup coming soon!

**Please Note**
Beer tasting tickets are available for purchase in African Hall. No cash will be accepted at tasting tables throughout the museum, only beer tickets.

Beer Ticket Prices:
$2 for 1 ticket
1-2 tickets for 3-ounce taste
4-5 tickets for 12-ounce full beer
Beer pricing varies at each tasting table

About NightLife:
Every Thursday night, the California Academy of Sciences transforms into San Francisco’s most popular cultural night spot—a lively venue filled with science, music, creatures and cocktails—as visitors ages 21+ get a chance to explore the museum after dark from 6-10 pm.

posts.title: Cerveza y Paella – ThirstyBear’s Ultimate Paella Organic Beer Fiesta
posts.description:

Enjoy unlimited paella Valenciana (saffron infused rice, tomato sofrito, chicken, chorizo, clams, mussels, calamari, rockfish, Spanish red peppers and peas), seasonal vegetarian paella and a seasonal mixed salad with ThirstyBear organic beers and the SF Brewers Guild collaborative beer. All the beers you want, live flamenco guitar and paella -- it doesn’t get any better than this! This event sells out every year, so get your tickets now.

$40/person.

Tickets on sale now!

posts.title: S'More Beer at Gilman Brewing: an REI Adventure
posts.description: Come on out to Gilman Brewing Company for a culinary adventure that blends the relaxing atmosphere of the REI Basecamp with a unique twist on a campfire classic. You'll be toasting gourmet marshmallows over a campfire, building three different camp desert delicacies, and pairing each with a distinct craft microbrew that has been selected by the experts at Gilman Brewing Company. A bartender will guide you through the entire experience, discussing each pairing and treating you to everything you ever wanted to know about beer (and s'mores). You will never look at chocolate and marshmallows the same way again. Participants must be 21+ years of age to participate.

posts.title: Second Annual Star Wars Beer Fest
posts.description: The dark side made us do it...again! All your favorite characters will be here. Wear a costume and get free beer. Come you will , drunk you will be.

$1 from every beer sold will go to Larkin Street Youth Services to support the health and wellness of youth in our community.

Visit our website for more details.
www.thesaratogasf.com

posts.title: North Beach Beer 'Rendez-Brew' and History Pub Crawl
posts.address: Meet At Church Key, 1402 Grant Avenue (@ Green)
posts.description:
SF Adventure Tours and Pubcast Worldwide team up to bring the baddest "Rendezbrew" of SF Beer Week - the North Beach History Beer Crawl.

We will meet up at Church Key for a pint, then start our historical drinking walk (or maybe drinking historical walk?) through one of San Francisco's richest neighborhoods for history and booze. We will hit up Rogue Ales Public House and then finish up at beat favorite the Vesuvio.

On the way we will meet great folks, check out some odd sights (like the church rectory with a devilish address) hear some weird stories (like what is in the time capsule under Washington Square) and do San Francisco history and beer-related trivia for prizes.

It's all FREE but please visit the event website to check in and drop a quick RSVP so we have an idea of how may folks to expect.

posts.title: Pilsner Urquell Netfiltrovany Special Release
posts.description: Rare, fresh Kellerbier keg, flown specially from Pilsner Urquell Brewery in Czech Republic.  Tapped at 6pm sharp!

posts.title: Yeast Flavor Profile Demonstration + Beer Trivia
posts.description:
Come join us at Triple Voodoo Brewery & Tap Room and learn how using different yeast strains in the same beer affects the flavor profile. We will be brewing a beer and splitting them into multiple fermentation batches. One beer is the "control" beer and the other three are 5-gallon batches that are our "yeast experiments" -- each fermented with a different yeast strain. We will be offering taster flights so you can do the comparison yourself.
Our friends from Gigayeast, Inc. will be here to educate you on the role that yeast plays in the making of beer.

Sunset29 BBQ will be serving up the goodness starting at 6pm.

Our weekly pub quiz starts at 7:30pm and will feature a beer trivia round.

posts.title: Armistice Tap Takeover
posts.description:
No joke: Cadet may have saved our lives. The year was 2014. We had just moved back to Napa with the heavy charge of caring for our mom. We had a taste of big city living from our time in LA, where we took an unhealthy interest in brewing and drinking beer. It was good to be home, but we missed the city’s nightlife, youth, and laid-back beer scene. But, Bacchus be praise, there as this new place, whose owners were as generous, rad, elegant, and chill as the vibe of their wine and beer bar. And it was open past eight! You’ll see everyone in there -- young winemakers, old industry types, singles, couples, somms, beer nerds, hipsters, urbanites, farmers, scholars, tourists, locals, etc. It’s a great spot and it had a huge impact on how we envisioned the vibe at Armistice. We spent many a hazy night drinking some of the best beers in the world (seriously, their bottle list is insane), while we hatched our business plan and hammered out our recipes. Colleen and Aubrey were even kind enough hold onto champagne bottles for us when we got into making ciders and sours. We know that tap takeovers are supposed to be about making inroads into new markets, but whatever. We aren’t business people. We’re bringing it back to our favorite bar in Napa. We (Alex & Gregory) will be on hand to discuss the beers, the process, and the finer points of medieval archery.

Ages 21+

The final beers will be available only at Hops for Housing. Music will be provided by local artists. A souvenir glass to commemorate the event will also be provided.

posts.title: Nerd Nite East Bay - Beer Edition
posts.venue: The Good Hop Bar & Bottle Shop
posts.description: Nerd Nite East Bay is hosting the first ever BEER edition at The Good Hop! The event will feature 2 guest speakers: Almanac's Head Brewer Phil Emerson, who will get his ultimate geek on about the science of wild ales and fermentation, AND Liam O'Donoghue of East Bay Yesterday podcast will delve into the rich and storied history of beer in the Bay Area. Ticket price includes a tasting of Almanac beers, and seats are limited.

posts.title: Absolution Brewing  Education 101: Meet the Owner
posts.description:
Meet the Owners of Absolution Brewing & the Northbay's premier new Taproom, CREEKSIDE.

This event is great for anyone, anyone in particular even remotely considering starting a brewery, venue or taproom with craft beers: These guys have done it and done it well:

Here from their Torrance brewery for SFBW2018, meet founder and owner of Absolution Brewing Company, Nigel Heath; learn all about Absolution’s all natural beers; water, grain, yeast & hops; sample hops & grains that produce this magical elixirs! 13 Absolution unique ABC beers on tap during SF Beer Week Absolution Tap Takeover at Creekside.

Meet Pat Townsley, Owner, Designer and Builder of Creekside and their iconic custom copper 40 handle tap system. Townsley will talk about system design, long-draw glycol installation, beer selection tactics and menu design, plus show you Creekside's 60 "half-barrel" 28 degree beer walk-in, on site nitrogen production and gas blending with 800 PSI of liquid CO2 pushing beer, wine, kombucha, root beer and cold brew coffee. Open forum, open Q&A, Open arms!

Follow Absolution and Creekside on Taphunter app and @CreeksideSA on Instagram, Facebook and Twitter.

posts.title: Duck Duck Gose Beer Dinner
posts.description:
Join Almanac for a duck-inspired six course pairing dinner at our San Francisco Taproom. Hosted in our intimate “Vintage Room” this coursed dinner highlights local duck, seasonal produce, barrel-aged and fresh beer selections. Hosted by our Brewmaster and Chef, this one-of-a-kind dinner will be a culinary deep dive into everyone’s favorite waterfowl.

Tickets and final menu in early January

posts.title: Whose Beer Is It Anyway?
posts.description:
Join us in the taproom for a night of laughs with Endgames Improv. They will bring a non-stop procession of scenes, games, and nonsense. This *FREE* improv show will feature ridiculous surprises and even more impressive recoveries. We are offering an exclusive pre-sale ticket for two beers to enjoy during the show and a logo glass to take home. Doors at 7, show starts at 8. See you there!

Endgames Improv produces five nights a week of shows and teaches classes all the time. Learn more at endgamesimprov.com.

posts.title: Alesong & Ale Apothecary Beer Dinner
posts.description:
This is a limited sixteen-person dinner. It will consist of ten beers paired with eight courses. Along with an additional tasting of something very special as a surprise from each brewery to finish the evening. Two of our favorite small batch breweries from Oregon will be offering up some very special beers for us to pair with local foods. Five beers from each brewery will be paired with small courses crafted just for this dinner.

Both breweries make Belgian style ales that use a range of adjunct ingredients and barrel aging which makes their beers truly special and unique. For these reasons, it will be a very fun and unique type of dinner. Both Paul from Ale Apothecary and Matt & Doug of Alesong will be in attendance and be joining us for the dinner and a Q & A. We are very excited about this event. This event has been talked about for a year and is finally going to happen, it should not be missed. It will be worth every penny for those that are into beer and food. These beers are extremely small batch and they take from months to years to produce.

Beers include but not limited to

Be Still
Spruce Latache
Faerie Tears
Cherry/Cognac El Cuatro
Unknown Fruit Beer
Terroir Pinot Gris
French 75
Kind of Blue
Peche
Vanilla Rhino Suit

Come down and join us!

posts.title: 5th Annual Craftsman Brewing Showcase
posts.description:
Our regard for Craftsman Brewing Company and its founder Mark Jilg should by now be well known to anyone reading this. Much of what makes Craftsman so extraordinary in our view is the stylistic range of beers they are able to produce at a high level. Craftsman offers everything from classic, sessionable American lagers and ales, to outstanding, Bavarian-style wheat beers, to seasonally influenced "foraged beers" with agricultural ingredients, and of course some of the most remarkable beers in the country.

As was done last year, The Hog's Apothecary will showcase Mark's remarkable range by offering nine of his beers on tap at once; 3 core brands, 3 foraged beers and 3 sours.

The Craftsman himself will begin the day with an intimate talk and tasting at 2:30pm. We will continue pouring the beers all night through dinner service (while supplies last).

Once again 10% of the beer sales from the event will be donated to the wonderful charity, Oakland Ed Fund.

Go to Open Table to make sure you have a table for this can’t miss offering!

posts.title: Swensen’s Ice Cream Beer Floats
posts.description: Try your favorite Woods beers in float form with delicious scoops of ice cream from our friendly neighbors at Swensen’s.

posts.title: SoCal Love Saturday
posts.description: We've paid tribute to our favorite Chicago and NorCal breweries now it's time to pay tribute to our friends down the coast.  All SoCal beers on all 16 taps! Featuring fun and special releases from: Modern Times, Pizza Port, Eagle Rock, The Bruery, Lost Abbey, Mikkeller SD and more! Stay tuned for the beer list.

posts.title: Barrel Aged Beers & Fortune Cookie Ale Release
posts.description:
Get ready for an eclectic night of beer releases ...

To commemorate the start of Chinese New Year, we're releasing a beer inspired by our favorite of Chinese treats, the Fortune Cookie. Little known fact, but the fortune cookie can be traced to turn of the century San Francisco. Local cookie, local beer, what could be better?

To top off the day, we're digging into barrel vault and releasing several of our bourbon barrel aged beers. We'll be tapping:

(1) Barrel Aged Dubbel Feature - we partnered with our friends at Healthy Wine & Spirits to make an awesome barrel aged Belgian Dubbel
(2) Barrel Aged Coastal Red - an aged version of our GABF winning Coastal Red imperial amber

posts.title: Bayview Haze Can Release
posts.venue: Seven Stills + Hard Frescos - Lawton Taproom
posts.description:
Join us for the release of our Bayview Haze Pomegranite DIPA can in collaboration with FDR, Laughing Monk and Bare Bottle. The base of this beer is our Alvarado collab, Tomahawp, that has fresh pomegranate added to it.

Each of us will be debuting a different beer this day with pomegranate added.

There are only about 10 cases of this being sent to the taproom so please arrive early if you want to grab a four-pack.

posts.title: Russian River at the Hop
posts.venue: The Good Hop Bar & Bottle Shop
posts.description:
Russian River is coming to The Good Hop for SF Beer Week! We'll have a plethora of Russian River beers both on draft and in bottles.

Russian River reps/crew will be in the building, Tacos el Precioso will be servin' up some tacos for your face, AND rumor has it that a certain sexy beer just may make an appearance!

posts.title: Special Imperial Stout Release and Meet the Brewers
posts.description: Come enjoy the special release of our 1 year old whiskey chip aged Cossack Imperial Stout on cask while hanging out with brewers Tyler and Adam.

posts.title: Hazed & Confused!
posts.description:
Can't get enough of that haze?! Then you won't want to miss this event that's full of hazy, juicy IPA's!

Some featured breweries include: Alpha Acid, Alvarado Street, Fieldwork, Humble Sea, Modern Times, Moonraker, New Glory, Revision, Temescal, Track 7, and MORE!

Check out our website or Untappd for a full draft list prior to the event!

posts.title: North Bay Pub Takeover
posts.venue: Winston's Pub @ The King George Hotel
posts.description: Join us at the King George Hotel's brand new lobby bar, Winston's Pub, for an evening of excellent North Bay beers. We'll be featuring a selection of UK/British Isles style beers from some of our favorite brewers to the North. Enjoy pub games like darts and billiards. Food available for purchase from The Grilled Cheez Guy.

posts.title: 5th Annual Barrel Aged Fest
posts.description: The Albany Taproom is throwing its 5th annual Barrel Aged Fest. Join us as we take over the taps with a host of barrel aged beers. We have of variety of styles lined up; from Sierra Nevada's Trip in the Woods Barrel Aged Narwhal to Gulden Draak's Calvados Barrel Aged Belgian Strong Dark Ale and Hangar 24's Pugachev's Cobra Barrel Roll No. 3, and so many more! We are aiming to tantalize your senses with the complex, rich and delicious result of marrying great beers for the perfect amount of time into the barrels of some of the worlds greatest wines and spirits. It's a wonder the stories that one glass can hold. Come experience this marvel with us during your SF Beer Week adventures!

posts.title: Pizza Port Strong Ale Fest Vertical Stout Tasting
posts.description: Come to Cask and enjoy a tasting of 2014, 2015 and 2016 vintages of Pizza Port Strong Ale Fest Imperial Stouts! Cheese and chocolate truffles included and Pizza Port Festival t-shirts will be given to the first ten people to purchase a to go bottle of Pizza Port Strong Ale.

posts.title: 510 Brews
posts.description:
Five -Ten - East Bay Brews A Plenty- Friday, February 16 highlights the
510's unique bay area pride and unique beers at The Ave.
*Federation* -If you work hard and play hard, them you might be ready to
join the Federation and taste a mix of positivity and funk in every sip.
"In The Weeds", "Low Boy", "Hot Nonsense" and "Doin Crime" are just a few
of the unique malts available for your responsible drinking employment.
*Ghost Town Brewing *- Local brewers and local brew... Don't be afraid of
receiving "Final Rites" or a run-in with the "Nose Goblin". A nice Lochrain
Pale and Old Trepanner will remind you why you want stay in the 510.
*Lucky Devil *- Break all the rules and enjoy an eclectic mix of Belgian
inspired beers. Learn about barrel aged sours and seasonal one -offs
*Benoit-Casper Brewery *- These spectacular beers are a testament to boldly
experimenting with ingredients, process, technique and equipment to develop
Belgian, Hoppy-American, and traditional German styles for the beer lover
in you.

posts.title: Bourbon Barrel-Aged Altbier Release
posts.description: Altbier is my favorite beer.  Four Roses is my favorite bourbon.  OMG!

posts.title: Battle of the Bay
posts.description:
San Francisco, Peninsula, East Bay, which brewery has the best beer?

Come on down and judge for yourself. We will be featuring breweries from San Francisco, San Mateo County, and the East Bay.

The criteria of course will not only be beers from local breweries, but also their limited and seasonal offerings.

***Check Back Here for the Beer List***

Free BBQ will be in the beer garden for SFBW participants.

posts.title: East Brother Beer Tap Takeover
posts.description:
Please excuse us as we take over the place!

Ever been to Smoke Berkeley BBQ and Beer Garden? If not, today's the day to try the delicious Southern barbeque! If so, you know why East Brother Beer Co. is invading this gem! Come party with us as we take over with our portable draft system tapping our brews and enjoy food prepared with East Brother beer blended right in!

posts.title: Sour Vibez Musica Festival
posts.description:
We’re putting out the vibe, the sour vibez. Come move to the groove, tap your toes, and enjoy the musical tunes from various local artists! Check out the line up below for a full night of music at The Rare Barrel.

We are excited to celebrate our music program by bringing back all of the artists who have played our 2nd Friday series to present the Sour Vibez Music Festival! It'll be 5+ hours of live music, including our featured band Sharkmouth.

Sour Vibez will showcase a variety of sounds, from folk to soul and all the genres in between. PLUS The Rare Barrel's very own Alex Wallash, as the loser of our fantasy football league, will kick off the evening with some ukulele tunes.

Music By…
Sharkmouth
Token Girl
Ash Powell (with Rob Dietrich and Emily Studden)
Justin Cohen
Rick Hardin
Natalie Smith
and Tall Alex

Come for the music, sip on some sours, we’ll also have a few non-sour guest brews on from friends, and enjoy some grub from our kitchen.

posts.title: Where the Buffalo Roam – Colorado Night 2018
posts.description:
We've got a special place in our heart for the state of Colorado. Not only is it a beautiful state, but it also has some great breweries who do some amazing things with barrel aging.

We'll be featuring a selection dark and sour barrel-aged beers from New Belgium, Oskar Blues, Avery, Epic, Paradox and Boulder. We'll round out the selection with a number of non-barrel aged beers for those of you who want something a little lighter.

In addition, we'll have a special flight of four beers paired up with four different cheeses. Beer nerds are always going on about how beer and cheese pair so well together, well now is your chance to try it out!

Current taplist includes:
Oskar Blues Rum Barrel-Aged Death by Coconut
Oskar Blues Barrel-Aged Ten Fidy
New Belgium Sour Saison
New Belgium Juicy Haze IPA
New Belgium Blackberry Oscar
Avery Tangerine Quad
Avery Vanilla Bean Stout
Avery Raspberry Sour
Epic Big Bad Baptista
Epic Triple Barrel Big Bad Baptist
Paradox Skully #53: Komet Sitra
Paradox Skully #54: Cherry Crisp
More to be announced!

posts.title: Five Years of Firestone Walker
posts.description:
We will be exploring the two worlds of barrel aging that Firestone has perfected: strong and sour. On draft we will have a beer from the last five years:
Firestone Walker XVII (2013)
Velvet Merkin (2014)
Sucaba (2015)
Agrestic (2016)
TBD (2017)
All beers will be available at noon, and Barrelmeister Jeffers Richardson will be in-house 4-6 pm to discuss the barrel program(s) that he oversees.

posts.title: Hoppy Hour
posts.description: Over the past three years we’ve earned a reputation for being IPA free, but we’re breaking tradition for an extra special Beer Week Happy Hour. Our new brewer, Mike, is cooking up some higher IBU brews for all your hopheads. We’ll tap his small batch experiments for a hoppier edition of our weekly happy hour! Score a beer and a taco for $5 from 4-8pm. Yeah, you read that right--a beer AND a taco for $5.

posts.title: Rarities & Favorites with Social Kitchen & Golden Boy Pizza Secret Menu
posts.description:
Enjoy some incredible rarities and favorites from San Francisco's own GABF award-winning Social Kitchen & Brewery! This is also an opportunity to try some of the first barrel fermented experiments coming from brewmaster Kim Sturdavant, who will surely be sitting bar side hanging with us and talking all things beer!

Have you ever fantasized about secret menu slices from North Beach's own OG legendary pizzeria, Golden Boy Pizza? This is a very rare opportunity to pair Social brews with slices like Pesto Pepperoni and Surf and Turf combo. Curated by SmashPizza, you do not want to miss this event with our friends and neighbors at Golden Boy Pizzeria, where it is "truly hip to be square."

Sample draught list: (subject to change)
~CA Grown Lager, brewed with local malt
~Mr. Kites Pale Ale, 2x GABF gold medal winner

~Who Let the Dog Stout

We will have our 2017 and 2018 Big Wall Imperial Stouts on draft as well as our 2017 Big Wall on Nitro and a special release of Big Wall Double Vanilla Imperial Stout variant.

posts.title: Corbin Cash Barrel-Aged Beer Night
posts.description:
Corbin Cash is one of our favorite California whiskeys and we had the chance to make some delicious barrel-aged beers in some of their Sweet Potato Liqueur barrels.

As a special treat, we'll have David Souza, the founder of Corbin Cash, with us this evening. David is a 4th-generation sweet potato farmer, who started the distillery on his family's 100+-year-old sweet potato farm in Atwater, in California's Central Valley.

Come to Southpaw to taste through a flight of our Barrel-Aged Barley Wine and Barrel-Aged Stout alongside the Corbin Cash Sweet Potato Liqueur.

Corbin Cash Sweet Potato Liqueur Barrel-Aged Releases:
*Barley Wine
*Stout

posts.title: Nor Cal vs. So Cal IPA Challenge ft. Seismic Brewing's Shatter Cone IPA
posts.description:
Who brews the best IPA?

It's a Nor Cal vs. So Cal showdown. Winner take all.

The new kids from Sonoma County, Seismic Brewing Company, will be representing Nor Cal with their Shatter Cone IPA. Come meet the brewing team and taste the best IPAs that California has to offer.

Brewer's Notes: We brewed this IPA specifically for those that are endlessly searching for unique hop flavor and aromatic expression. Intensely aromatic, Shatter Cone features a bouquet of strawberry, stonefruit, melon, and citrus.  The palate is bright, crisp, and acidic with a punch of clean bitterness which gives way to a lemon/orange and concord grape profile overlaid on a neutral malt canvas.

This is a great opportunity to celebrate pilsner style of beer by tasting the original pilsner as close to brewery fresh without having to travel to the Czech Republic!

MENU DETAILS TO COME.

No tickets, required.

posts.description:
Join us for a night with two of our favorite Breweries. Allagash and The Bruery. Drawing inspiration from Belgium and blending it with their own style and skills, these two keep pushing the boundaries each year and creating some of the best beers out there. We'll have a dozen drafts and some bottles from the cellar.
Allagash- Tripel, Little Brett, Little Sal, Map 40, Pastiche,
St. Klippenstein, and Cuvee Industrial

The Bruery- Mischief, Frucht Peach, The Wanderer,
White Chocolate, and their collaboration beers "Bouffon" with Jester King and "Ngongo" with Garage Project.

posts.title: Shuck Yeah! Stouts & Oysters
posts.description:
Join SPARK for a renowned Bay Area experience – Oysters and Stouts! This pair is a match made in heaven. Loyalists know that stout's deep, toasted creaminess only serves to heighten the delicate, briny flavors of fresh oysters.

Though this pairing is Old World, the stout selection will be anything but, featuring an array of flavors from bourbon, to oatmeal, to vanilla. Dive into 12 fresh-shucked oysters and your choice of 6 draught stouts with 10 to choose from – the most succulent way to kick off your Friday night.

Bottoms up!

STOUTS LINEUP
Anderson Valley Brewing Co. – Turkey Bourbon Stout
Drake Brewing Co. – Turkey Bourbon Stout
HenHouse Brewing Co. – Oyster Stout
Ol' Republic Brewing Co. – Resolute Export Style Stout
Almanac Brewing Co. – Barbary Coast Stout
101 North Brewing Co. – Naughty Aud
Highwater Brewing Co. – Campfire Stout
North Coast Brewing Co. – Old 38 Stout
Marin Brewing Co. – San Quintin Breakout Stout
Fieldwork Brewing Co. – Fieldwork Stout
posts.admission: Free Admission or Oyster and Stout Passports $20-$30

posts.title: Cask & Queso, Triple Fermented
posts.description:
Fermentation lovers unite! Beer, cheese & bread on one table!

Janet Fletcher’s Planet Cheese, The SF Baking Institute and ThirstyBear team up to present unlimited tastings of 17 unique cask conditioned ales from 16 different breweries paired with local and Spanish artisan cheeses and freshly baked breads.

Once all brewries and beers are confirmed, we'll post them and the cheese pairings!

This is one of the premiere SF Beer Week events! It sells out every year, so get your tickets now. $50 for unlimited beer, cheese and bread tastings plus take home a ThirstyBear logo-ed glass.

Tickets on Sale now!

posts.title: Drag Brewery Tours
posts.description:
A classic brewery tour with a twist!

Come learn the history of Laughing Monk and take a peak behind the curtain of our brew operation while enduring the sass of San Francisco drag legend, Ginger Snap. With Sister Snap at the helm, hijinx are sure to ensue!

Brewery tours start at 6pm, 7pm, 8pm, 9pm and will last 20-30 minutes with time for photo ops, followed by a pint of your choice and you get to keep your logo glass as a memento. You don't want to miss this--grab your tickets today!

#LaughOn #SisterSnap

posts.title: Whales of the Deep
posts.description:
We're definitely going to need your help finishing these ten Whales of the Deep! It's ten over 10%, dive, dive, dive!

1) Dogfish Head - Oak-Aged Vanilla World Wide Stout - 16% ABV - dark, boozy, oaky, vanilla-y, roasty, mega imperial stout

2) The Bruery - So Happens It's Tuesday - 14.7% ABV - bourbon barrel aged imperial stout

3) Gulden Draak - Calvados Barrel Aged - 10.4% ABV - a rare Belgian Dark Strong beast produced only once!

4) Dogfish Head - 120 Minute IPA - 18% ABV - mega imperial IPA dry hopped daily every day for a month and then aged another month on whole-leaf hops

5) Firestone Walker - Helldorado - 12.8% ABV - bourbon barrel aged blonde barleywine

6) New Holland Brewing - Dragon's Milk Reserve Mocha Mint - 11% - bourbon barrel aged stout with peppermint, chocolate, and coffee character

7) Alesmith - Hawaiian Speedway Stout - 12% ABV - imperial stout with coconut, vanilla, & Ka'u coffee

8) Perennial - Abraxas 2017 - 10% ABV - imperial stout brewed with ancho chiles, cacao nibs, vanilla beans & cinnamon sticks

9) Epic Brewing - Triple Barrel Big Bad Baptist - 11.4% - blend of coconut & Blue Copper’s Colombian coffee beans aged in fresh whiskey barrels with imperial stout aged in both rum & whiskey barrels

10) North Coast - Old Stock Cellar Reserve 2015 - 14.5% ABV - bourbon barrel aged old ale

MEGA BONUS 1) Modern Times - Monster's Park Super Cuvee - 14% ABV - an insane blend of Tequila Monster's Park, Bourbon BA Monster's Park, Bourbon BA Devil's Teeth, & Rye Whiskey BA Haunted Stars conditioned on Bourbon BA cacao nibs

MEGA BONUS 2) Oskar Blues - 2017 Rum Barrel Aged Death by Coconut - 11% ABV - super limited release (only 5 kegs in the Bay Area) of the awesome Death by Coconut aged for 9 months in rum barrels

BONUS 2) BFM (Brasserie des Franches-Montagnes) - Abbaye De Saint Bon-Chien Special 20th Anniversary Edition - 11% ABV - sour biere de garde aged in Bordeaux Grand Cru wine barrels (we'll tap however much is left after our Sour Sh!tstorm event the previous weekend)

So sayeth the Urban Dictionary: "a White Whale is something you obsess over to the point that it nearly or completely destroys you." These white whales are within your reach on Friday the 16th of SF Beer Week. See you there!

P.S. awesome sloppy seconds from our previous sour and other events will be pouring on the other 10 taps, yum!

posts.title: Three Cheers:  Temescal/Cellarmaker/Social Kitchen Collaboration Fun
posts.description:
One thing we know to be true:  the "rule of three" applies to more than just writing.  Three talented brewers putting their heads together is bound to produce a satisfying beer; one you might just pen a short story about or tell around the campfire.  Raise your glass to Three Cheers: An Extra Brut IPA with Simcoe, Loral and Zeus hops

The finest of sparkling IPAs for the most laudable of festivities, this singular marriage of Simcoe, Loral and Zeus expresses the plenitude of these breweries' three houses. An incomparable balance of opulence, precision and crushability.

Gather your pack together to taste a collection of Temescal, Cellarmaker and Social Kitchen beers on draft.  Three Cheers will be featured on draft with cans available to cart home.

posts.title: Check Out The 916
posts.description:
Have you been keeping up with the beer scene in Sacramento? No? I just assumed you said no, but I realize some of you reading are saying, "uh yah dude". Sacramento is killing it! That's right, the 916 is not just for bureaucrats anymore -- they have a killer beer scene. So we are bringing the 916 to you for a night and introducing you to a brand new brewery out of Rocklin named Moksa that will be opening February 3rd just a week before the event! So on tap for the night will be:

Moksa
Moonraker
Mraz
Claimstake
New Glory
Track 7

Some of the brewers will be here to say hi to, should be a great night!

posts.title: Battle of the State IPA Challenge
posts.description:
This year we're going even bigger with our IPA Challenge!

Last year we pitted the best Bay Area breweries against each other for the cup, and Faction Brewing came out on top.

This year we will be expanding the competition into a Nor-Cal vs So-Cal competition. The results will be determined by popular vote using a bracket system (think football playoffs). The 'IPA Bowl' will be the finalist from Nor-Cal vs the So-Cal finalist, with the winner taking home the trophy.

posts.title: Clear vs Hazy IPA – You Decide The Winner!
posts.description: Over the past year, the battle lines have been drawn: Hazy IPAs or Clear IPAs? Come and taste the best of the best side by side in our blind tasting people's choice competition and once and for all determine where your taste buds fall! A flight of 6 beers (3 hazy and 3 clear) will be offered and you cast your vote on which is the best of the best.

posts.title: Firestone Walker Friday
posts.description: Firestone Walker Tap Takeover. Showcasing their Proprietor's Vintage Series as well as their Barrelworks Wild Ales.

posts.title: West Coast IPA vs Hazy IPA Night
posts.description:
2 of the hottest beer styles out there, 4 breweries, 8 beers-you decide which you like better!

Here at The Willows, we're in a debate over which IPA style we like more, so we decided to open up the debate to the public. We're putting on one of each style from 4 different breweries, and you be the judge of which style wins!

Henhouse:
Deep State NE Style IPA
Phantom Time West Coast IPA

Alpha Acid:
Emerald Hills NE Style IPA
650 West Coast IPA

Track 7:
Mo'Suka NE Style Double IPA
Hop Addict West Coast IPA

Barebottle:
Wonder Dust NE Style IPA
Liberal Bias West Coast Style IPA

We'll let you vote for your favorite style and your favorite overall beer, and at the end of the night, we'll announce the winner!

posts.title: Bottle Logic Brewing Tap Takeover
posts.description:
Meet Bottle Logic Brewing & drink their tasty brews as they host the eve. At Beer Revolution!

posts.title: Beards & Fruity Beer
posts.description:
All hail the beard! Triple Rock Brewing and Sierra Nevada are proud to present an exciting SF Beer Week celebration of all things brew and beard. Join us Friday 2/16 from 6-10pm to enjoy an eccentric evening of facial hair and fruity awesomeness.

We'll be serving our new debut Tight Squeeze Fruited Wheat, as well as our usual Berkeley Brewed offerings, accompanied by juicy delicacies from Sierra Nevada. Stay tuned for full draft list!

Experts from Peoples Barber will be on hand to thoroughly judge that thing growing on your face. Competition will include three different length categories: mustache, beard and full beard. Don’t have competition ready facial hair? We'll have stick-on alternatives for ladies and gents spectating so that everyone can get involved in this facial hair madness.

Prize packs will be presented to the winners of each category, from merch and swag to gift cards and goodies, provided by Sierra Nevada, Triple Rock and our barber partners. In person sign ups will be available at the bar. Competition starts at 7pm!

posts.title: Good Vegan Times with Modern Times
posts.description: We’ve lured our veggie-loving friends up from San Diego’s Modern Times to San Francisco with the promise of delicious vegan food. Our kitchen is getting inspired and putting together a menu of vegan specialities, so loaded with flavor you won’t even miss the meat. Paired with rare and limited IPAs, stouts and sours from Modern Times, and Almanac’s special releases. Don’t worry meat eaters: our regular menu and burger will still be available.

posts.description: Enjoy our Tap Takeover with Firestone Walker Brewing Company and Stone Brewing.

posts.title: Lager Than Life Drag Show
posts.description:
In true Laughing Monk fashion, we are going against the grain for SF Beer Week with a *FREE* Lager Than Life Drag Show! We have a full-bodied lineup of queens ready to make you say "come a-grain?".
Our amazing MC, Flora Goodthyme, will have no problem telling you to citra ass down! Mary Wannah will make sure you get your money's wort. Ferosha Titt'es will have you grinning from beer to beer. Sara Converted will serve up a keg-stistential experience and last, but certainly not yeast, Mutha Chucka will get us all rye-led up!

We'll have MEAT BY PETE outside serving up gourmet sausages with superior mouth-feel. The drag show is free, but check out our dinner & drink special pre-sale tickets:
Your ticket includes:
-2 beers
-Boudin Blanc Sausage served with the best mash ever and pickled mustard seeds.

Get ready to hang on for beer life!

Middle Weight Flight – Firestone Walker’s Agrestic and Velvet Merkin vs Stone Lupulin Loop Single Hop IPA and Stone Starmageddon Belgian Style Stout

posts.title: REI Sufferfest - 10K Trail Run
posts.venue: Smith Trail Head Parking Lot, Rodeo Beach
posts.address: Smith Trailhead Parking Lot, Rodeo Beach: Marin, Golden Gate National Rec Area
posts.description: Have you been enjoying SF Beer Week maybe a little too much? Start your weekend burning some of those hard-earned calories on our Sufferfest 10K trail run, optimized to maximize suffering with 6.2 miles of trail and 1,400 feet of climbing. Take in the beautiful vistas of San Francisco and the Pacific Ocean that you would expect to find in the Marin Headlands while you grind up and down those hills. And after all that suffering on the trail, don't worry: Sufferfest Beer Company and Early Bird Tacos will be waiting for you at the finish line with a cold one and delicious a breakfast taco. So grab a friend and hit the trail.

posts.title: 4th Annual Bay Area IPA Face Off
posts.description: We will be pouring 20 IPAs from the best breweries the Bay Area has to offer. Hop heads unite! We will be offering flights, and the ability to taste all 20 IPAs and vote for your favorite, The winning brewery will be announced the following day on our facebook site. Last year Henhouse brewing took number 1, let's see if they are dethroned this year! IPA judging until 1:30 am!

posts.title: Brew It Yourself: Beer Making at Home
posts.description: Have you ever tasted a beer and said, I could probably make that? Take our Brew It Yourself: Beer Making at Home class and you’ll realize how true that is. This is SF's only class where you get to learn from a professional brewer and take home beer YOU made! You’ll get your hands dirty on one of our brewing rigs, and after this two-part class, you’ll walk away with a case of beer that YOU BREWED. We'll make special STRONG beers for SF Beer Week and Strong Beer Month!

Come join us for our first-ever brunch service with a  beer-centered pho experience, beer flights, sake flights, and did someone say champagne?

posts.title: Fragaria Day, 3rd Annual Special Release
posts.description:
It's the 3rd Annual Fragaria Day, where we proudly release our show pony, limited, Wild Strawberry Beer. Not only will we have this rarified example of our local Terroir available by the bottle, but we also have some key updates to our fan favorite release day.

Key to them is our inclusion of Fragaria among the Sonoma Pride Fundraising Initiatives from breweries all over the world. Six lucky auction winners will obtain 1 of 6 limited edition signed Magnum bottles of Fragaria branded with the Sonoma Pride logo, thanks to the wonderful team efforts of the crew at Russian River Brewing.

Quercus Reserve: Fragaria, batch #3 is a fan favorite for the purest of reasons. The process starts with a brew of a light golden ale which is spontaneously fermented, then aged for 8-12 months in French Oak Wine Barrels. Like all of our Wild Beer, it is a pure showcase of West Sonoma County Microflora.

Then, 500 pounds of Strawberries are picked at peak season in August right down the road at the Lao Family Strawberry Farm; de-stemmed by hand; and allowed to ferment for 2-4 weeks.

At the right juncture, the laid down beer is then infused to the strawberries to undergo a re-fermentation process, adding to the complexity of both strawberry and beer.

After the 2-4 week re-fermentation process, the fully realized product is bottle conditioned for a period of 4-5 months for your drinking pleasure... and ours to be fair!

Quercus Reserve: Fragaria, is like drinking a glass of sour champagne with fresh cut strawberries dropped in. A puckering of fruity apricot and lemons is matched by a balanced, dry strawberry finish which forces you to take the next sip, and the next...

Availability: 520 bottles, 375 ml
ABV: 5.2%
IBU: 27
Color: Light, Strawberry Sunrise
Batch: #3
Style: Wild, Fruited Aged Lambic
Process: Spontaneous/Re-Fermentation
Limit: 3 Bottles Per Person

12:00 Doors Open

1:00 Tour & Tasting
Where the Wild Things Are

Woodfour Brewing's Sales Manager, John Roberts, will take you on a talking journey about Woodfour Brewing's History, its Mission in Life, & of course, our Wild & Barrel Aged Beer Program. First 20 People to mention the tour and sign up are in.

3:00 Sonoma Pride Auction Closes
Proceeds to King Ridge Found.

Starting February 6th, the online silent auction for 1 of 6 Limited Edition Fragaria, Sonoma Pride Magnums will go on sale, and end at 3:00 pm on Fragaria Day. Woodfour is super proud to include our special, locally driven, rare beer release with the only 6 magnums sold in the 2018 year. This is a one bid, one win policy auction to raise money for those affected and effected by the Sonoma & Napa County Wildfires.

Place your bid at, https://www.32auctions.com/fragariasonomapridemagnum


Special Food for Purchase

Strawberry Tamales
Chocolate Covered Strawberries

See you at Fragaria Day 2018

posts.title: Hops on Fire: Spicy Food and IPA Festival
posts.description:
Feel the heat at SF Beer Week’s spiciest beer festival – Hops on Fire!

– HOP-XHIBIT –
Get a whiff of what’s hop-ining in your favorite IPAs at our first-ever interactive Hop-xhibit. Industry pros lay out their knowledge on varieties, brewing techniques, and flavor as they guide you through your own fragrant flower sniff-test.

– ALL YOU CAN DRINK IPAs –
Once you’ve primed your palate, savor the flavor with 20+ pours of premium, local IPAs, served in a commemorative glass. Smell the hop, taste the hop, quench the hop
$40 All You Can Drink IPAs served in a commemorative glass

>>> Get $5 off with FUNCHEAP code: http://bit.ly/hopsonfire <<<

– SPICY FOOD TRUCK SPECIALS –
Then test your taste buds with a lineup of extra spicy eats from SF’s fieriest food trucks. How high can you climb on the Scoville Scale? Jalapeño, Cayenne, Habanero? Perhaps even the world’s hottest pepper, the Carolina Reaper?

– CHILI EATING CONTEST –
And if your lunch doesn’t quite light your fire, sign up for the chili eating contest! It will have you reaching for a glass of milk in no time…
Prize: two Free All You Can Drink Tickets to any upcoming 2018 SoMa StrEat Food Park Beer Festival! Sign-ups are day-of, starting at 11am.

IPA LINEUP
20+ extra hoppy IPAs
Coming soon!

Coming soon!

posts.description: Join us for a Barrel Aged Tap Takeover. This category, which also has some crossover with Specialty Beer, is at its basic definition beers that are aged in non-neutral wood.

posts.title: Barrel-Aged Bash
posts.description: Be it a barleywine, Belgian blond, porter, or saison, we think that barrels make just about any beer taste a little better. We’re breaking out our cellar supply to share some of our finest barrel-aged brews from the past three years, including the Port-barrel aged Batch 44 / Dubbel and our very first bottle release, Batch 9 / Apricot Golden. Try special curated flights of our barreled beers while they last!

posts.title: Almanac Beer Talks
posts.description:
Beer Talks is back! Our Ted-Talks inspired educational event, Beer Talks pairs world-class ales and lagers with speakers on a variety of beer topics. Investigating the intersection of beer, brewing, technical process, and the community of people who brew and drink beer, we’ll explore the science and culture of craft beer. Ticket price includes beer samples and light snacks.



Speakers:

• Dr Charlie Bamforth - Distinguished Professor, Anheuser-Busch Endowed Professor of Malting & Brewing Sciences at UC Davis "Who Cares What Beer Looks Like In The Glass?"

• Jeffers Richardson - Director of the Firestone Walker Barrelworks. "Jeffers Drops Acid Knowledge - The Short Trip"

• Collin McDonnell - CEO Henhouse Brewing, “Take Responsibility For Your Beer”

• Averie Swanson - Jester King Head Brewer "You Can’t Make Lambic in Texas: The Story of SPON"

• Michael Kiser - Good Beer Hunting, “Beer Marketing: Making A Splash vs. Making A Wave”

• Andrew Schwartz - Modern Times, “A Spirited Defense of Hazy IPA”

• and featuring: Brewers Reading 1-star Untappd Reviews

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/almanac-presents-beer-talks-tickets-41315337286

posts.title: Kick-A** Beer Week Block Party
posts.description:
Seawolf Public House is turning 1 and to celebrate we’re teaming up with Boneyard, Melvin, and Altamont breweries to host a Kick-A** Beer Week Block Party! We’re shutting down the road and taking the party to the street with high-stakes games and competitions, live music & a DJ (dance party, anyone?), and socks-knocking barbecue!

Come party with the folks from Boneyard, Mevlin, and Altamont breweries and be part of the first ever (because we just made it up) Oakland Beernament! Join a team and have a great time competing for prizes! (Who doesn't love prizes?)

Tickets include four 8-oz beers, a plate of slow-smoked barbecue from GT Bakes BBQ, live music, and a DJ. Get 'em now because ticket prices will go up at the door!

For tickets go to: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/kick-a-beer-week-block-party-tickets-42011887687

Brewery reps will be in attendance as well as Lizzy D.  We have paired her creations in the past, and all will be impressed how well brew and cupcakes go together.

posts.description: We will be offering to-go sales of dozens of vintages of beers from our cellar. From noon to 4pm, in addition to regular service, we will sell (to-go) bottles of cellared beers from breweries including Deschutes, Russian River, Prairie Ales, Allagash, Firestone and much more...

posts.title: 'Magic In a Bottle' Homebrew Competition: Experimental Idaho #4 Hops
posts.description:
At Barebottle, we love nothing more than a good homebrew and the brewers that brew it. For our first homebrew competition of 2018, we've launched a Pale Ale comp with an experimental hop from Crosby Hop Farm - Idaho #4.

Characterized by an abundance of berry notes, we've tasked homebrewers from the Diablo Order of Zymiracle Enthusiasts; the Bay Area Mashers; and the San Francisco Homebrewer's Guild to make the most amazing of Pale Ales. As always, we brew the finalists on our production system and let the public vote on which is best. The winner, gets distributed in kegs & bottles, with their name and recipe enshrined on the label.

Join us and the homebrewers to sample the finalists and vote for the winner. If you can't make it to the Barebottle taproom, be sure to visit one of our satellite locations to cast your vote!

posts.title: Collaborative Beer Release with Jupiter!
posts.description:
For Beer Week 2018, we're brewing a collaborative beer with Jupiter in Berkeley! We'll be tapping the beer in our tasting room and know you'll want to come enjoy the IPA the two Justin's have created!

To highlight the release, the first Brewzza Palooza of 2018 will be on the same day. A Slice of Italeigh food truck will be out front and the UnOriginals will be playing 5:30-8:30 pm.

This day will also be a fundraiser for the Make A Wish Foundation of the Greater Bay Area! We'll be a portion of the days proceeds to this foundation. Cash donations will also be accepted!

Just added!!!!! Beer 101 - Eight Bridges Way! Learn what makes craft beer, craft beer. This class, led by our Brewmaster Justin, will enlighten you to the way beer should be made. Come learn about the different ingredients and how they play together. You'll learn how beer is produced, what makes that citrus flavor or even the sweet hints, and then you'll evaluate flavors and aromas.

$10 gets you the class, tour and tasting flight hand picked by Justin. Limited space so reserve your spot today. Must be reserved no later than Friday February 16. Any remaining seats will be $15 day of event.

Come by the tasting room to purchase your ticket or email us: info@8bridgesbrewing.com

It's going to be a fun day full of food, music and great beer! Bring the family too.

posts.title: Off-Flavors Advanced 12 – Good Beer Edition
posts.description:
Taste off-flavors in 2 great beer styles: IPAs and pilsners. Special SF Beer Week edition of Rich's year-round offerings of Cicerone Prep Courses and Off-Flavors Seminars. Normally, off-flavors are dosed into the most neutral beer available, but Rich is upping the ante this SF Beer Week with some tastier beers that you actually want to drink: IPA and real pilsner!

Price includes a post-class draft beer of your choice at The Beer Hall!

This combo workshop-and-tasting-quiz covers the 12 beer off-flavors listed in the Advanced Cicerone Syllabus, with discussion of each compound's flavor and aroma profile, source, and appropriateness. Each off-flavor is served and evaluated TWICE: first, during individual evaluation with discussion; second, during a blind taste test of all of the off-flavors plus a control beer.

Warning: using full-flavored beers will make it a bit more difficult to notice the off-flavors, but they make for a tastier, more fun event and are probably more realistic of how you might taste off-flavors in the real world. (For a more traditional off-flavors tasting, check out Rich's Certified Cicerone Exam Prep Course.)

Off-Flavors Sampled: acetaldehyde, acetic acid, chlorophenols, diacetyl, DMS, H2S (hydrogen sulfide), isovaleric acid, lactic acid, lightstruck, mercaptan, metallic, and trans-2-nonenal

http://richhiggins.com/events-classes/beer-school

posts.title: The Wild Ones:  Two Day Sour Sipping Session
posts.description:
If there is one thing we know to be true: folks love sours and brewers love artfully composing sours. The whim of nature combined with the whim of the brewer, blended together to create something special; sours have enjoyed a rich history with the devotion to this form of brewing continuing today. We would love to have you over for drinks: two full days of wild, tart, stunning, and funky sours of a varying degree on draft (starter sours alongside grownup sours).

Along with your draft pours, plan to cart home alluring sour bottle releases. Lively breweries to behold:
-Cascade Brewing
-Soquel Fermentation Project
-Libertine Brewing Company
-Crooked Stave
-oh you know there will be more....

posts.title: Beers Off the Beaten Path... Progressive Tasting in the Ing-Xcels-Ola
posts.description:
Get “off the beaten path” and enjoy an afternoon of great beer and outstanding food at places you maybe never heard of in this eclectic city that is San Francisco.

What the hell is the “Ing-Xcels-Ola” you ask? It’s our made-up word to direct you to the INGleside, eXCELSsior, and portOLA neighborhoods along the southern edge of the city. We may be a bit off the beaten path, but once you find us, you’ll realize we’re worth the trip, and a lot closer to where you normally grab craft beers than you may have originally thought.

This event is structured as a “Progressive Tasting” but you can start anywhere along the route if you wish. What the hell is a Progressive Tasting you ask? It’s where you enjoy food and craft beer pairings at one location, then “progressively” move along the route to enjoy more food and craft beer pairings at other locations. Our Progressive Tasting event will get you to FIVE locations, and the best part is we’ll shuttle you along the route for FREE!

For our Progressive Tasting, you’ll enjoy food paired with beers by Ferment.Drink.Repeat at FIVE different, unique locations. Starting at 12:30pm at The Ave Bar on Ingleside's Ocean Avenue (www.theavebar.com), you’ll get a beer-infused cocktail crafted with an FDR beer at this watering hole that features craft beers and has been welcoming Ingleside residents for years. From there you’ll make the short walk down to Ocean Ale House (www.oceanalehouse.com) where you’ll pair delicious food with multiple FDR beers at this inviting, craft beer mecca.

Starting at 2:30pm, our FREE shuttle will then begin moving folks to the Excelsior to get more outstanding food paired with FDR beer at The Dark Horse Inn (www.darkhorsesf.com), an oasis on Geneva Avenue that has been featuring locally-produced craft beer for the past seven years, as well as the newly opened Witch Doctor’s Lounge (www.witchdoctorslounge.com) on Mission Street.

For your last stop, you’ll again take our FREE shuttle to Ferment.Drink.Repeat, the Portola Neighborhood’s first craft brewery (www.fermentdrinkrepeat.com), where you’ll get even more beer, this time paired with a delectable dessert prepared for us by The Dark Horse Inn. FDR will also be prepared to provide tours of the brewery, where all the beers paired for this event were brewed!

Mark your SF Beer Week itinerary for this can’t miss event … check back here often, we’ll post more information as we finalize our food and beer pairing menu. Shake up the routine and get “off the beaten path” … you won’t be disappointed!

Event Timeline
12:30pm – Progressive Tasting starts with beer-infused cocktail at The Ave Bar
2:30pm – 7:40pm – FREE Shuttle Service runs a continuous loop between four venues on route:
Ocean Ale House--Dark Horse Inn--Witch Doctor’s Lounge--Ferment.Drink.Repeat--Ocean Ale House

Planned Departure Times from Each Venue*
Ocean Ale House (OAH) --> Dark Horse Inn (DHI)
2:30pm 3:30pm 4pm 4:30pm 5pm 5:30pm 6pm 7pm
Dark Horse Inn (DHI) --> Witch Doctor's Lounge (WDL)
2:45pm 3:45pm 4:15pm 4:45pm 5:15pm 5:45pm 6:15pm 7:15pm

2:55pm 3:55pm 4:25pm 4:55pm 5:25pm 5:55pm 6:25pm 7:25pm

3:10pm 4:10pm 4:40pm 5:10pm 5:40pm 6:10pm 6:40pm 7:40pm

*Shuttle times subject to change based on traffic, weather, and acts of God.

The 9th annual Meet the Brewers Beer Festival is almost here!

Where: Hermitage Brewing Company in the heart of San Jose

What: A celebration of the best local beer from Monterey to Livermore, and all points in between.

30+ breweries attending are local, within 150 miles of San Jose. Locally produced beer, live music, great mobile eats. This is the biggest and best festival in the South Bay and beyond during SF Beer Week.

It's like no other festival out there, and is truly a special event.

Breweries, food truck and vendors line up TBD and subject to change. All ages welcome. Please, no pets. No refunds allowed. In the unlikely case of an event cancellation, we will make good to ticket holders with a similar event within 6 months if the event is cancelled, unless the cancellation was for reasons of force majeure or government revokation of required alcohol or assembly permits.

posts.title: (Beer and) Whiskey Train
posts.description:
Chugga Chugga...

We are very excited to announce some changes to this year's Whiskey Train. We are switching up the format slightly and will be starting our train this year at the distillery at 1439 Egbert Ave. The first train will depart the distillery at 1pm and will load up and drive across SF to our Outer Sunset Taproom. We will then unload for half an hour, grab some beers and grub, and get back on the train and load up and head to our next surprise - our partner hotel bar at Stanford Court on Nob Hilll. We will get out at the Stanford Court, enjoy some whiskeys, and load up and head back to the brewery for the termination of the first Whiskey Train at 4pm.

The next train will run the same route and will depart from the distillery at 4:30pm and return to the distillery at 8pm. The trains we are using this year are slightly smaller so we expect them to sell out faster. There are about 35 spots available per session.

------
Admission includes:

One round trip ticket making all three stops aboard the whiskey train
Live music on the train (usually a banjo or fiddle band)
A limited Choo Choo Mother Fucker 2018 Whiskey Train beer koozie
Beers aboard the train
One drink at the bar at each stop
Snacks at the Outer Sunset Taproom

posts.title: Andy Goldsworthy Walking Tour with Fort Point
posts.description:
Did you know that the Presidio is home to the largest collection of Andy Goldsworthy sculptures on public view in North America? Led by Presidio Trust Docents, hikers will explore Spire (2008), Wood Line (2010), Tree Fall (2013), and Earth Wall (2014).

Following this guided tour, enjoy a tasting of Fort Point beers -- including the newly released Resonance! -- at Arguello Restaurant in the Presidio, and meet the Fort Point team.

This event is a three-mile moderate hike including a few uphill stretches and various surfaces, such as sand and rocky areas. The hike will include several of the park’s major trails, featuring striking views and beautiful landscapes. Please wear sturdy hiking shoes, dress in layers, and bring water! This hike is free and will occur rain or shine.

posts.title: Dogpatch Plus Closing Weekend Brew Tour
posts.address: Pickup At:   Hotel Zelos, 12 4th Street (above Powell BART)
posts.description:
Finish out SF Beer Week in style with a small-group brew tour of the city’s southeast side. We will visit the hot new GABF Award-winning Barebottle Brew Co, the elegant and innovative Harmonic Brewing, and a visit to San Francisco's best kept secret chocolate shop for a beer and chocolate pairing.

Each brewery stop will also feature food pairings from local street food vendors* and at one, we will get a private tour of a brewing facility. Meet our open-sided “woody” bus near Powell Street BART and bring your thirst for the best beers in the City on this adventure!

*Vendors and locations may change

posts.title: Ghost Town Brewing Beer and Black Metal Tap Takeover
posts.description: For this event we are putting together some fantastic specialty sandwiches and BBQ to pair up some killer releases by our Oakland Neighborhood Brew Masters Ghost Town Brewery. If you dont know about Ghost Town then you are really missing out. They make amazing beer and are also huge heavy metal fans so we are gonna be cranking out some killer tunes for this event :)

posts.title: Let's Do Drunch
posts.description:
In collaboration with our weekly Drunch of Bloody Mary's, Micheladas, and fresh squeezed Mimosa's, we will be taking $2 off all SF Beer Week beers to kick kegs and help out with those hang overs.

We will also have a waffle bar set up to provide proper sustenance for that said hang over.

Smooth yacht rock will be playing to avoid any sharp sounds for the tender headed.

The StandBy was established in 2009. We work hard to feature local vendors, in both spirits and beers. We only use house made mixes and fresh juices. We have a passion for cocktails and beer.

21 and over only please.

posts.title: Barrel Aged Brew Day
posts.description: This one's going to be a doozy! We've been saving up your favorite barrel aged beers for a one stop taste shop! We'll have some extra special bottles available as well! Not to be missed!

posts.title: 7×7(plus a couple) North Beach Beerfest – 9th Annual
posts.description:
Welcome to the 9th Annual North Beach 7x7 Beerfest! This year we will feature an assortment of local San Francisco breweries at a select group of North Beach bars. Each bar will have a mini tap takeover featuring three unique beers from the respective brewery. Delicious food pairings will be available at some locations, music at others; fun everywhere! Tickets get you a map, a wristband for the discounted tasting, and the first 300 to arrive get the commemorative T Shirt. We hope to see you there!

All this while supporting Muttville, a great local organization that specifically fosters and finds homes for older dogs.

Breweries include: Fieldwork, Lagunitas, Drake's, Calicraft, Laughing Monk, Social Kitchen and Brewery, Bare Bottle, and Fort Point. Bars include The Boardroom, Northstar, Rogue, Columbus Cafe, Belle Cora, Tupelo, Tope, and Church Key

Registration will be at The Boardroom/Northstar Cafe at the corner of Powell and Green.

posts.title: Tap Invasion with Barebottle Brewing and Black Hammer Brewing
posts.description:
Come join us and meet our friends from Barebottle Brewing and Black Hammer Brewing for a Dual Tap Invasion!

Be among the first to taste the breweries new releases for the season, along with some of Jasper's signature dishes.

Barebottle is having their home brew competition voting for the two finalist of this competition. Using an experimental Washington hop that has not been release to date. Come taste the two beers and cast your vote for what will be released next. We will also have some special Beer Week releases to try as well.

Black Hammer Brewing will behaving their flagship beer Sparkle Pony can release as well as a number of exciting special releases for Beer week, including a CBD beer!

The brewers are excited to meet and share their latest creation with you!

posts.title: Barrel-Aged & Stout Saturday
posts.description: Featuring a selection of rare, barrel aged beers and a selection of stouts to round out your beer week experience. Our line up of releases will feature some of our boldest and most robust beers to date. Be sure to sip these nano-batches slowly because they're a meant savored.

posts.title: Boomerang – A Queer Patio Party
posts.description:
If you’ve joined us for our monthly Queer First Fridays, you know we can throw a serious dance party. Now, in honor of Beer Week, we’re taking it to daylight hours for the very first time.

Expect babes, beats, and plenty of queer cheer, along with a special can release for the occasion: Boomerang, a passionfruit blonde. We’ll also have soul food from Kenny’s Heart and Soul, and a photobooth for all your best Boomerang Instas. All are welcome!

posts.title: Brews & Tunes ft. Laughing Monk Brewing
posts.description:
Celebrate SF Beer Week with us at Club Mallard as we turn into a two-story beer garden. Featuring a Laughing Monk Brewing tap takeover and an instrumental groove, funk & jazz band live on the patio.

Come for the great beer stay for the live music!

Tickets get you up to four barrel-aged beers (including bourbon, tequila and rum barrel-aged beers) -- each paired with a Tartine Manufactory teacake -- all in your commemorative Local Barrelage 2018 12-oz Brandy Snifter Glass.

Pairing beers and teacakes will be updated in January.

Gleaming and glittering with gold and wondrous surprises for young and old. Behind the curtain you will find upscale versions of the carnival food you know and love with corresponding beer pairings.

While enjoying your bites, stand spellbound in amazement as you take in the mystical, magical and sometimes spine chilling attractions. Think contortionists, glass walkers, aerialists and clown burlesque!

The carnival itself is free, but are offering discounted pre-sale tickets for the food and beer pairings, so grab yours today and get ready for the greatest show on earth!

Menu:
Nutty Cheesy Popcorn w/ LM Pilsner

posts.title: Beer Tour – Alameda & San Leandro Breweries
posts.venue: Whole Brew World - Bay Area Brewery Tours
posts.description:
The Blue Collar Beer Tour | Visit Alameda and San Leandro Breweries

There's nothing better than a guided tour where you can check out local breweries, drink amazing beers, meet great people and not have to worry about a thing!

No hard hats required for this tour, but be ready for strong and well-constructed beer flavors. These brewers are brave and hard at work producing some of the most popular craft beers in the country. Honestly, there are seemingly infinite options for every kind of palette. Bring your thirst. You're gonna drink hella beer!

​Included:
- Visit a minimum of 3 breweries
- All of your beer tastings at each brewery
- Complimentary on board snacks and beverages
- Safe and comfortable round-trip transportation for max. of 8 guests
- Professional and friendly guide with beer knowledge
- A brewery facility tour at one stop (if available)
- Gratuity for brewery staff

Pick Up and Drop Off Location:

In front of the fountain at Latham Square Plaza in Oakland, two blocks from 19th Street Bart station. 1615 Broadway, Oakland, CA 94612

There are a few parking garages in the area. Street parking has a 2 hour limit. Public transportation or ride sharing is best. Whole Brew World does not condone drunk driving.

All participants must be at least 21 years old. Advanced reservations are required.

To learn more and book online visit www.wholebrewworld.com/bluecollartour or call 925-725-5029.

posts.title: Celebrator 30th Anniversary Party
posts.description:
The Celebrator Beer News will celebrate its 30th anniversary on Saturday, February 17, 2018, with a Brewer’s party from 4-8 pm at the Trumer Brewery in Berkeley, Calif.

Over 35 other breweries will pour favorite brews as well. Meet Celebrator writers and beer industry luminaries, including pioneer figures in the craft beer movement. Catered food and beer are included! Breweries pouring are listed at celebrator.com.

The event will be one of the closing events of SF Beer Week! Don’t miss it.

FREE SHUTTLE available from the North Berkeley BART Station to the Trumer Brewery in Berkeley.

This event benefits the California Craft Brewers Association, a 501 c6 organization.

posts.title: Fort Point 'East Mission' Cookout & Shandy Throwdown
posts.description:
Fort Point x Junior x Goldbrick Burger presents:

a day of cookin' in with world famous Goldbrick Burger and specialty "shandy" beer cocktail menu showcasing each Fort Point can expression. Join us at our beautiful brand new cocktail bar in the mission, sip some unique beer cocktails, eat some food, get some sun and hang with us into the evening!

posts.title: Bottle Logic + Artifex - Meet the Brewers & Tap Takeover
posts.description: Last big event for the week! We're bringing you Bottle Logic, and Artifex! Both hailing from down south, and trust us, these breweries are not to be missed. We know you're gonna be "beer'd-out" by Saturday, but this is a must. Drink some water, suck it up and come through! full tap takeover from both breweries. bottle / cans to go!

posts.title: Humble Sea Meet the Brewer & Tap Takeover
posts.description: Humble Sea Brewing is taking over our taps! These folks come from sunny Santa Cruz, CA  and are killing the beer scene! super pumped about this. don't sleep on it. drink some beer, meet some people!

posts.title: Maui Brewing Meet the Brewer, Special Barrel Aged Tapping, Beer Cocktails & More
posts.description: Come meet Jess Houck, have a pour of Woodford Reserve Barrel Aged Saint Damien Belgian Dark Strong Ale, Hand Crafted Beer Cocktails with Pineapple Mana Wheat, and another with Coconut Hiwa Porter.  Boilermakers featuring Pau Hana Pilsner, Pineapple Mana Wheat and Coconut Hiwa Porter!

posts.title: 2nd Annual Beer Can Derby
posts.description: No need to be an engineer to build a sick ride that wins this Beer Can Derby.  Bring your imagination; New Belgium Brewing will bring the beer and all the supplies you need to build your car.  If your car's the fastest...you'll win prizes and an amazing trophy!

posts.title: Big Band of Brewers
posts.description:
Join us this Amazing Saturday evening for a brewery collaboration that has never been seen before! We have brewers from all over the city joining the Harmonic house band, composed of Harmonic owners + friends. There will be cover songs galore, and it will be a rocking good time! Come support your favorite brewers and jam out with us!

Music:
Big Band of Brewers 5pm - 8pm
Fogbank Jazz Band 8pm-10pm

posts.title: Firestone Walker Total Tap Takeover
posts.description:
Sycamore closes out another SF Beer Week with what has to be one of our favorite breweries...Firestone Walker!

Dark and Stormy

Agrestic

Bretta Rose
Reginald Brett

...check back as we'll be updating this often

Join us every afternoon during SF Beer Week to help Kick The Keg. The draft beers from the previous night will be 50% off (while supplies last!)

posts.description:
Stone Brewing takes over the bar as part of our San Francisco Beer Week festivities! Free Stone Brewing glassware while supplies last and a free raffle at 7:00 p.m. for an Arrogant Bastard LED, beanies, Berlin Magnum Bottles and specialty glassware.
