posts.title: Berryessa Brewery Tap Takeover
posts.description:
We'll fill out our five taps will all Berryessa beer. This includes something special for you to try.

We're a Mexican Tapas restaurant. We'll have small bites to pair with each beer. Come drink some great beer and eat unique food!

posts.title: Sierra Nevada Closes Out Beer Week at Naked Lunch
posts.description: Sierra Nevada brings their expertly crafted brews to Naked Lunch to help us throw down hard to close out Beer Week '18.  Stuff to drink: Sierraveza Lager, Otra Vez Lime/Agave Gose, Experimental IPA, Nitro Nitro Night Howler Coffee Milk Stout, Baltic Joy Porter, & Barrel Aged Raspberry Bigfoot.

posts.title: Mraz Brewing Tap Takeover
posts.description: Meet the brewers from Mraz Brewing Company and see what special limited beers ON TAP we've got for you.

posts.title: North Coast Brewing Tap Takeover & Dinner
posts.description:
Bully is bringing the beer and our Chef John is making the sausages!

North Coast has crushed it this last year with limited releases and new beers, and Chef John will be using the beers and produce from the North Coast Brewing Gardens to bring it all together!

This promises to be a delicious evening!

posts.title: HazeFest II
posts.description:
Bring on the Hazy Pales and IPAs...and why not a hazy hoppy sour or two! At ODM we love the hazy hop trend and typically have a couple of those pale, fruity, dank, cloudy, low-bitterness IPAs on draft. For HazeFest we're going all in, tapping a slew of ultra-fresh hoppy beers for you to enjoy and compare.

The initial tap list is sick!

1) Sante Adairius - Exclamation Mark: Enigma! DIPA - 8% ABV - super hazy DIPA with Citra, Centennial, & a big dose of Enigma

2) The Booth - EurekaSeoul IPA - 6.5% ABV - New England style IPA made with loads of Citra hops

3) Barebottle - Doom Bloom 2018 Triple IPA - 10.4% ABV - super hazy and juicy TIPA, special once a year release

4) Phantom Carriage - Super Dry Hopped Broadacres - 4.2% ABV - PC's house berliner weisse dry hopped with a ton of Simcoe

5) Freewheel - Old Devil Hands Gold - 4.1% - custom made *cask* of English pale ale with dry hopping and buddha's hand citrus

6) Sixpoint - Hootie Hoo Hazy Pale Ale - 5.4% ABV - hazy pale ale hopped with Amarillo, Citra, & Centennial

7) Epic Brewing - New England Style IPA - 7% ABV - hazy single hop IPA

8) Henhouse - Big Chicken 2018 Imperial IPA - 10% ABV - once a year special SFBW release!

9) Drake's - Hopocalypse Black Label Triple IPA - 12.5% ABV - massive once a year release TIPA w/ Warrior, Jarrylo, Polaris, Cascade, El Dorado, Idaho #7, Pekko, Simcoe, & Amarillo

10) Laughing Monk - Bayview Hazy Pomegranate IPA - 7% ABV - fruited hazy IPA

11) Temescal - Wonder Why IPA - 6.5% ABV - hazy IPA w/ Simcoe, Citra, & Loral hops

12) Grimm - Galaxy Pop! - 4.8% ABV - Dry hopped Berliner Weisse w/ galaxy hops, vanilla, & milk sugar

13) Monkey Paw - Pineapple X-Press Piña Colada IPA - 6.2% - super fruity hazy IPA with pineapple

14) FDR - Juicy Beast IPA - 7.3% ABV - hazy IPA w/ Citra, Mosaic, & El Dorado hops, fermented w/ Vermont yeast

15) Dogfish Head - 120 Minute IPA - 18% ABV - it may not be hazy, but it's a classic BEAST level IPA

16) Freewheel - English IPA - 5.2% - on cask, a special one-off dry hopped English IPA

Good stuff to know:

~~ ODM is open for HazeFest II at 11AM and we aren't shutting it down until 2AM

~~ ODM's Black Magic Beerunch menu will be happening from 11AM to 3PM, with our regular menu in effect from 6PM to midnight. We're thinking we'll grill Coney Dogs on the patio during the 3 hour gap from 3-6PM

~~ We aim to tap several beastly dark barrel aged options remaining on draft from our "Whales of the Deep" event the night prior, plus we'll be sure to have several hazy dry hopped sours!

posts.title: Twisted Tasting
posts.description:
It's time to GET DOWN and BOOGIE for another TWISTED TASTING! CAN YOU DIG IT?

You know what that means... the craziest, flavor bending, once in a lifetime creations from your local brewers, cidermakers, distillers, and food artisans. But that's not all. As usual, we've got some surprises in store for you that will not just tingle your tastebuds but blow you away. This year, think Studio 54 and dress to impress. C'mon you hep cats, this is one event that you don't want to miss. In conjunction with SF Beer Week 2018 - Twisted Tasting is an event like none other.

Twisted Tasting is a benefit for the Arts Council of Santa Cruz County. Since 1979 the Arts Council has fueled and supported the unique, ever-evolving Santa Cruz County arts ecosystem. They're a private, non-profit agency made up of a staff, board, and volunteers dedicated to strengthening our Santa Cruz community through the arts.

posts.title: Dustbowl vs Barrel Brothers
posts.description: Come meet the brewers and enjoy our Tap Takeover as Dust Bowl Brewing Co. and Barrel Brothers Brewing Co. go head to head.

posts.title: Mystery Event
posts.description: Join us for our 2nd annual Mystery Night Event.  Last year we had a voodoo inspired ice cream and beer pairing.  What are we doing this year?  The only way to find out is to join us, the only thing we can say is that we'll have lots and lots of beer on tap for the night.

posts.title: Barebottle Home Brewer's Competition
posts.description: Cato's Ale House has a special Beer Week treat for you! Join us and Barebottle as we host their 2nd Home Brewer's Competition! This time around 2 Bay Area Home Brewers will brew their own Pale Ale recipe and you cast your vote for your favorite. The winner will become the next Barebottle Pale Ale! In addition, we'll also be carrying several other Barebottle beers. Cheers!

posts.description:
Say the words beer & San Diego and any beer geek worth her chops will have visions of hops and malts and barley (oh my!), so we're dedicating a night to the best of SD.

posts.description: This is the 3rd year we have asked local Bay Area aerialists to come and display their amazing high-flying skills right in the brewery. Check out a "Cirque Du Soleil style" show at Ale Industries complete with stage lighting, music, food trucks, and beer. Last year we had a huge turnout and expect the same this year!

posts.title: It Came From The Wood: A Barrel Aged Festival
posts.description:
Come on out to The Jug Shop for our annual "It Came From The Wood" barrel aged beer tasting. We will be pouring over 120 barrel aged beers from around the world. Expect representations from Cantillon, Drie Fontienen, Rare Barrel, Jester King, Jackie O's, Prairie and so much more. Your ticket includes unlimited pours of some of the best beer in the world as well as some cheese and snacks to cleanse your palate. We will also have a food truck (or two) in our parking lot for something more substantial. Along with all the amazing beer to sample, we will be offering large discounts on all of our vintage beer through all of beer week. This makes it a great time to re-stock your cellar (or your refrigerator). This event sells out every year and is limited to the first 100 people. Don't delay and get your tickets today. posts.title: Barrel-Aged Love
posts.description: We love barrel-aged beers and we aren't afraid to show it. Dedicating eight taps (that's 1/3 of them!) to Barrel-Aged beers for one night. Have a favorite? Come and see if it makes our list.

posts.title: Kombucha Detox
posts.description: Repent, indulgent imbibers! Exorcise your Beer Week demons with a day of purifying probiotics and some of our house made kombucha.

posts.title: 2nd Annual Benoit-Casper Homebrew Competition
posts.description:
It’s that time of year again, SFBW! And your club is invited to the most popular event (besides the gala that is) the 2nd Annual BC Homebrew Competition! Last year, Queers Makin’ Beers won it all with their Yaaasss Kolsch. Who will run away with it this year?

Compete with your homebrew club and come prepared with the gear and ingredients necessary to brew a batch onsite that you think can hold its own and reign supreme. Please allow your team to have enough time to set-up, brew, and pack up.

Take your beer home, ferment and bottle them, then bring your masterpiece back to the brewery five weeks later to be judged by a BJCP judged panel. We will then hold an awards ceremony where your beers will be put on display for guests to taste and rate for an additional "peoples choice" award.

Important Dates:
Entry submission window March 15 to April 1, 2018
Closed session judging will be held April 5, 2018
Awards Ceremony held April 7, 2018

If your club’s beer is crowned the champion, not only will you get a trophy and bragging rights, we will also host your club at the brewery to replicate and scale it up for production to be sold at our brewery and locally on tap! But wait, there's more....

Our friends at Freewheel are hosting a similar competition and after the winners' beers are scaled up for production, we are going to have a Best of the Bay showdown! (Date TBA)

This event is Rain or Shine so please be prepared and bring all the necessary equipment (IE Rain Jackets, 10x10 Pop-up Tents, etc). Please let us know in advance if you need any assistance in this department.

--

Who can compete?

Homebrewers! Official clubs get preference but all are encouraged to participate until our limit of 20 clubs/teams is reached. There is a $40 entry fee per club that helps us cover operational costs and includes 2 drink tickets and 2 food vouchers. Please feel free to bring your family and friends as this is a fun, all-day event filled with beer, games, music, food, and good company.

--

Specialty Beer Week Collaboration Beer Releases:

Origin Brewing, Scottish Wee-Heavy
Good Hop, Black Rye IPA
Barclays, IPA
Special NEIPA can release collaboration with Morgan Territory and Hop Dogma

--

FAQ:

Will I have access to water?

Yes, you will have access to water to brew with, for your chillers, and for any other purpose! Please bring your own hoses.

Will I have access to electricity?

Yes, there will be electricity on-site to run your pumps or any other small devices. Please bring your own extension cords.

How long will I have to brew?

You will have from 9am-5pm, please plan your brew accordingly!

What styles can I brew?

You can brew any 2015 BJCP style you’d like although we would discourage lagers due to the short time from brew to bottle. Please keep in mind that your beer needs to be bottled and submitted for judging by April 1, no fooling!

This year we are limiting the number of clubs entering to 20. If this is something that seems of interest to you, please don’t hesitate to RSVP by 2/15. Spots will be reserved on a first come, first serve basis and official clubs will have priority over "teams". For more information check out our official SFBW listing AND please don’t hesitate to reach out to us with any questions at info@bcbrewing.com (please include "ATTN: SFBW Competition" in the subject line)

Thank you and we look forward to seeing you there! 🍻

posts.title: Bay Area Sour Showcase
posts.description:
20 taps full of sours! All local. Brunch served til 3pm. Dinner served til 11pm. Sours served til midnight!

Flights available

posts.title: End of Beer Week Brunch
posts.description:
End of Beer Week brunch is here to nurse your hangover, and give you enough energy for the final day. The greatest thing about it, we serve it all day long! No need to rush out of bed.

Beer, Mimosas, & Mocktails

Menu:
Beer Focused Special Dish TBA

Winter Hash- Braised pork, butternut squash, red onion, swiss chard, brussel sprouts, red potato, sweet potato, and two eggs. (vegetarian option available)

Benedict Sandwich- Ham, bacon, two fried eggs, green onion, a garlic Tabasco aioli, and hollandaise on ciabatta. Served with roasted potatoes

All-American- Two eggs your way, bacon, house-made maple pork sausage, roasted potatoes, toast and jam.

Avocado Toast- Smashed avocado, feta cheese, butternut squash, green onion, pea shoots, & a poached egg on toasted sourdough.

Cinnamon Toast Bites- Texas toast bites with cinnamon, nutmeg, and an orange-vanilla-maple-cream cheese dipping sauce.

Fried Chicken Biscuits & Gravy- Fried chicken with a house-made sausage gravy over two honey biscuits and a fried egg.

posts.title: Yoga and Beer
posts.description:
Life is all about balance. Come undo some of the damage done the night before with a little yoga and beer!

Your morning will start in our taproom with an awesome, 90 minute Bhakti yoga session suitable for all levels led by instructor Armando Luna.

After yoga is over head to the bar for your cool down. With 16 beers to choose from, there is sure to be something to quench everyone's thirst.

Follow the link for exclusive discounted presale tickets, otherwise walk-ins are also welcome, just pay $15 after yoga when you grab your beer.

Namaste and #LaughOn

posts.title: Beers for the Bayview - Street Cleaning + Free BBQ and Beer
posts.description:
To celebrate the conclusion of what has likely been a week long of debauchery for SF Beer Week we are going to do our part to help clean up the Bayview.

On our first cleanup we removed over 3400 pounds of garbage from the Bayview State Park and are hoping to bump that number to 5000 pounds this time!

We will be cleaning the Bayview State park and surrounding blocks from 10am-12pm and will be holding a free bbq with beers for all of the volunteers afterwards at the distillery.

Hope to see you all there!

posts.title: Sunday Brunch
posts.description: If you like mimosas but don’t want to commit to champagne, then you are in for a treat! We will be serving beermosas and 2 other brunch cocktail inspired sours during Sunday Brunch at our Tasting Room & Kitchen. We are adjusting our hours from 11AM to 5PM so that you can wind down from a fun and busy SF Beer Week by enjoying a beermosa and some of our brunch-inspired dishes from our kitchen. If you weren’t able to try any of the beer from our events during the week or want to get another chance to grab a glass of something that was offered during one of these events, Sunday Brunch will be your last chance to try some of these amazing guest beers. We’re not sure what will be on tap yet but our draft list will be updated on site throughout the day.

posts.title: Sierra Nevada Beer Brunch
posts.description: Finish your Beer Week off right with Sunday Services at Sacrilege. Chef Santi will be crafting up some irreverent breakfast items to pair with some hard to find, one of a kind Sierra brews.  Sarah "Nevada" will be here in person tempting you with education + schwag.  No RSVP required.  First come, first served.

posts.title: Brewers Sunday Tea with SF OG Brewers Collab Release Party
posts.description:
Join us in our Beer Garden for live music, beer and BBQ! We will be grilling our in-house beer sausages (made with our Strong Beer Month beers) with special 21A beers on tap, and our favorite brews from some of our SF Brewers Guild friends.

We'll also showcase our Strong Ale collaboration beer with the 2001 SF brewers that were depicted in the "last supper" painting done by Tobias Freccia and hanging in our SF pub.

Enjoy "OG SF Brewers Collab" a strong ale and meet the brewers from the early days of Bay Area craftbeer with Dave McLean (Magnolia). Ron Silberstein (Thirsty Bear), Scott Turnnidge (formerly of Beach Chalet) Steve Ryan (formerly of Gordon Biersch/SF), Mellissa Myers (the Good Hop and formerly of Magnolia), Mike Pawlicki (journeyman brewer), Nico Freccia (21A), Frank Commanday (formerly of E&O Trading Company) James Renfrew (formerly of Potrero Brewing Co) and Andy French (formerly of Speakeasy)

posts.title: Sour Sunday
posts.description: Crazy about sours and disappointed that most restaurants and bars only have one or at most two sours on draft? Join us for six sours on tap at once! Try flights of three so you can try all six. We'll be featuring our favorites from Almanac, Hermitage, CaliCraft and more!

posts.title: IPA Day
posts.description: Almost every beer on draft will be an IPA, DIPA or TIPA. Featuring the infamous Pliny The Younger from Russian River.

posts.title: Field Works
posts.description:
Join us as we feature one of our favorite breweries: Fieldwork's. We will be pouring several of their IPA's including:
Pulp
East Side Motel
Wax
Nine Trizzay
Hazy Glue

posts.title: Chilaquiles & Chill
posts.description: Whew, we’ve done it--we’ve survived another Beer Week! Nurse your week-long hangover with Canasta Kitchen’s ridiculously tasty chilaquiles, and enjoy one last round of our special Beer Week brews before giving your liver a well-deserved rest. Kids, dogs, and well-behaved adults are all welcome as we wind down after a long week of beer-centric celebrations.

posts.title: Kombucha Detox & Yoga
posts.description: Need even more of a refresh after a busy, beery week? Squeeze out those toxins in an all-levels yoga class with Atma Yoga, then rehydrate with a fizzy, friendly glass of chakra-aligning kombucha.

posts.title: All Day Sour Day
posts.description: Since sours are so popular and have so many variances we celebrate this style twice.  We will have some of the same, but many different sours than the Sours, Barrel Aged, and Mussels Day (see Feb. 11).

posts.title: Beer Brunch
posts.description:
It's beer week and we got what you need to start the day with your best foot forward; Beer Brunch!

Our amazing brunch-only chef Becca will be cooking up the goods including a 48 hour semolina pancake that will knock your socks off, and her tasty Shakshuka among a bunch of other offerings.

We'll have a great lineup of our own beers plus the best gosh darn bloody mary you've ever had made our infamous bartender Janio.

Full menu here:
https://www.socialkitchenandbrewery.com/

posts.title: IPA Sunday
posts.description: Wrap up Beer Week with a few pints of crisp, refreshing ale. We'll fill as many taps as we can with all manner of IPA, from hazy to triple. Breweries include Alvarado Street, Cellarmaker, Fieldwork, Moonraker, Revision and more.

posts.title: Low and Slow – A Sunday Rib Cookout
posts.description:
Beer Week is a marathon, not a sprint, so we’re keeping it easy like Sunday morning as we cross the finish line. Come join us and Smokin’ Woods BBQ for a laid-back rib cookout on the patio, complete with a DJ spinning soul classics on vinyl.

Your ticket ($30/presale, $35/door) buys a full plate of ribs, sides, and a pint of any draft on our list to wash it down.

Come unwind with friends, or lay down a solid base before you finish strong at the 10th annual Celebrator Beer Fest! We’re right around the corner from MacArthur BART, only three stops away from the shuttle at North Berkeley station.

posts.title: Grillin’ & Chillin’: Family Affair
posts.description: Celebrate the end of SF Beer Week insanity with the entire Drake’s family. Our sister breweries, Triple Rock Brewing and Jupiter, will be in the house with beer on tap. Bring your family to toss some corn hole, play board games, or just chill in our Adirondack chairs. The event will also include our own Papa Roy, Drake’s co-owner Roy Kirkorian, who will be serving up his famous Tri-tip. New SF Beer Week releases will be on draft alongside your favorite Drake’s flagship brews. Come by any time!

posts.title: Firkin & Donut Fest
posts.description:
Time flies when you're drinking beer!

As #SFBeerWeek2018 comes to a close, join us for one final hurrah. We will be tapping an assortment of firkins curated by Brother Austin -- so come prepared for some interesting combinations.

And what would a lazy Sunday be without some sweet treats? Enjoy a free donut with your beer purchase while listening to the whimsical musical stylings of Polythene Pam!

Lastly, we'll be offering a killer crowler deal you won't want to miss. Come grab any 3 crowlers (Barrel Aged excluded) for $25 to take home with you for the week ahead. So much beer, so little time.

posts.title: Food Truck Bonanza - Slider & Tot Fest
posts.description:
What better way to end Beer Week than with a Slider and Tot Festival?

We'll be opening up our back lot for 3 of our favorite food trucks (Izzy's Cheesesteaks, Jackrabbit and Mobowl), which will each be serving up a slider and tot-filled menu.

We'll be crowning our People's Choice favorite (slider & tot) and washing it all down with our favorite Barebottle beer's of the week. Come wind down with us!

posts.title: SFBW Bazaar and Mural Unveiling with Eagle Rock and Social Kitchen
posts.description:
Each month Lost and Found hosts a free, all-ages bazaar to support our community of artists and creative types.

As usual there will be local vendors, showcasing a variety of goods (think; hand-made jewelry, ceramics, clothing, collector books, vintage items and oddities, accessories of all types, body and home goods, vintage clothing and wares, and more fun stuff like that). Given that this month's Bazaar falls on the final day of SF Beer Week we are adding a special twist....

Two of our favorite breweries will be joining us:

-- Social Kitchen and Brewery is out of San Francisco's Sunset District and brewmaster Kim Sturdavant is the brewer of our most popular beer here, "The Smell" IPA.

-- Eagle Rock Brewing Company was among the first to open of the recent brewing boom in and around Los Angeles, CA. We have carried Eagle Rock beers here at Lost and Found ever since they first became available in the Bay! Owners Jeremy Raub and Ting Su will be joining us on the 18th as well.

In addition to their wonderful beers we've asked one more thing of each brewery. Both Social and Eagle Rock have selected a favorite artisan to be one of our vendors at the Bazaar.

Eagle Rock has invited famed visual artist and muralist Olive47 - olive47.com/olea/art/ - who will not only exhibit her work, but also we have commissioned Olive47 to do a mural on one of our exterior walls which will be unveiled at the event!

Social has selected Kendama USA ambassador Jake Weins https://vimeo.com/80116627. Jake is a traveling competitor and evangelist for Kendama. Kendama is a Japanese variation on the class ball-and-cup game you may have played as a child. The game is currently enjoying an international explosion in popularity. Jake has his own signature model Kendamas he will be exhibiting as well as offering free lessons to guests of all ages.

Please join us Sunday, February 18th for a shopping and kick-it experience like no other. Our expansive, lush garden is the perfect setting for these artists to showcase their wares. You can peruse all their goodies with beer in hand, feeling good about your purchases while keeping your money local. THANK YOU for supporting those that do what they love. :-)

If you're interested in participating as a vendor, please email events@lostandfound510.com.

posts.title: Bob’s Donuts & Beer
posts.description: Donuts and beer? Nope — donuts *in* beer. That’s right: we’ve brewed another batch of our epic Belgian Quad, flavored to pair with Bob’s famous apple fritters.

posts.description:

posts.title: Blind Tiger Day
posts.description: We put aside one keg just for today. 10 oz pour for only $5 until the keg runs out.

posts.title: Tropi-Calicraft Beer & Island Food Festival
posts.description:
Get ready to taste the tropics!

Calicraft Brewing Company is excited to bring sweet sunshine and fruity pacific flavors to a grey San Francisco February for SF Beer Week! Say aloha to the Tropi-Calicraft Beer & Island Food Festival – a celebration of tropical beers, killer eats, and island vibes.

Sit back and relax while your tastebuds surf the brew-tastic waves of sours, citruses, and tropical flavors from Calicraft's new "Fruit Trees" inspired beer series. Once your feelin’ the island breeze (and buzz), dive into a sea of some of the best Bay Area Hawaiian, Filipino, and seafood trucks! Hawaiian shirts recommended.

CALICRAFT BEERS
Guava Trees Sparkling Wheat Ale
Raspberry Trees Sparkling Wheat Ale
Passion Fruit Trees Sparkling Wheat Ale
Karl the Foggier Tropical IIPA
The City IPA with Mango
Cucumber Kolsch
Barrel Project: Sour Hibiscus and Chamomile

posts.title: Kick the Keg Closing Party - 1/2 Off SFBW Drafts
posts.description:
Come by for a Sunday to remember while you help us kick our beer week kegs. Get 50% off all full size pours all day and night long!

Plus, you kick it, you pick it -- whoever kicks the keg gets to pick the next up from a huge array of Beer Week beers.

posts.title: Beer Judging 101
posts.description:
Beer Tasting and Judging class, with Grand Master Beer Judge David Teckam.

Prerequisites: None. This class is intended mainly for non-judges who have some amount of casual tasting experience, and an interest in craft beer and world beer styles.

Instructor: David Teckam, BJCP Grand Master V ranked Beer Judge and beer educator, assisted by Master level BCJP judge and homebrew competition organizer, Brian Cooper.

What separates a truly world class brew from a run of the mill beer?

Beer Judging 101 is an introduction to the critical tasting and describing of beer. Expand your evaluative, perceptive, and descriptive ability, while sampling some unique and world class beers. We'll compare and contrast different beers, talking about the ingredients and processes that go into them, and discuss the resulting flavors, body and aromas in the beer. You will be shown how to approach a beer from a judge's perspective, learning some practical tasting skills, as well as terms for discussing the various flavors, aromas and other attributes of the beer.

In addition to learning about judging, we will also discuss world beer styles and their evolution, and how they fit into recognized historic styles. You will learn a bit about what constitutes an award-winning example of a style, and gain some experience detecting and identifying defects or style deficiencies. We will also touch upon the effects of aging on beer. For those interested in taking it a step further, we will share some information about joining the BJCP (Beer Judge Certification Program).

Price: $30 includes all beers and materials. Purchase tickets early to ensure a spot.

Venue: The Banquet room at the HopYard Alehouse & Grill in Pleasanton, CA. For more info about our host, visit: http://www.hopyard.com/#alehousegrill.

Use of public transit, cab, and/or designated drivers is highly recommended. The venue is reasonably close to the Dublin / Pleasanton BART Station (easy cab / Uber ride, or ~15 minutes by bike).

posts.title: Bye Bye SF Beer Week

posts.title: Mission Kolsch 5K
posts.description: Join us for our first Mission Kolsch Run!  We'll be burning off all of the beers from Beer Week by racing around the Mission drinking beers.  Race starts at 1pm from the brewery and hits Rosamunde, Pop's Bar, Mission Bowling Club, and Southpaw BBQ for a half pint of Kolsch at each before finishing back at SDB.  Prizes for all entries, better prizes for top three finishers!  email mark@standarddeviantbrewing.com to register

posts.description: We've saved the best for last - Four hours of face melting Metal from DJ Issa featuring the best of Black Metal, Sludge, Thrash, Grindcore, and Heavy Metal classics demonically paired with the darkest and heaviest beers around. Featuring tons of barrel aged and imperial stouts/porters from our favorite breweries including: Perennial, Modern Times, The Bruery, Jester King & many more! Stay tuned for the draft list!
posts.admission: FREE to attend - Drink Tickets & Tokens Package Available

posts.title: $5 Kick the Keg Party
posts.description:
Sick of beer yet? We're not! Help us knock these kegs the f out! We're doing $5 full size pours *all day.* That means $5 pints of normal beers like hazy IPAs and $5 for 10oz pours for the extra fancy stuff like sours and barrel aged beasts. We'll be doing Black Magic Sunday Brunch from 11am to 3pm and the regular dinner menu from 6pm to 10pm. We've lined up over 80 kegs of sours, hazy IPAs, and BA stouts for SF Beer Week and there will be *plenty* left for Sunday!

~~ LIQUOR! We're comfortable saying that ODM is one of the best, if not the very best, beer bar in SF that also has the hard stuff. If you happen to be sick of beer, or your friend/significant other/mom isn't into beer, bring them in for a Bloody Mary, Mai Tai, Old Fashioned, Negroni, shot of Fernet Francisco, or whatever cocktail tickles their spirit!

~~ ODM is open from 11AM to Midnight on Sundays. Our Black Magic Brunch menu will be in effect from 11AM to 3PM, with our regular menu going from 6PM to 10PM.

~~ All full sized pours of beer *on all 20 taps,* tons of goodies left over from our SFBW events, will be just $5!

~~ No 4oz pours today, it's all about knocking these kegs the f out!

~~ ODM has a full calendar of 9 awesome SF Beer Week events, including our Sour Sh!tstorm, Sour Sunday Brunch, Fat Tuesday, Whales of the Deep, and HazeFest II! See the deets for all of them here: https://www.facebook.com/pg/olddevilmoonSF/events

Whether or not you're sick of beer yet by the time this final Sunday of SFBW rolls around, we've got you very much covered! See ya soon!

Follow us on Facebook for more details, including the breweries and the beers they will be featuring at this event.

posts.title: Lemon Kush - Tequila Barrel Aged Wild Gose Bottle Release
posts.description: Join us for a very limited bottle release of Lemon Kush, a spontaniously fermented wild lemon gose aged in tequila barrels. Limit 2 per person. Food provided by My Mom's Mole

posts.title: Temescal Beers and Bites
posts.description:
Dive deeply into the Bay Area’s most blowing up breweries, local beer, and food. The Temescal Beers and Bites walking (and drinking) food tour focuses on craft beer. Guests will sample two to three fresh beer tastes at four stops, and have the option to buy additional Pilsners, Saisons, Kolsches, Dubbels, and IPAs as they roam.

Food tastes may include beer-friendly charcuterie, pizza, gourmet popcorn, garlic “bombs”, and an inspired craft root beer float. Stops are subject to change, but may include Rose’s Taproom, a shiny new taproom gem in the heart of the district, Hogs Apothecary, a neighborhood pub and taproom sporting at least 33 California craft beers and a snout-to-tail approach to food, Temescal Brewing, the first commercial microbrewery in the neighborhood, Arthur Mac’s Tap and Snack, an outdoor beer garden and eatery footsteps from MacArthur BART, and Lanesplitter Pizza, a classic spot for craft beer and food.

Use code BEER20 for a 20% discount!

posts.title: Tag + Jug Cider Special Releases & Tap Takeover
posts.description:
Come join us for a night with San Francisco's acclaimed Tag + Jug Cider Co. and its founder Aaron Bryan. San Francisco's only cidery, produces artisanal barrel-fermented ciders aged in French Oak. They craft their ciders like wine, inspired by the old time art of producing traditional American ciders.

Come check out some of the incredible blend releases we'll be featuring that night.

*Brut Cider - blend of five apples pressed into old French Oak Barrels where it fermented (to complete dryness) and aged for three months before being kegged unfined and unfiltered.

*Rosé du Cidre - blend of Divergent Vine Russian River Rosé of Zinfandel and Brut Cider aged together for five months in French Oak barrels.

*Flora - blend of Conduit Amador Co. Viognier and Brut Cider aged in old French Oak barrels.

*West of Eden - last year's SF Beer Week Southpaw BBQ & Brewery and Tag + Jug malted cider collaboration. Southpaw's barleywine malt blended with Tag + Jug fresh pressed cider juice and co-fermented in Cabernet Franc barrels.

*Flanders Noir - this year's Tag + Jug SF Beer Week malted cider collaboration with Southpaw BBQ and Standard Deviant. A base brown ale malt was blended with Conduit Pinot Noir and cider juice, co-fermented in old French Oak barrels with brown sugar.
